description:
Okay Perry's... I really do like you. Honestly, you can't go wrong with this place. Is their food out of this world? No. Is it good and convenient? Yes. I come here often on Thursday nights for half price bottles of wine- they are one of the only
Places in SF that does this and they have a pretty great wine list. They have four tables outside that are dog friendly and have amazing people watching. Part of me hates saying that because I don't want more people to take my table on Thursday nights! 

Must haves: buffalo tenders w/ ranch, Cobb salad with buffalo sauce on the side (I promise it's good), sweet potato fries and the chili. 

I'm only docking them from their five stars because service is totally hit or miss. Some nights I have amazing service, and some nights it's incredibly slow. Also their Sunday brunch is just okay- and the service is never good then, so don't be in any hurry when you're there. 

The entire month of August 2018 they have half price bottles of wine to celebrate their anniversary!
author: Morgan J.

description:
We sat outside and enjoyed the sun in San Francisco while enjoying a Moscow Mule. This was a great place to people watch and grab a snack. 

We will be back!
author: Wendy C.

description:
First time visiting this place. Waiter and waitress are super friendly and nice. The atmosphere is really cozy, and the music is not too loud. Food we ordered was pot roast, and it was really good. Beef was juicy and tender, and the mashed potato was fluffy and soft. Although we didn't ask, but the waitress nicely helped us to split the dish for two because we were sharing the food. 

Overall, very relaxing bar and good food, and welcoming environment. Recommend!! :)
author: Gatsby Y.

description: Absolutely a great place.. food.. service.. ambiance..fun!
author: Shirley J.

description:
A proper pub that serves decent food and drink and appears to cater to a slightly more mature and well-behaved crowd than might otherwise be the case in this often douchetastic neighborhood. 

The first thing you see upon entering the venue is the long, wooden bar with plenty of places to sit. There are also plenty of tables along the side, and there are also two rooms in the rear that can be used as extra dining space or for private functions.

The food is typical pub fare - salads, sandwiches, burgers, and modest entrees - but the serving sizes and overall quality are quite decent for what you're paying. There's also an extensive selection of boozy items, whether a nicely curated wine list, a fair amount of craft beers, or any number of cocktails.

Service is friendly, fast, and professional here, and this is a perfect spot for unpretentious groups large and small. If you're looking for some place reasonably sophisticated in the general vicinity, this is a solid bet.
author: Vincent L.

description:
The wait staff here is excellent so I don't like to hold it against them for the rating. The cooks really seem to know what they're doing as well because the pot roast I had was amazing, not a dry bite I the whole dish, the mashed potatoes were extra fluffy and flavorful and the broccoli had a flavor all it's open.
The issues I have with this place are that the cooks are clearly under utilized by such a lackluster menu that rivals that of the most common restaurant available. The portions appear small for the price. I felt that 20$ a dish for these portions were not appropriate.
All in all, it's a decent place to eat but for the price and with the menu options and it feeling a bit cramped for the seating, it loses some points there that could've made this place a 5/5 if they utilized the wait staff and cooks to their dull potential.
author: Anthony S.

description:
We wanted something fairly healthy for dinner after celebrating a friend's birthday earlier. A friend suggested this place so we decided to give it a try!

6 of us got here a little before 6. The front of the restaurant was full so we were seated in the back, under the pretty glass ceiling sunroom area. 

All of us either ordered a salad or the Grilled Salmon ($21). One ordered a Grilled BLTA and another shared an order of Buffalo Wings. I had the salmon and it was delicious! The salmon was tender and sat on a bed of quinoa with pesto sauce. I believe everyone enjoyed their food! I also had a glass of the rose and they complimented each other well. 

I'm pleasantly surprised by this place as it felt a bit touristy. However, I'm glad we gave this place a try. It seems that they also have other locations in the city so I will probably try this place again in the future!
author: Alice L.

description: A great classic San Francisco spot with terrific food, attentive service and wonderful atmosphere.  Petrale sole was heavenly, penne pasta fabulous and salads were fresh and perfect.  Our server was professional, attentive and cheerful.  Great libations, especially the Irish coffee.  If you want a place to enjoy a relaxed and delicious evening, come to Perry's!
author: Phyllis S.

description: I have ordered delivery from here a few times. They have this grilled salmon dish that I love. It comes with delicious sides and it's just perfect. I would give five stars just for that. But today I decided to try some of their other menu items and I'm super bummed because they are garbage. The buffalo tenders are somehow soggy and tough at the same time. Sauce is not flavorful, it's just hot. I've only eaten three and twice I've bitten down on something crunchy or hard that I had to spit out, it's full of cartilage and tendons. Clean your chicken properly, dang. These buffalo tenders are so bad I couldn't even finish them. More than half just went in the trash. The mac and cheese was edible but underwhelming. Needs seasoning, and aside from a sprinkling of breadcrumbs on top, it's basically indistinguishable from the frozen kind. So, only three stars. Would give one star if not for the delicious salmon dish.
author: Traci R.

description:
Preface with the fact that we only had Perry's Bloody Marys and the Grilled Artichoke appetizer. 

The Grilled Artichoke was fantastic!! The Bloody Marys were good for the $8 price but lacked any garnishes like celery and olives which can really add to it.

Our server was very attentive. However the space towards the back of the bar is tight with tables really close to each other.
author: Mary B.

description: 3 stars it is! The food is just mediocre nothing to really write home about. The service however was great! The hostess was welcoming our server Flo was on her stuff! Food was prepared right and. Portions were good. The location is super cute!! Lots to do.
author: Angie R.

description:
Not sure why some reviews are not glowing. Had lunch there today with
two other people. Chopped salad, Cobb salad, and a hamburger.
service was spot on!! Portions were large and all tasted excellent. My
hamburger was cooked just right. Will definitely go back again.
author: Peter F.

description: Rumor has it, Perry's has extended their 50% off bottles of wine deal from just Monday's and Thursday's to the entire month of August 2018 to celebrate 50 years in business (at least for the Union St location). I've always thought their food was mediocre - except for the sweet potato fries and buffalo tenders, but I love good deal on alcohol (and their wine list is decent) away from most of the Marina bros so I keep coming back, on Thursday's. If you're looking for a spot to post up outside with your dog or daily specials, Perry's is your spot. If you're looking for decent artichokes, custom salad orders, or even good barbecue sauce, look elsewhere. The service is great, but only at night. Sit at the bar or outside. The back room is weird.
author: Erin M.

description:
Perry's is a nice establishment with many spaces to dine in including a bar, main room, sun room and back back room. We had a ZPPR lunch that was cute. Our friend Stephen joined us for some good laughs. 

They are really good about substitutions on the menu and even add kalamata olives. The Arnold Palmer will please.
author: Zak R.

description: Their chopped salad is my favorite salad ever. Good food, friendly staff and all-around good vibes. One of my neighborhood go-to spots, never disappoints.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I ate there 7 April 2018 19:30 with a delightful waiter. The burger was one of the best I have ever had.
Problem was a rat ran across the dining room floor as we were eating! Everyone in the restaurant saw it. Waiter apologized. Not sure if we should have just gotten up and left. The rat ran from the rear to the front and then turned around running back again. I feel bad as this could be a one off. All restaurants struggle with pests but this was outrageous. I hope they fix the problem like right away. I am more forgiving than some people.
author: Andreas M.

description:
Update: spoke too soon, ratings back down. The ribs were so dry we didn't eat them. Dry, tough, no sauce, gamey smell. Inedible. Plus, they kept putting the ribs over the fries, so they're all soggy and covered in sauce.

Ratings are back up because food seems too have improved, in particular the ribs. Those ribs! Please keep them in the menu  Whether we eat them in the restaurant or have them delivered, they're great! BBQ, thankfully not smoked. Tons of tender meat & great sauce. So ribs, chili, fries, salad and salmon (on salad)are worth the trip.
author: Nancy R.

description: My wife and I had a lovely dinner there with a waiter that was attentive and ensured our dining experience was wholesome. Highly recommend?
author: James L.

description: Solid.  We needed a filling meal, good service and an iconic SF locale and we got it.
author: Peggy S.

description: When I picture myself eating in San Francisco, this is what I envision. We ate here at the recommendation of a "local" who said Perry's was an Institution.  We were seated at one of the tables on the sidewalk and really enjoyed eating our lunch while watching the people stroll up and down Union.  The menu has a nice selection and the food was very good. The service and the atmosphere was fantastic. Bonus...while walking to the restaurant we ran into Joe Montana and his wife!  That was fun.
author: Tom M.

description: Came here on 2 separate occassions and the food is just not spectacular at all. Incredibly bland and flavorless. Service and atmosphere are great however.
author: Johnny M.

description: Ian is very disrespectful he needs to get fired asap, doesn't know how to do his job, argue and fights with customers and is clearly in a bad mood
author: Mike Y.

description: Perry's was the premiere restaurant as I used to frequent often in the 90's and early 2000's.  It has lost its luster. We were greeted with a smile but that was the highlight. The initial service was very timely. The grilled artichoke was chewy and lacked meatiness. The pulled pork lacked flavor and the salad didn't come with dressing. The Thursday special (prime rib sandwich) was very tasty and had good depth of flavors thus getting the second star. The busboy was attentive keeping beverages full and clearing our plates. Also, the attentive hostess noticed our table waiting for nearly 8-10 minutes for the bill and went to the back to find our server who then promptly came.
author: Jason B.

description: In the past my wife and I had a decent meal here and decided to try it again for dinner after a long absence. We arrived at 8:00p and by 9:00p walked out very dissatisfied. The little food and drink we tried was poor, and the service which started strong went quite bad. To start, the breadsticks were quite stale and the iced tea was watered down. I started with a mixed green salad and asked for the extra blue cheese dressing. The greens were somewhat limp and the salad dressing was so thinly applied you could barely taste the blue cheese. For entrees we ordered straightforward dishes, penne pasta and a hamburger. But 30 min after we finished the salad the entrees were not delivered. Meanwhile two other groups in the back dining room,  parties of 3 and 4 people who arrived after us, were enjoying their entrees while we waited and waited. Fed up, we stood up to leave just as the dishes were brought to us. We said it was too late and walked out.
author: Michael B.

description: The waiter was nice, and the view is one of my new favorties if you're looking for nice outdoor dining.
author: Carlos A.

description: If you are heading to this place , prepare yourself for a long wait and to meet some unprofessional stuff. The hosts are a joke.
author: Cher K.

description: I literally wish that UberEats, Postmates, Eat24/GrubHub, anyyyything would deliver from Perry's to my new home in Scottsdale, AZ (my new home). When you're constantly in the hustle of bustle of San Francisco, namely with the most recent year's tech explosion, it's so refreshing to have a comfortable environment that is has space, and is just -- normal.  They have picnic table table clothes, predictable bread sticks each visit, outdoor seating that is dog-friendly, and THE BEST boneless buffalo tenders as appetizers.  Yep, I said it.  Test them out and see if I'm wrong. I've made several of my friends believers.  This is hands down a great place to spend quality time with loved ones, watch sports game (there is an awesome back room with sky lights), or just kick-back and have a few beers and relax.
author: Laura B.

description: This place is tops! Nothing left to chance here! Bloody Mary's are wonderful, atmosphere chic, exciting as the menu. A little noisy but you wont mind, the food is so great! And the waiters/waitresses are sooooo nice.
author: Sherri R.

description:
Classic Americana.  Nothing special here.  

Had the Ahi Tuna and as one might have guessed I should have stuck with the land based proteins.  The tuna smelled but I figured what the hell. I was wrong. The fishy taste was there only slightly masked by the jalapeño topping and odd aioli.    Don't go for an adventure with this menu.  Check out the clientele and go with what they are having.  Lots of regulars here and they know who they're looking to please.  

Business lunch...sure if your client is boring or you don't want the food to distract from the conversation swing through. Especially if you want an east coaster to feel at home. 

 Plenty of salads.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating. 

 It is in the middle of Basic B central so the menu matches.
author: Spanky M.

description:
UPDATE: The owner contacted me and apologized for the service and sent a gift card to try the restaurant again.  To me, that is great customer service and I hope this will reflect in better service for the staff as well. 

I added one star for the customer service from the Owner. 

I was in the restaurant with my daughter. We were talking and the waiter came by and we asked him to box the food. He grabbed the plate and rather than box the food, he placed it in the bin with the dirty dishes. We then asked him if he was boxing our food and he said no but he can, then he proceeds to grab our plate from the dirty dishes and send it to the back to be boxed. We call the host over to tell him the situation and he along with the waiter come back to our table and tell us that it's completely clean and our food is boxed if we still want it. 

What kind of behavior is this from a well-established restaurant? Would you allow this with your own family members? That is just NOT ok.
author: Lisa G.

description: Fast and friendly staff with great bar food on a union street landmark...so good, ask for Margie, she is the best. Always on top of your dining pleasure.
author: Kevin E.

description:
Great cocktails, great bar bites!  We had margaritas and martinis which were great!  Cherry was a great bartender making our drinks just as we like them.  Margarita with no salt and the martini with two olives.  

The skins, calamari, and wings were delicious.  The portions were generous as well.  Most importantly, you get what you pay for with a smile.

We will be back!
author: Emilia G.

description:
I have been coming here for years, and I am glad that it is still in business, an old Staple of the Union St. restaurant community.

Perry's has a simple formula, solid American food, like burgers, fries, salads, etc., a decent wine list, good cocktails and beers, fast, no non-sense, friendly service.  The prices are what they are, it is SF and Cow Hollow, so it isn't cheap, and you can probably find more scrumptious food for the same amount. But consider this, Cow Hollow is not a tourist destination, so any restaurant here relies on the local crowd to thrive, and Perry's been here forever.

What else to say? Great brunch, and it is nice to have a few curb tables on a sunny, warm day.
author: Massimo M.

description:
Great spot! My server MK was the highlight. She was super down to earth and hilarious! The food solid and the staff was amazing. 

Peace and love!
author: Daniel M.

description: Every time I make it the area I typically mosey by Perry's. I go for an early dinner at the bar and have a few drinks with the local bar crowd, who typically are regulars. Last time I had the spaghetti and meatballs. While the flavors were good, the handmade meat balls were a bit on the dry side this particular time. I'm sure they would have made it right if I had asked, but it was OK and I was hungry. Overall, the place has a nice atmosphere and they have a decent sized bar, so you can typically find a spot. If you time it right, you can be there for dinner and hang tight for the party crowd the comes in the evenings towards the weekends.
author: Doug B.

description: Solid food, not gourmet, great servers and staff but over the top NOISY on a Saturday with football games on. Happy hour prices were good for wine and cocktails. Steak was very good, lamb shank was under spiced and could have been less bland, fish special of sea bass was excellent. meatloaf and burgers were typical food, nothing out of the ordinary.  So the rating is good middle of the road. No real complaints.
author: Diane A.

description:
Sometimes I feel like a plastic bag, blowing in the wind.
Or I feel like Kim Jongun getting #spoiler exploded by a tank.
#hatersgonnahateatersgonnaate

1st *and* 2nd brunch plans got nixed coughsfmarathonstreetclosurescough; randomly ended up here at Katy's.

ICED TEA: Yes.

PULLED PORK: Moist, springy, chopped small. #thatswhatshesaidx3 Nearly iden to one of my fave Southern restos in SF. #surprise

Only "downside" was our section was quite #sardinecan. Our particular table was wedged between a wall & a handrail; felt like someone had their arm across my back the whole time. But #whatev #nottrippin.

Vintage in your face everywhere posters & wall decor. Sunflower table centerpieces. Blue x white checkered picnic tablecloths. Muhammad Ali. Darth Vader.
author: Dan B.

description: One of my favorite weekday evening spot. The atmosphere is always good and the food is always the same quality. Except the bread sticks they hand out for free - sometimes you get the day old batch and far from crispy. Their fillet mignon is superb as well as their appetizers, but my absolute number one is the french onion soup. Can't tell another place in the city serves the same and it's always melts my heart. The only downside is the price range, it comes pretty pricey for being regular American food. the drink menu is fine, several options for beer and win as well. Service is great, I like to be greeted by the same people every time I go there.
author: Brody B.

description:
Long-term survival on Union Street is about as solid a recommendation as can be.

I first came here in the 70's, when it was considered to be a British sort of place with an excellent London Broil. What was so unique then was that it was like a Body Bar for older gents and younger ladies then.......

In the years between, I have had a lot of wonderful meals and a few duds. Sure, the duds were disappointing, but this is not the Golden Arches. It just seems that incompetent people are hired from time to time, and they are dumped right away, just like at any other business.

So, despite the lapses, I will always drop by here on every trip to the City.
author: George T.

description: I've been working in San Francisco for about 2 years now and this was the first place It felt like home. The bartender Heather is funny and awesome to speak with. I came in a few times feeling a little down and after laughing and talking while enjoying my wine and food I leave out feeling a lot better. There has only been one time where I didn't have a good experience and Carolyn the manager hear my complaint and took care of it right away. This has been not only my favorite restaurant but a place where I refer my clients to get the good ol San Francisco hospitality.
author: Paisley L.

description: Saturday brunch: it took them 30 minutes to get our eggs. The service was good though. Asked to box our food
author: Alex P.

description:
Avoid the tomato soup. It's laced with sugar. 
They should also stop serving the chips that's served with their burgers. Salmon dish served on a bed of veg. Extra oil. 

Overall: mediocre dishes and slow service
author: Irvaan D.

description:
What happened to this place?  I have been coming here for 40 years.  I went for lunch yesterday.  We got seated immediately, which was nice. 

I always get the chopped salad, which I did.  My friend ordered the chicken sandwich, specifying no bacon.  The waitress acknowledged (but we found out didn't write it down).  Friend ordered chips.  We shared.

The sandwich came, with bacon.  Most of her chips were burned.  No biggie we just took the bacon off.

But the chopped salad was a major disappointment.  The first thing I noticed when it was put on the table was a small pile of grated cheese on top.  I didn't remember it being served that way.  It was more oil and vinegar to my recollection.  It was when I took the first bite, I knew it wasnt their usual chopped salad.  It had a creamy (mayo?) dressing I disliked immediately.

We didn't really touch the salad.

I won't be back for a long time, even though I live in the neighborhood and used to like the place.
author: Lois L.

description: First, my coffee cup was dirty and I mean a large sticky spot on the outside of the cup sort of dirty. The spoon to stir the coffee didn't look that clean either.  Took awhile to get a new cup and coffee.   Second, getting a waitress to come back to refill the coffee was impossible. We asked and she finally showed up when we were ready to pay the bill.  I had the eggs benedict. They were fine.  Potatoes were fine.  I wouldn't say it was anything special.
author: Jean F.

description: Best chili (aside from mom's) that I've ever had!
author: Kyle S.

description: Perrys is a traditional old school American fare. We got to try 4 different entrees and all were solid. The lunch menu choices are similar to what you would find at a diner, just better quality and a bit more upscale. Their salads are heady and full of stick-to-your-bones goodness. The peppered steak on the black and blue salad was tender and cooked perfectly. We were amazed at how large a half order of Cobb salad was! Still a meal in itself. Loved the seating by the sunny window and they have a few outdoor tables as well. Perry's is a classic
author: Piper W.

description: Not super sure why this is 3 stars.  Perrys is a twice a month thing at least. Always sit outside, (weather permitting ). The food is consistent and the relaxed vibe is one of the reasons I'm a repeat customer. All of the food is solid. I usually go for a wedge salad and cup of chowdah. Chicken sandwich is also fantastic. DOG FRIENDLY outside, YAY!
author: Barbie B.

description: Most importantly I stood at the hostess stand for approximately 5 minutes with multiple employees passing by not saying anything. I later noticed a bar and sat at the bar. I noticed that one of the employees that passed by me multiple times was the hostess (tall, lighter complexion male with a beard) that I saw greeting and seating other patrons. The food was good. I ordered corn beef hash; Billy the bartender was attentive. The hostess was at the hostess stand when I exited the place and said absolutely nothing unlike most businesses that say thank you, come again. ADVICE hire a new hostess because the experience I had was not very welcoming.
author: Whitley R.

description:
I walked in to place an order to go Monday night and commented that this is one of the few places around to get food after 10 pm. The angry woman bartender proceeds to yell at me that there are so many places open for food and I have no idea what I'm talking about. I cancel my to go order and proceed to walk out and she creates an unneeded scene at the restaurant and is still arguing. Sounds like there are much better options to get food after 10 than Perry's without a bitch bartender. 

I will never go back and recommend firing the woman bartender working Monday night, October 17. She created an unfriendly environment and clearly does not recommended Perry's .
author: John S.

description: I didn't really enjoy the atmosphere, it was an uncomfortable mix of families trying to have a nice dinner and a rowdy bar crowd. The food was also overpriced and portions were pretty small.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Good is good, service was outstanding however there was a lot of fruit flies in the restaurant.
When I brought it up with the host I was told they are bad this time of the year!
Unacceptable for a popular restaurant!!!!
author: Michael R.

description:
While in SF for touristy stiff we met a local SF family member for breakfast. What a hip place. Great food. Greta staff. Clean bathrooms. 
Its a surprisingly large place with patio seating in front and a covered atrium in the rear (very cool). The decor is dark lush wood w high ceilings- very comfortable. 
I enjoyed Perry's so much that If I lived locally the staff would know my name.
author: Mike S.

description:
We're sitting in the front room by the window and can clearly see and hear the bar area. We asked our waitress for 3 tastings before we got a bottle. We could clearly see and hear the blonde woman bartender complaining about us asking for tastings and angrily telling our waitress that was it for us and proceeded to say a few more things knowing I was looking over at her rude demeanor. I never yelp but felt obligated to since I read other reviews about this particular bartender. The fact that we could see and hear her displeased manner is so unprofessional. I hope that someone speaks with her about her attitude since this isn't the first time someone has complained. 

***Although I appreciate your quick response, Margie, I've read through the other reviews and see that this happens more often than not with this particular bartender. As a bartender myself, her attitude and demeanor are unacceptable in such a tight knit industry.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Popped into here on a whim and man, they killed it.

First, thanks for being unpretentious with the brunch menu. Cow hollow comes yuppie as hell most of the time, getting waaaaayyyy to clever with the brunch menus. Perry's keeps it real. They can get fancy if you want to get fancy, but if you want an omelette, or even a burger, they've got you. Let's be honest, you're at brunch because you're too hungover to live. I appreciate not having to google the ingredients.

Atmosphere was real cool, they have a covered patio thing in the back that was beautiful and let a ton of light in. It was busy, like any brunch spot on a sunday, but we got seated for 2 with no reservation, which was nice.

Omelette with homefries and burger with house made potato chips all came absolutely correct. Not a single complaint. Food was absolutely perfect.

It was a hair expensive, relative to the same menu in other places, but we agreed the top notch food quality and hangover friendly atmosphere were well worth it.

One catch, if you care: the mimosas are not bottomless. But then again, that's what got you into this mess in the first place, right?
author: Patrick S.

description:
We've eaten here a few times now. The breakfasts are terrific and offer a large variety of menu items. Particularly enjoyed the French toast! But the egg dishes are also very good - we've had some of their scramble and also omelets, all were tasty. And they have unsweetened ice tea! Perfect!
Waiting can be a while as they are crowded on the weekends but if you pick off time, it's no wait.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
I've had 2 meals here with very different experiences.  

Weekday lunch 3/5:
My party sat by the window on a beautiful day, and despite the crowdedness in the restaurant, the ambiance was nice with the open window letting in a lot of sunlight and a breeze.  Ordered a simple spaghetti entree and received a huge portion, enough to feed 2 people. The meatballs were really huge and cooked very evenly; they did a great job of absorbing all the sauce and remaining very juicy. They were generous with my side order of fries as well, but the fries were bland, thick cut, and soggy, which I wasn't a huge fan of. The service was pretty average, and there was a constant throng of business people who were eating nice business casual lunches there, so I understand the lag.

Weekend breakfast 2/5:
I came with my boyfriend and we opted to eat outside at the last outdoor table available because it was great weather. There was a set weekend menu that featured brunch items, none of which were fully breakfast-y or lunch-y, but just a hodge podge of whatever seemed quick and easy to prepare without having to heavily burden the cooking or serving staff. Since brunch places are pretty competitive in San Francisco, I was expecting a much more diverse menu, especially for the price point. After a long deliberation picking between entrees I wasn't really interested in, I halfheartedly ordered the Monterey Scramble which consisted of egg whites with sautéed spinach, shiitake mushrooms & tomatoes.  All the ingredients were soggy and watery.  Together, it was like a pile of mush with no definition to any of the flavors of the ingredients, salt, pepper, nothing could save it. My boyfriends eggs Benedict was a bit more flavorful, but by no means memorable. The hollandaise sauce was pretty plasticky in texture and the biscuit was dry if not almost stale. I was really disappointed to see such a limited brunch/weekend menu considering how diverse and extensive their lunch menu is during the week. 

Will I come back? No, blerrrrgghhhh. The food was lacking taste and the proper food texture. The only plus was the portion size, but I had no desire to consume big portions of underwhelming food. Good American food is not hard to come by in San Francisco so this really just didn't meet expectations for what I thought should have been a simple brunch and lunch meal.
author: Kathy T.

description: Best restaurant in town! Great food, awesome atmosphere, top notch customer service  I highly recommend Perry's for all occasions, any day of the week!
author: sarah b.

description:
Stumbled upon this place by mistake as we were trying to find a place for dinner after an event at Fort Mason.  Every other place either had a line, or didn't take walk-ins.  Perry's seated us right away! 

We were a little overwhelmed from the noisiness and the crowd at the event, so we asked to seat in a quiet part - they had to areas in the back after a hustling bar area - and we were the only table there.  So happy they accommodated the request.  But it felt that the good service stopped there. 

They took a while to take our order, and the person taking the order was not very nice or engaging, I felt like she was making me a favor.  She took the order and disappeared.  In a little bit we managed to *catch* someone and get some breadstick.  In a little bit longer we were able to obtain some water for the table... and some silverware.  And we were all set.  The food showed up timely and order was fulfilled as requested.  Typical American... Oh, and then we were fishing for out check...
author: Marianna K.

description:
Overall, a great spot for casual drinks and dinner! We started off with the calamari which was great and had a zesty dipping sauce which we all enjoyed. The star of the show, however, was the burger. Try it with bacon! A little odd that they make you pay an extra $1.50 for cheese, but it was worth it. Don't be the guy that orders a salad here, my friend did that and was immensely jealous of the delicious and hearty burger. 

As far as cocktails, try the Mayan Mule! Very tasty and they certainly don't water their drinks down. 

Service was slow at times, but overall a very friendly atmosphere. 10/10 would come back for the burger.
author: Abby B.

description:
Yesterday we got our day drink on at Perry's.  A couple of days before we got an evening drink on somewhere else.

Yesterday, at Perry's, one of the ordered drinks was perfection and the other one not perfection.  This was just like it was the other night at the other place like deja vu all over again.

Except for one difference.

The other night, the response from friendly and prompt barkeep when advised that said imperfect cocktail was unlike a far more enjoyable version last time around said no, this cannot be.  I know these cocktails inside and out.  What you have is perfection in a glass.

But it wasn't.

At Perry's, however, without even words being said friendly attentive barkeep saw the frown and said why the long face rabbit.

Who demurred.  Until he insisted then a short conversation ensued and he again insisted to make another.  No talk of his expertise as a mixologist and said patrons obvious amateur status as a drink taster, none of that malarkey.  

Before any further protestation could be offered he was off and in two shakes there was drink 2.0.  And it was a lot better.

And everybody was happy.

Old school wins again.

Five stars.

The End.
author: Markus N.

description: I went into Perry's the other night and I was shocked by how unprofessional the staff was. There is a woman bartender with short blonde hair, may be a manager, that publicly drinks while she's working. I've been to many bars and have friends that are bartenders and they all only drink when they've clocked out, never while still working. I also overheard her making negative comments about a couple of female patrons at the bar, who were just sitting there not causing any trouble. I feel like this employee is extremely unprofessional and should not be allowed to drink and talk bad about other patrons, especially while on the clock. I definitely won't be back because of this person.
author: Madison A.

description:
It is truly disheartening for me to leave a negative review for this establishment, as I have enjoyed meals at not only this location, but their Embarcadero and SFO locations as well, and normally have an amazing experience. 

While the food was at its usual high quality, the customer service experienced this morning was atrocious.  After talking up the location to my friend visiting from Sacramento area, we headed to the Union Street location, my favorite of the three. When contacting the two young hostesses at the podium and requesting an outside table, (one of which was unoccupied and set), we were told that they would need to hold the available table for a reservation which was scheduled for over 15 minutes from the current time, despite there being other tables outside which appeared to be finishing their meals soon and likely departing at or close to the future reservation. Initially accepting this, I noted a table inside by a window also open and set, and requested this table. After a brief moment of consideration the hostesses again told us that they would need to hold that table for another reservation which was also over 15 minutes away. After being seated at a different location I noted at least two tables which were in the process of paying their tabs at the windows while the first remained open.  When I expressed to the hostesses that I felt it was in poor form to hold multiple tables for reservations so far out while others were clearly coming available and customers are present ready to be seated with requests for those tables, I was met with an argumentative and rude response to the effect of I just don't know how their job works. After both young ladies became agitated and argumentative, I informed them that I was not willing to participate in an argument over the issue and would instead discuss my concerns with a manager at a later date, to which one continued to attempt to engage me in a dispute while the other responded with "that's fine, go ahead and talk to a manager, we can too."   While this was frustrating enough, being glared and scowled at while trying to enjoy our meal made for an extremely unpleasant experience. 

The condescending attitude, hostile and immature demeanor and obvious immaturity of the young hostesses, who made it clear to me that they are not only very willing to, but take pleasure in making every effort to avoid a customers reasonable request, has left me with serious doubts as to whether I will continue to patronize a normally very pleasant and delicious lunch spot.
author: Jon S.

description:
I love this PERRY's restaurant.  It's a little old school feel to it reminding me of things from the Northeast where I'm from.

When I first moved to SF years ago, I thought this was a stand alone unique restaurant.  It is actually part of a small regional chain, but still pretty good quality.

We used to frequent it for a number of occasions, coming here for Valentine's Day when my new beau, soon to be husband, didn't make reservations with enough advance time at the romantic places, this was great for me b/c it is Atkins friendly.  At one time featured NM ranch meats.

Great place for a weekend brunch date. Sit outside, weather permitting, and your close proximity to each other will enhance the romance of your date.

We have sat all over this restaurant with our large family parties, including bringing our mother here because it's a casually classy place.  One of the last time we ate here, the hostess of the time was extraordinarily rude to us.  We just hoped and prayed she wouldn't last long and ruin this great restaurant in the heart of Cow Hollow.

Tips for the Cow Hollow Locals: check out their daily special entree of the day to plan your noshing choices.
author: April B.

description:
I wanted to really like Perry's. I was all set up perfectly to fall in love with the place. Slight hangover from NYE. An empty stomach and willing to settle for anything open in the neighborhood. As expected there was a wait but we were sat about 10 minutes less than the estimate from the hostess. This might have been the one or two bright spots we had that day. 

Our server was friendly but throughout the service there were constantly things we never had available to us or had to ask for repeatedly. We were told potatoes came with all the dishes and later found out that some of the scrambles did not come with them.  This was clearly not mentioned on the menu so it's hard to blame our server for that mistake. We didn't get utensils on time and when we did we only got ONE knife between the 4 of us. We made due buttering our toast with our one knife.  Our knife was a trooper throughout the meal as we shared him for a couple things. Other little things kept our visit from being pleasureable like curdled cream and missed drinks. I will say our server was on top of the booze when we asked for it. The food was disappointing for all of us to the point we had to find something else after to please our palettes.  

In the end none of us were able to look at the other and convince ourselves that we'd ever come back. Hopefully if you read this you don't have the experience we had.
author: Joco F.

description:
Excellent chicken wings!!! We shared the wings and the chicken club.  So yummy!  
Service was great and I loved the atmosphere.   Definitely will be back.   
Almost forgot they also pour some good drinks.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Came here for brunch with my girlfriends.  

I do like the back of the restaurant that appears to be outdoors but isn't (The roof is glass).  

I had the french onion soup.  Pretty decent for a french onion soup.  I was going food OG on it but it was good.

Haven't tried anything else here but my friend seems to adore their eggs benedict.
author: Michelle T.

description: I think the food here is good. The only think that needs improvement is the service, but just my opinion. I still like them anyway.
author: Jonh S.

description: My whole family (4 of us) ate here on Thu night.  Upon walking up to the restaurant on Union street, we passed by an angry homeless man cursing at himself.  As we are not exactly used to this, this was surprising.  (I know this is not quite about the restaurant, but this person was sitting nearby & I want to be honest w/ the overall experience.)  As you walk in the entrance, you see a classic cozy American bar/restaurant (NYC style) w/ brass railings, dark wood walls & eclectic posters hanging on almost every square inch of wall space - love the ambiance right here!  Upon glancing at these pictures/posters, you'll notice several are of the Yankee baseball genre.  This not only confirms the "NYC style" I mentioned, but the owner must also be a Bronx bombers fan, accordingly.  Nothing wrong w/ that as I also love all things baseball!  It was also very busy - another great sign.  We were led through a fairly winding & snake like (w/ 90 degree turns) path, past the kitchen, that finally opened to a beautiful skylit room w/ only 4-5 tables (w/ blue checkerboard table cloths on them) in it.  Complete contradiction to the rest of the restaurant, but still very VERY nice!  Right next door to this room, on the other side of a glass wall, was another small dining room, inside, with no skylight.  Within this well lit room, you feel like you're sitting on a patio, as lower lying clouds race beautifully overhead (yes, we were having an early dinner).  Pictures on the wall in this "lanai"/room included one of Clint Eastwood in a scene from "Dirty Harry".  There is also 1 flat screen TV, in this case showing Giants baseball.  (Unfortunately, they were losing to a well fed Matt Kemp & the Braves this night.)  There are other flat screen TVs throughout the restaurant - very nice to see that too!  I ordered the poke starter & in keeping with the ocean theme, the seared Ahi burger as my entree.  As the poke was set down on the table, the first thing I noticed is how dark these diced fish pieces were.  As Ahi tuna is normally bright red, this is where my first half ding comes into play.  It still tasted OK, but the dark red fish signals a lack of freshness.  Still, I am impressed that Poke is even on the menu at a classic American NY style restaurant!  The burger was much better looking.  The bread of the bun was soft & seemed recently baked; the meat was pink on the inside, while of course, cooked well on the outside.  The lettuce & other accompaniments w/in this fish burger complimented each other nicely.  My daughter even commented that I devoured this burger surprisingly rapidly.  My wife had the french onion soup & says, "I rank it high".  My son had the hamburger w/ fries & loved all of that too.  Our daughter had the veggie burger w/ sweet potato fries - she ranks the fries a 10/10 & the burger a 7/10 as she felt there were too many seeds in the patty.  Although our server was friendly, helpful & attentive, he pushed a bottle of wine on us a little too hard.  He was trying to make us aware of all bottles being half off this day, but some people don't HAVE to drink.  Even though 2 glasses were the same price as the full bottle, some people don't NEED alcohol.  I definitely respect up-selling, but a little less salesmanship, please.  Two "No thank you's" should be enough, but 3 should definitely be the signal to stop.  The busboy was super friendly as well.  Quick note about the bathrooms - they sit perched high above the dining room area.  You have to walk up narrow & steep stairs in order to get to them - only one person can go up/down at a time.  Even though this would be tough on people w/ leg/hip/foot problems, I love this aspect actually - it's as if there's a secret upstairs crow's nest...but it's only the bathroom!  Overall, this restaurant was a great experience.  I loved the ultra fantastic feel of the place + the modern menu + the overall friendliness!  In our next visit to SF, I definitely want to dine here again!
author: Terran S.

description: I have lived in the marina for the past 15 years and by far this is the worst bar on union. The bartenders specially Dave is extremely rude. They physically threaten customers. I had not even order a drink and the bartender threatened to physically harm me. This place employees the worst trash of the Bay. If you want to get insulted and disrespected while you drink go to This place.
author: vahid r.

description:
***UPDATE: The owner said she would look into this situation and contact me privately. This never happened and it's been almost one year. I see that my business is not wanted here.***

I've been here three times now and don't plan to return. My family and I came for lunch at noon yesterday. We sat in the patio area and unfortunately we had the tall waitress with reddish brown hair. She checked on all the other tables which happened to all have white customers and neglected the two tables with non-white customers. 

She never once smiled and barely came to see how we were doing. After she gave us the bill, she did not return and after 10 minutes I went to find another staff member to close out the bill. The past times I've been here were great, but I won't be back. Used to recommend this place to friends and won't be doing that anymore.
author: Christina M.

description: As another reviewer brought up, the fruit fly situation was bad.  Also the service was pretty bad, our waters never got filled, had to ask a food runner to refill them.  And our entrees arrived with no utensils on the table.  Obviously the server did not know what she was doing.  That goes to training and managing your staff.
author: William M.

description:
There's a kinda grundge feel about this spot, dark wood, black table tops, as much bar length as restaurant space... Following the hostess down a brick hallway to your table feels so familiar. There's a sense of having been here before, popping into similar hang-outs in other cities. It exudes an easy, very casual way about it... 

My bagel platter was good, though the bagel didn't have much of a toasting. I thought their coffee was excellent (medium roast) and others with me seemed to enjoy their eggs. Nothing cheers up a meal more than a pleasant server, so despite the nondescript Rush Street atmosphere, and simple cuisine we were content. For fresh cooked meals without frills, this is a good weekend choice.
author: Lynn S.

description:
I had been here back in December following a party and fell in love with the old-school atmosphere. I came back months later and did enjoy the place, albeit it being empty (it was also 3pm on a weekday). 

I ordered the the wedge salad -and it was huge! And pretty tasty (if you love blue cheese and bacon, then you'll be munching down to chow town). They do have a $5 wine special during happy hour as well. Overall, decent place with a nice location on Union St. 

P.S. be sure to try their house chips!
author: Michael G.

description: I order from here all the time and tonight I got my favorite salad. So disappointing that they left out the best part...the avocado, and tried to make the salad look big by filling it with lettuce! There's no point in calling because all they are going to say is "sorry". So pathetic
author: Melanie B.

description:
I remember walking past Perry's one night and seeing someone eating one of their burgers.  It was a big, thick burger and I thought to myself, "Hmm, I might have to try this place."   So, today I finally tried 'em.  

When I was there - Sunday morning, brunch-time - they switched the TV at the bar (there were at least three) from basketball highlights to golf.  That is really all you have to know about Perry's.  If watching The Masters in a bar during Sunday brunch is your thing, you'll probably love Perry's.   If you'd rather be watching basketball, this ain't your spot.  

Don't get me wrong, nothing was particularly bad, but nothing was particularly GREAT either.  Hence, the 3-star review.

I should point out that the staff was very friendly and attentive, everyone from the hostess who seated me, to the waiter who took my order, to the busboy who brought me a small side of mayo.  

But the food?  Overall, pretty bland and flavorless.  No zing, no pizzazz, no zest.  

I started with a cup of tomato bisque that was definitely more on the creamy side, more pink than red (hello, White People!!)  Compared to the tomato soup at the American Grilled Kitchen, this was just wimpy wimpy wimpy.  But I'm sure some investment banker in a bowtie thinks it's the cat's meow.  This soup is strictly for old ladies and Thurston Howell types.

The burger WAS big, I'll give them that.  I ordered it MEDIUM and it came to me MEDIUM, which is also impressive.  And, I liked the two big slices of tomato on the side.   But, taste-wise, there just wasn't anything there.  It's like, they knew what it should LOOK LIKE, but they forgot to put the flavor in it.  The same goes for the breakfast potatoes that I lieu of French fries.  Plenty of them, colorful, but ultimately lack-luster.   (Imagine you're taken prisoner by Aliens.  They want to feed you, they have images of what Earth food looks like, but no idea what it should taste like.  That's Perry's.)  

So, there you have it.  If you come from old money, if you're boring and white and wasp-y and bland, this is your place!  As for me, I'll stick with my fellow "lowlife degenerates" in The Mission, thank you very much.
author: FoodDudeS F.

description:
The ol' I-cant-believe-I-have-never-Yelped-this-place-before.

One of my favorite watering holes of all time. Have stayed in this neighborhood for many years whenever in one of Americas most fun and beautiful citys. And Perry's is one of it's most iconic establishments, anchoring Union Street since the late 60's. My 1st visit was in the late 70's, and is always a must stop. In fact on our latest trip here we were having dim sum in China Town when I suddenly realized we had not yet payed a visit. We were to depart for home that afternoon, but had the cab driver drop us off for a goodbye glass of vino. Ah, felt much better, thank you. 

Back in the day this is where many of the scribes and columnist from the local papers hung out, along with some now ex-mayors, attorneys, and other professionals. Generally a more mature crowd until the later hours, but even then the youngins tend to head to the cheaper and more rowdy nearby bars. Not that this is a quiet boring place. I foggily remember dancing on the bar with a waitress near closing time many years ago, while the bartender cranked up the tunes and cheered us on. Go ahead, visualize. Sorry to traumatize. One would never suspect that type of behavior would be condoned here, but there you go. Only in Danimal World. 

Drinks are strong, made by friendly seasoned professional btenders, and they always have some decent wine by the glass choices. As far as the food goes, it has been many years since I have partook, mainly because there are too many great choices for food in this city. It's just basically boring American food.  

But do stop in for a drink or three, and enjoy some old school San Francisco hospitality.
author: Dan H.

description: I think this was an awesome place that I went to! I actually went here for a total of 2 times already and it already seems amazing to me! One time I went here during my school's ski week break back in February, and the second time was in August when I celebrated my brother's accomplishments in his career! I really loved the burger there, and I think they make them pretty good compared to others out there! I definitely recommend that all you guy out there check this place out on your own time because it's really good quality and doesn't even suck at all!
author: Asher D.

description:
Perry's seems like one of those restaurants where you don't know where to go but you want to go someplace new but can't decide so you end up going back to Perry's.

Loved the food and cocktails! For dinner I got the ahi burger which was quite delicious. No problem substituting sweet potato fries which is a bonus. All around pretty chill vibe and I would come back.
author: Jordan S.

description:
A-Ok is an accurate assessment.  Came here for lunch during bay to breakers.  It was easy to get a table and service was quick.  The ambiance is ok.  It was bustling and there is an outdoor area that is probably a little cooler than the inside space.  The crowd seemed a bit uppity, and older...but that may have been a fluke.
I had the Filet open face sandwich and it was good, not great.  The fries were perfection though.  My girlfriend's had the Tex Mex type salad and the cobb.  They raved to no end.
As an out-of-towner I probably wouldn't return because there are so many other options in SF, but I guess if you're a local and can walk here, it could be a solid spot to fall back on.
author: Lisette C.

description: Very good food, and excellent customer service. Andrea is friendly and has a great timing when we needed her to bring more drinks. Prices are so reasonable!!!  We'll be back for sure!!!
author: Mikhail M.

description:
Stopped in here for lunch because I was intrigued by a salad ordered by 2 girls sitting in the sidewalk seats. 

As it turns out, they barely touched their food. Not sure why because the beet/goat cheese salad is amazing!

Would go back for that for sure.
author: Jainy S.

description:
Probably wouldn't come back here again given all the choices on Union street.

Came here for sunday brunch.  Vast menu, lots of choices, just not that many great picks.

We ordered:
Tortilla scramble
bacon and cheese potato skins
Ahi Tacos

All sounded great in concept.

(+) HUGE portions. you definitely won't have to leave here hungry.  Even the drinks had huge portions (cappuccino in a mug the size of a small bowl)

(-) tastes were all pretty bad.  

The Ahi tacos only had ahi tuna in the tip of the taco. The rest of it was red lettuce slices and a bit of sauce. You get 4 tacos.

The bacon and cheese potato skins (about 10-12 of these) had way too much potato for the bacon and cheese. overall tasted bland. The potatoes were too thick and mealy.

My friend's Tortilla scramble was decent but nothing to write home about.
author: Alice Z.

description:
When in San Francisco...we go to Perry's for their Cheeseburger!!  It never disappoints..
Another plus, is that they have Anchor Steam on draft!!!!!!!
We always sit at the bar, and the service is always great.
The staff is always friendly 
Would highly recommend!!
author: Catherine C.

description:
My husband and I stumbled upon a cute outdoor Parisian style cafe trottoire seating with white an blue checker table cloth and yellow flowers center piece. 

We ordered a salad, mini ruben and Ahi tuna tacos. Everything was delicious. Specially the Ahi tuna tacos. A tuna tartare wrapped in a taco with a special sauce *drooling*. By far one on the best things I have ever tasted. Trust me you gotta stop by and taste those tacos!
author: Tamara S.

description: Perry's is reliable and tasty. My coworkers and I go here often because it's near our office. Breakfast and Lunch hasn't failed. The oatmeal is delicious with a side of blueberries and the salads and soups for lunch are always reliable. The only things is even with a reservation the wait can be long especially at lunchtime. Portions are great size and priced perfectly for a business lunch or an affordable daily option.
author: Mysings A.

description:
Went here for a business dinner with some colleagues and was pleasantly surprised. This place is very cute and perfect for groups. 

While waiting, we ordered the quesadilla, wings and a bottle of wine (1/2 off on Mondays). Both appetizers were delicious! The dry breadsticks were nice to have, but I'd rather waste my calories on actual breadsticks.

I am unsure of what everybody ordered, but I believe there were:
Cobb Salad - all 3 women thoroughly enjoyed this
Pot Roast - tender, flavorful and very filling
Perry's Hamburger - very generous serving of meat, cooked perfectly
Sliders - looked delicious!

Overall, didn't hear any complaints about the food and atmosphere was great. Would definitely return for dinner again!
author: Megan R.

description: I used to love Perry's, unfortunately the new staff they have hired do not portray the hospitality they used to have before. The bartenders are absolutely amazing! Kind and always wiling to help you. Hoping they will work on their employees to be kind soon,instead of not putting their customers first. Best of luck Perry's
author: F A.

description: Poor, slow service! Stopped in for drinks and our server literally dragged his feet with no joy or rush to help anyone. Not impressed!
author: Claudia S.

description: These guys customer service sucks. A horrible manager named Ian actually told me his staff couldn't do their job in seating me and providing a menu because I was on the phone. So I seat myself and don't get a menu because I have one headphone in my ear. This place and the staff are unprofessional.
author: Jo S.

description:
All the staff - from the bartenders, waitstaff and busboys are so attentive and friendly  -you guys ALL make this restaurant stand out.
Great service in a town where your basic service "How to Serve People 101"is almost non-existent.
Food is also pretty good and prices are very fair. Old school, heck yah but relaxed and fun.
author: G K.

description: Good American food, with large portions and low prices. This is clearly a neighborhood favorite. You don't come here expecting gourmet food, but it's new American cuisine at its best. I had the best veggie burger I've ever eaten, and my mom had an amazing meatloaf with lots of mashed potatoes and vegetables. The portions were seriously large, and left no room for dessert. I can't believe how low-priced this place is.
author: Brian B.

description: Extremely rude hostess.....complete turn off!!!!   Waitress was not great either!  Food is good---horrible horrible service!!!!  Table of 7 received food before our small table of 3.
author: Sarah M.

description:
The parking situation here is very poor. To drive up and have to explain whether you're eating there or not and, if yes, then be pressured into paying $5 for them to park your car 15 feet away from the entrance is a joke. 
If you're not eating there then, once they've moved the cars in front of you, you're told to park at the other end of the car park.
Very off putting. 
The food itself was so so. Perhaps what you'd expect from a sports bar. That said I'd much rather eat at Piccos up the road where both the food and service is excellent.
author: Joe P.

description:
Situation
- Early dinner (5pm-ish) on a Saturday 
- Went with 2 friends
- I ordered a Pulled Pork Sandwich with Sweet Potato Fries

Pros
- The service was fantastic
- My food was excellent
- Allow credit cards
- You can bring your own bottle of wine, with a corkage fee

Cons
- At the table I sat at, the room between my table and the other tables was very tight
author: Dipesh G.

description:
I went to this place with a huge group and I really enjoyed it! The food is just all American Fare and the place was really crowded!

It was actually quite loud which made it hard for us to keep conversation, but either way, I thought it was a pretty good place to grab dinner after running around all day. 

I had Two pies in one day. The Chicken Pot Pie was really creative because instead of being in a bowl, it was actually a deconstructed pie. It had a creamy base, with pieces of chicken, carrots and peas in it. BUt then it had two buttered biscuits on top so the top of the biscuit was flaky but the bottom was soft from sitting in the soup. Absolutely phenomenal and it was nice and warm. Then apple pie :D It was huge! It came with a scoop of ice cream and I couldn't even finish it. 

I think that this place is worth a visit and I would go again if I was in the area. SF is just so full of food though so I would want to try a lot of other places too!
author: Julianne Z.

description:
The food is usually amazing, but the service is ridiculous. I usually do phone orders or through Yelp for takeout. I'm always told it will be a 10 min wait (for my always small simple order) and it always ends up taking 30+ mins no matter what, and always entails me standing around in the cold entryway while awkwardly looking at the hostess, even when I wait 10 or 30 minutes to showing up after I put my order in. It's like they don't actually start putting it together or making it until your standing there waiting for it and ask a billion times. Most of the time the hostess is never even at the front at the stand. What are they doing? The hostesses are usually always slightly rude/disinterested and unprofessional. They should be representing the place in a positive way, it's usually the first (or only, if you're doing takeout) impression that the customers get. 

Meanwhile across the bridge, the larkspur location is amazing, I've never had any problems or long wait with anything, and everyone who works there is super friendly and gets stuff done.
author: Haley J.

description:
Perry's is classic San Francisco but I have no idea what really keeps this place open? The ambiance is nice and it has a family vibe so I am not opposed to going but every time I go I am slightly disappointed...the food is just NOT that good. 

I've gotten the following:

-California Benedict
-Veggie Burger
-Cheeseburger
-Club Sandwich 

All 4 are pretty hard to mess up...everything was a solid C in my book. Also, the California Benedict arrived cold. Gross!
author: Ashley S.

description:
There are tons of great eats on Union, so Perry's isn't a place we frequent when in the area.  After getting turned away from the Brickyard (apparently our Bruin gear was not acceptable to the Michigan crowd), we went to Perry's to watch games and eat.

The food is nothing to write home about, but I like the restaurant layout. I had no idea there was a back room until we were seated there last night. Two big TVs and full service.  Loved being away from the crowded bar area!  We got the chicken BLT which was pretty tasty and the chopped salad.  Could have done without the salad, it had no flavor whatsoever :( 

Good spot for a casual drink or meal...but with all the great spots on Union, I won't be back to Perry's soon.
author: Brianna M.

description: I have been familiar with Perry's for 30 years; It has been at least 20 since I last visited the restaurant.  The food and the drinks were exactly as I remembered them -- very good and satisfying.  It is the waitstaff that has created my big complaint.  The English-learning staff does not have a clue and is pretty much MORONS!  Several orders delivered to our table were not correct, busboys slamming food down then shoving them across the table to the intended guest, and on and on...  Get the picture?  Make sure you sit at the bar or have an ENGLISH-SPEAKING waiter/waitress to serve you.
author: Larry H.

description: Nice atmosphere and decent service, but the food was just okay. Half of my eggs benedict arrived with a hard overcooked yolk. I told the waiter, and he just shrugged. Oh well.
author: Skye R.

description:
Great service, great food and the Irish guy at the podium is Awesome!!!
Try the Ribs on Tuesdays:)
author: Al T.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants for breakfast. 

My recommendation: try their eggs Benedict. Order an hors d'oeuvre of grilled artichokes! You won't be disappointed.
author: Ferd M.

description: I went to Perry's for a work lunch and enjoyed a pretty decent Mexican salad. It was fresh and a good size. My only complaint is the menu seemed pretty standard, nothing really stood out, but I do recognize that this is a SF institution so they probably don't want to change the menu to often. They also allow dogs, which is great!
author: Hayley H.

description:
In a word, reliable tasty American comfort food. 
Equally comfortable ambiance, complete with blue-checkered
table cloths, cable sports at the bar and a warm, friendly
wait staff.
author: Art K.

description: Perry's is a great place to have comfort food, watch a game and enjoy friends.  The breakfasts are good as is the dinner menu.  It's  a noisy place so be prepared.  I just wish they sold those great embroidered Perry's baseball caps from years ago.  Mine blew off while sailing and they don't sell them like that anymore.
author: Molly C.

description:
Whilst sitting on the patio, street level, my group of four enjoyed the San Franciscan sunshine as we drank and ate like the first world savages that we proudly are. 

Twas the first stop on a journey through the annals of a great american city.  My guide; a rather sharp looking yet slightly deranged young chap of mine who has held domicile here for over 10 years.  Upon his recommendation Perry's lived up to his suggestion.  

Quality fare and an old SF ambiance all added up to a very authentic first SF experience.  Only topped by being greeting by a kind homeless man that came up to the patio and generously offered to masturbate for us after exclaiming "OH SHIT IT'S PERRY'S!!!!!!!".."This is soooooooooo Sex in The City"..

Upon my disappointment in his lack of follow through (and knowledge that Sex in The City was based in NYC) we paid our bill and moved on  to our next stop of an epic bar and booze tour that only cost you your dignity to join.
author: Mike M.

description:
So meh. 

Perry's is a cross between an Applebee's and a Denny's. Seriously, it is.

The food is flavorless and ordinary. 

The quality of the meat and fish is questionable. 

The dishes look entirely unappetizing and the menu is utterly boring.  

The only positive is that the service is always friendly - that's why the 2 star review. 

I'd definitely recommend checking out the numerous other restaurants on Union St before giving Perry's a try.
author: Priya S.

description: Perry's is an amazing, SF institution. Heather the bartender is the reason we keep coming back.  If you're in SF or need a friendly face come for half off bottle of wines on Mondays and Thursdays.
author: Ashley A.

description:
Two stars mostly for the ambiance. It was a Sunday afternoon, great weather and we were just looking for a casual restaurant to catch some rays and grab some food. 

Two girls, two waters, one regular cob salad with salami and added avocado, one seared tuna burger, and one grilled artichoke appetizer. The two entrees came first, I'd say they were pretty average at best, nothing too amazing, I saw a lot of other pretty salads that a lot of people seemed to be ordering. The grilled artichoke was pretty decent, I'd probably order it again if I was around the restaurant and was hungry. Our total including tax and tip was $48.

It's great for some sun and enjoying the nice day, they don't really rush you out and you're able to take your time and catch up with friends. The downside was the cleanliness, our table cloth was pretty disgusting and all of our silverware was dirty as well. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but if I was super starving and in the neighborhood, I may stop by and order something new.
author: Mindy T.

description:
Awful breakfast food. Save your money and find a different place to eat.  Ate here with 5 friends and the only one who walked out happy was the one who didn't order food. 

I ordered the eggs blackstone and a hot tea.  The tea was really weird tasting. I don't know if it was the brand or the water but as someone who has tea daily and many places, I've never encountered such weird tasting tea. It was drinkable but not enjoyable. My eggs blackstone was very mediocre. The idea of the tomato and bacon sounded really good but in execution just didn't taste right. Lacked flavor. 

My husband ordered the chorizo scramble and he was sorely disappointed. Undercooked eggs and a strange diced meat that definitely wasn't chorizo. The tortillas were laid in grease. 

My 3 other friends had the French toast that was soggy and uneatable, the veggie omelet that the eggs again were undercooked and lacked flavor, the corn beef hash which was not corn beef and there was no hash which was ridiculous. 2 had bloody Mary's and they were watered down with very little alcohol. 

Not sure where they are getting their recipes or what's going on in that kitchen but we've never had such awful breakfast before. 

The only good things they had was the breakfast potatoes and toast. 

The decor is really cute and it looks well maintained. The service was good and friendly. It was such a disappointment that the food did not live up to the atmosphere.
author: MISS S.

description:
Had a play around 8pm that we had to catch and we wanted to grab some food beforehand. We called up the restaurant on our way there and put our names down. We made it to the restaurant a few minutes later and were seated next to the huge christmas tree. That was super nice. In addition, it was on the santa con and I appreciated the fact that there weren't too many drunk people at the restaurant at that time. 

The burger looked good and he seemed to have enjoyed it. Said it's one of the best in the City, and I'll take his word for it. I got the fish of the day special. Very well cooked and delicious veggies. The wine was good, the food was good, but nothing amazing and memorable. 

I will say, I did enjoy being next to the tree and being so festive.
author: Nina Y.

description:
The people who run this joint seriously have no knowledge on how to run a business. I was here right before the holidays and there was a couple in front of us waiting for a table. The hostess told them there were no seats available and  that there would be a bit of a wait. The woman in front of me was able to see a whole bunch of empty tables in the front of the restaurant and when she asked about them, the hostess said "we are keeping those tables clear because we're about to decorate the tree and we need those tables for ornaments". My jaw dropped in utter disbelief. Turning away paying customers to decorate a tree during business hours. This is clearly poor, poor, poor management. There were about 4 empty tables they could've seated but instead they decided to keep them open for ORNAMENTS!

Needless to say, the couple in front of us left, as did I.
author: Yuxuan N.

description:
Really nice man who works here... I called them to check if they were still serving brunch and could I bring Buster to sit outside. They said yes. When we got there, we saw that the last outdoor table was reserved. He had reserved it for us! 
Breakfast was delish, Buster had a nice time hanging out on the sidewalk table, there is a nice metal grate that you can tie your dog leash too, they have mimosas, and the service was very attentive. Thanks!
author: Laura F.

description: Traditional. Historic. Amazing. The French toast was the best I've ever had. Eggs benny we're classic and delicious.
author: Tara S.

description:
"meh" all around. 

the food was mediocre at best and the service was disappointing.

I wouldn't recommend it and I won't be returning.
author: danielle m.

description:
Had my worst brunch experience of the Marina here.  

Perhaps they were having an off day (a very verrrry off day), but nothing seemed to go right.  The service was miserably slow, orders were wrong, and condiments never arrived.   Not mildly worth the wait, the food was sub-par: eggs benny -over cooked, and french toast  -dry.  Our drinks were forgettable (and, in the case of the server, forgotten).  We watched as the food runner kept running things to the wrong tables, and could hear other tables complaining as well.  One guy off to the corner looked so miserable that my boyfriend and I could not help ourselves from busting up laughing when we'd look his way.  We could commiserate, and it was that comically bad...  Another guy and his son threatened to leave and you couldn't blame them. 

Needles to say, my first visit was my last, and I've had no desire to return since.
author: Cuppy C.

description:
You can take the girl out of Chicago, but not Chicago out of the girl........ Love this place as it reminds me of my old stomping grounds in Lincoln Park in Chicago.   
Intrigued by the tiles on the ceiling and how some have small pieces missing and can't help but wonder if they landed in drinks over the years :)

Great place, great atmosphere.............
author: Julie Z.

description: A delicious hot spot for locals! There are several perrys in the Bay Area, but this one is my favorite. Great, friendly servers and delicious food. My favorite item on the menu is the fried potato skins.... Yum! One small caveat-- while perrys is delicious, it can be fairly expensive. Most entrees are around $15.
author: Barbara P.

description:
Super charming place.  I mean, where do you see a checkerboard table cloth and a single flower on your table anymore?  The breadstick thins were not my favorite (too dry, doesn't go well with butter), but they are complimentary so whatever.  I got the baby spinach salad, which was perfect--super filling, and just the right balance of sweet and citrus-y.  I also got a side of fries, which was humongous (couldn't even finish it), and the waitress brought me BBQ sauce when I asked for it.  She rocks.  BF got something I forgot what it was called...maybe the meatloaf but it was NOT a meatloaf.  The beef or roast or whatever it was was SO juicy and tender and it just melted in your mouth.  YUM.  I was jealous I didn't order that. 

Love that they put a Batkid newspaper cover as part of their wall of framed memorabilia!  Cute.
author: Jess H.

description:
I came here a month and a half ago with my visiting mom and brother. My brothers fall-off-the-bone tender, BBQ sauce smothered half rack of ribs ribs were amazecraze,  and my mom's French onion soup (suggested by yours truly) was sooo good. They use a good amount of a certain herb (thyme?) in the soup which gives the broth such a homey and rich quality, plus there is a ridiculous amount of gruyere baked on top (I am not complaining!) 

I ordered the special, which was a  prawn, alfredo fettuccine dish. It has just the right amount of prawns where I could even share some with my fam, the noodles were al dente, the sauce was buttery and garlicky. Yum! 

The waitress was so nice and attentive, too. I would bring anyone back here because I know the crowd is polite and the staff is well-trained, and the food is quality and flavorful.
author: Alanna R.

description: Visited a few times for lunch. Good food and service. Attentive while not being intrusive. Would recommend to try out.
author: J Y.

description:
This place has the WORST service and RUDEST staff members i've ever come across, especially being in the Marina. I came here on a Saturday night with a group of 6 girlfriends around 9pm. The bar was not crowded and there were several other tables that were not occupied. We just wanted to grab a quick drink, or a bottle of wine before our dessert reservations across the street at American Cupcake.

When we entered, we explained to the hostess that we just wanted to grab a drink at the bar, she did not look interested or welcoming, and just looked towards the bar area. She was more interested in having a conversation with her co-worker. When we walked into the bar, we sat ourselves at an empty round table, again there were several empty tables. When we sat down, a server walked up to us and the first thing she asked was "are you guys ordering food", no HELLO, or WELCOME, and she was very rude in the way she asked. We explained to her, just like we explained to the hostess, that we wanted to just order a bottle of wine and some drinks. She rudely took the menu's off the table and walked away. She did not even give us DRINK menu! We had to ask another girl in the bar area to give a drink menu...how the hell are we suppose to order a bottle of wine without a menu????? She returned with 1 menu for 6 people to share!!! At this point we were already irritated and wanting to leave, but we tried to stick it out and finally found some drinks and a bottle we wanted to order. As we wait for a server, another girl approaches our table and rudely explains to us that "if someone comes in wanting to order food, we have to kick you off this table". ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!! Not only was it after 9pm and your bar is only half full, but isn't your job in customer service? 

We had enough bitchiness, rudiness, and unwelcoming behaviour that we just walked out. If i could give NO STAR, i would. Don't waste your money here...that is if they even let you get that far!
author: Dessirea V.

description:
Perry's overall rating (3-stars) is pretty much in line with what to expect.  I eat at Perry's here and there.  I don't dislike it.  I just don't prefer it.  There's a lot of great places to eat around the Cow Hollow/Marina area.  Perry's sort of just feels like the neighborhood place you go to with a friend or with your parents when you don't feel like trying.  

The service and the workers at Perry's are all friendly.  It's the best quality of the place.  They also get by on the name brand recognition.  Perry's just IS part of San Francisco and their bar always seems to be buzzing.   

However, the food is okay.  Nothing truly stands out as amazing.  The burger is pretty tasty but not something I'd come here for specifically.  I do like the Prime Rib sandwich that they serve on Thursdays but it can sell out.  

The calamari is a good starter.

Overall, Perry's is as Yelp describes a 3-star rating:  A-OK.
author: Joe M.

description: Went back to perrys for the first time in six months and have to say the service is so much better. Much better experience this time around.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Decent. Pretty all-American. Had a salad, pretty okay. Tried the Mac and Cheese (my thing), and it wasn't great. It's an overpriced staple. 

That's about it...
author: Kristin F.

description: If you want old drunk married men to hit on you and rant about their brother is a SF cop, then I would go to Perry's. Also, BEAWARE! Dont leave your change in a glass on the table, because the manager will take it and say it belongs to the bar.
author: K A.

description: Excellent service, great ambiance, and superb food. (Home-made potato chips!) We are becoming regulars on Saturday afternoons.
author: Ibrahim S.

description: The service and ambiance at Perry's is impeccable however the flavor of the food portion sizes and pricing leave a lot to be desired. This is not a place I would visit again.
author: Catori D.

description:
I came to you for breakfast, the eggs florentine was not so bad
The next time, I ordered the huevos rancheros - it made me sad. 
The service is decent and the decor is pretty nice,
But unfortunately your food will not suffice.
