Oh Perry's, I think our time together has come to an end.  
But my best wishes, I will send...



In case you didn't like my elementary-style poem, the food here is quite disappointing.  It is cool how Perry's is one of the oldest places on Union St, being around for over 40 years, but I'm sure the food has gone downhill since then.
author: Juliana K.

description: Went here for lunch with a girlfriend yesterday and had a great experience. I had the steak salad and she had the southwest salad. Both were delicious! Our server was very friendly but could have been a little more attentive. I'm not a fan of the dry breadsticks they offer but, other than that, was really happy with my meal. I'll definitely come back again.
author: Tara M.

description:
I guess this is a San Francisco must, or so I'm told.  Honestly it was ok, service was pretty slow.  

We asked one of the Barista's if we could order, as she dropped off our drinks, then she said our server was on his way.  I guess she didn't signal him and just assumed he was coming to help us.  He walked right past us and on to the table next two us where two ladies were just chatting and had just received their drinks.  

Then he took our order, and our food came out pretty fast.  The wrong order at first for two of my friends, but after that they got it right.  

The food wasn't so bad, pretty good actually.  The Corned Beef Hash was different from Hawaii's Corned Beef Hash, but it still had plenty of flavor.
author: Kristin I.

description:
I had brunch here with a friend this past sunny Saturday to start off our little SF day trip!  After walking around the Marina look for a place that was more reasonable priced, we decided on Perry's.

We were seated outside on this beauuutiful day, which probably made our experience a zillion times better.  Yes, a zillion.

Mimosas which were good, but if you want me to really be a brat, it seems like it wasn't with real orange juice.  I personally like super pulpy orange juice with it, so if you like that too, don't order a mimosa here.  

The potato skin appetizer was enough to be an entree in itself!!  It was soooo good, and definitely worth the price ~$9 if you're sharing it with a bunch of people.

The eggs florentine was good, but it wasn't super flavorful... maybe because I just had the potato skins.  My friend and I split this dish because it comes with two + more potatoes.

We ordered a side of chicken apple sausage which was delicious (it comes with two), but not worth $4.50.

I don't think I'd come here again, but I enjoyed my experience overall :)  For the amount of food you get, the prices are reasonable... I definitely had a lot of leftovers!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Breakfast review.

Came here last Sunday with my girlfriend.  Snagged a table outside on Union Street.  If it's sunny, it's worth waiting a little bit for those seats.  

Pancakes - decent, but nothing spectacular.  3 cakes, rather small.  Didn't even come close to filling me up.

Eggs - scrambled eggs are good.  Had a texture that makes me wonder what they cooked them with (1 pound of butter, maybe).  Almost filled me up from the inadequate pancakes.

Eggs Florentine - had some of my g/f's egg Florentine.  Pretty good.  You won't be disappointed with it, except for the mediocre side of potatoes it comes with.  

Coffee - good enough.  

Service was on point.  Hostess, busser and server outside were friendly.  

Had a good time, except for the girl who dropped her ketchup-slopped fork on my g/f's shoe.  Restrained myself from asking her why is she wearing workout gear and drinking bloody marys?  Oh yes, this is Union Street.  Must let people know that you went for a run 3 hours ago.  

Cheers.
author: Dane P.

description:
Where do I begin? Came in today with a friend and sat at the bar, greeted by Nick who seemed friendly enough. I ordered a tequila NEAT and he poured into a shot glass, big difference. I casually asked him how long he'd been bartending as I'm a bartender and restaurant consultant, he said something like 15 years and that his resume "spoke for itself" 
We asked about some of the items on the menu, he was clueless. He said the calamari came in thin slices and that there weren't any tentacles (WRONG) His response was oh it was different last time I ordered it. We also each ordered a cup of soup(clam chowder and tomato)I got the pot roast and she a salad. Mr. my resume speaks for itself doesn't know how to course your meal as everything arrived at the same time. The tomato soup was so sweet that it was inedible, the pot roast was awful, bland and greasy aftertaste. I returned mine and we left shortly after. 
As a bartender and a representative of the restaurant you may not want to drop "F" Bombs so casually with every sentence. It's not a dive bar it's a family restaurant and I know that because another bartender had his 2 year old behind the bar. 
3 star reviews for a restaurant that's been there for 50 years? Kinda sad!! 
Nice enough guy but needs to learn the menu and lose the profanity. 
Best of luck going forward but I won't be back.
author: F G.

description: Stumbled upon this little gem while window shopping on Union. Not sure why there's only 3 stars. I had great service and the food was delicious! Had the beet and arugula salad with chicken added and the grilled artichoke which was fantastic! I'll definitely come here again if I'm in the neighborhood- saw a table eating chicken wings that looked delicious- need to try that next time!
author: Cora M.

description: I have been going to Perry's since the 1980s. It is a wonderful place with a great atmosphere - very San Francisco. The Apple Brown Betty will just about knock your socks off.
author: Robert B.

description:
I checked out Perry's with a friend for brunch one Sunday morning. Upon walking in, you're transported to a Cheers-like, neighborhood bar serving homely food.

The service was very prompt and friendly. We got there about 11:30am and it was fine, but the place definitely got crowded by 12:30pm-1pm, so keep that in mind. They take reservations also, so I'd definitely recommended making one for prompt seating.

I decided to order the huevos rancheros, and it was fantastic. Perry's unique twist on this dish was that it was served alongside an amazingly satisfying piece of homemade cornbread and a side of roasted house potatoes. Simply delish! Complemented with coffee, this was the perfect way to begin my Sunday!
author: Mansi A.

description:
We walked to Perry's from my cousins place nearby. 
We had 9:30 Brunch reservations today (Sunday) for myself, my cousin and her husband. 
It was already crowded when we arrived and when we left it was PACKED. Our waitress told us it was going to be an extremely busy day with the Niner game, the Giants game and apparently a big convention in town for Oracle.
We started off with Mimosa's, then coffee. For appetizers we had the grilled chicken quesadilla (which was good) and spicy wings (which I didn't care for at all).
For brunch I had the Veggie Scramble w/potatoes which I really liked. My cousin had the French Toast and her husband had a Cobb Salad, that looked delicious.
Service was somewhat slow but our waitress was very friendly.
The food here is just about average, nothing memorable.
Sadly I think Perry's better days are behind them. Years (and more years) ago our gang use to bar hop here almost every weekend. Those were the good ole days!  Ha!
They've been a San Francisco Staple on Union St for a very long time.
author: Janet T.

description:
Perry's has always been one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco and I've been going for years! The decor is awesome and it's a true San Francisco establishment. They serve the best Cobb salad in the city and the burger is killer! 

However I went to Perry's for lunch today and the new hostess (blonde) was extremely rude. I've always known Perry's hostess to be extremely nice! Very dissatisfied. 

With that being said Perry's is still the best and I'll be going back for years!
author: Meredith A.

description: This place has TERRIBLE service. The 60 year old bartender man was awful. He was a grumpy rude bitter old fart. The waitress had an attitude as well. The food was ok but considering there are way better places with way better service, steer clear of here!!!
author: Kendall L.

description: Old class + Modern finishes! The menu has many of the traditional staples w/ an avg. of $11 an entree. Friendly staff, light conversation and 70's music playing in the background.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Meh. 

It was ok. But not the best. 

Came for brunch on New Years Day. Didn't have to wait long for a table because our group got here before the big rush. 

The bloody mary hit the spot... a given considering the day... =)

The food left me wanting something more and/or more tasty. The potatoes were the best part of the breakfast for sure. My scramble (tortilla scramble??)  wasn't great. The eggs were burnt. I asked for sourdough toast and they gave me wheat. I ate the cold, butter-less, not crisp toast anyways without complaining because I was starving and the waitresses were slow moving. 

All in all.... I would come back for a drink. And i would continue walking down the street in search for a different brunch spot.
author: Ashley K.

description:
The word meh comes to mind. 

They need to work on their steak salad.
author: Angela B.

description: Sloe service, blasting air conditioning on a cold day, Ok food (but not great), crowded, loud. And seriously challenged service. Not a repeat place for us.
author: Joanell S.

description: Have come here twice out of necessity - it's just like a TGIFridays: reliable food, crowded, slow, and corny. A little overpriced. Not sure why it's always so busy when there are other places around but hey, I guess I've had to go twice too. It's one of those places you go when no one can decide what they want to get, because they have all the old favorite dishes. Will try to avoid in future.
author: Sarah B.

description: Still a great stand by place for lunch. Good salads and always a great burger. Don't forget the French onion soup too. Consistent food,  great service, casual dining.
author: Calvin J.

description: I like going down to Perry's for a casual cocktail and entree. I really look forward to their margaritas. I usually order top shelf margaritas, but the house margaritas here do the trick. My husband and I enjoyed the quesadillas and enchiladas. Funny that we find ourselves eating Mexican food there. That's what's great about Perry's though, they have a little bit of everything!
author: Karin R.

description:
Came here for brunch with my running buddies, who have a lot of nostalgia for the place and fun memories of the Perry's to Perry's races the restaurant used to sponsor.

I would never have believed the place was so large-- definitely a good choice for groups.  We were given a table in the atrium area, which was beautiful on such a sunny day.  Loved that the brunch menu was about twice as large as our usual brunch haunts (three types of eggs benedict- yay.)  

Simple food with no surprises, but still pretty good.  The eggs blackstone were delicious, though my accompanying potatoes were mushy.  Blueberry pancakes with maple syrup were awesome though.  Huge portions.  

Loved that the bar was packed at 10AM on a Saturday morning!
author: Joanne G.

description: Went here on August 3rd with my boyfriend after buying a pair of $350 lampshades. He was in a weird mood. Said "it's a middle-age thing". He got blue crab cakes and I got eggs Benedict. We just stared at the walls cluttered with sports bar shit. Sports bar shit.
author: Valerie J.

description:
I have to write another review on Perry's since Marge (the owner) responded to my 1-star review last time. She was apologetic, offered explanation, and asked us to give it another try offering us a small incentive so we went back. 

This time we avoided ordering the same things and ordered their classics like club sandwich, buffalo wings, and soup of the day. All were good and congrats on the spicy buffalo wings! It was pretty spicy so thumbs up to that! 

Perry redeemed itself to me because the owner cared to respond. Kudos to her!
author: Judy F.

description: Wound up in here on a Saturday afternoon because I was A) starving, and B) looking for somewhere with a tv that was showing the Giants game.  I ended up having the burger and fries and was satisfied with my meal.  The burger was good, but also didn't surpass another averagely good burger.  The waitress was very nice and attentive, the atmosphere was chill, and overall I had no complaints.  I guess it does kind of give off an Applebees type vibe, but a little more homely.
author: Kristen F.

description: Hands down the best clam chowder I've found between here and Maine. So many clams it's ridiculous. Where do they find 'em? The isn't potato soup. This is CLAM Chowder. The Maine Lobsters on Wed. nights are spectacular, as well. I might as well throw in the Filet Mignon sandwich. Whew! If you haven't tried the chowder yet, I would recommend you get on it!
author: Tom D.

description:
Such a wonderful staple in Cow Hollow. I love Perry's, for brunch, for lunch, for dinner, for wine, to watch a game, honestly it's such a "welcome home" spot. Good food (burgers especially). 

Wonderfully large back room area with a clear roof which is perfect for a large party. Staff is always friendly and chipper, which always makes me happy :) Love watching games here, as it's usually pretty adult and filled with sexy older men. A bit more waspy than most bars in the area.
author: Meredith M.

description:
Perry's has all the staples for basic lunch or brunch. It won't dazzle you and it feels a little '80s dated but the food will satisfy. 

It's fun to go on a Sunday for breakfast and pick out the post-evening successful hook ups vs. the ones wishing they hadn't stayed the night.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Boring American food and nothing spectacular.  It's decent and a consistent 3 star restaurant. Good place to sit outside though. 

Go for 1/2 off wine nights and happy hour
author: VIOLA L.

description:
Perry's is a good place to get acceptable food and cocktails at a reasonably price in a great location. 

-Enchiladas were just okay. Any decent Mexican place would have been better. 
-Spicy buffalo wings were great- would order those again to start.

Come here when you want a casual bite to eat/drink with a group of friends. Go elsewhere if you are looking for a big night out on the town
author: Bryan H.

description: The food is sometimes ok, sometimes not great, but the service has always been good for us and it's a comfortable restaurant. Maybe come here for a drink and an appetizer rather than a meal.
author: Brianna C.

description:
simple, straightforward, good food and drinks deserving of 4 stars for consistency, good quality and flavors...  But man-o-man the service (lack there of) has reminded me each end every time I go there why I am not a regular, even though it's 3 blocks from my house.    It's to the point where it is flat aggravating how either poorly trained the servers are or more likely, what dim-wits the managers are for not staying on the service training with them.  I get the sense that so many of them have either been there so long that they feel invincible or flat don't care enough to to be attentive to their tables.  

Shame on the Perry's management team for letting what could/should be a staple in the neighborhood slide away slowly as more and more of us lifelong locals watch it crumble.

The brunch food is steadily fantastic.  The simple Perry's Burger is another shining star.  Casual good eats, marred by unprofessional, unapologetic and untrained servers.
author: A R.

description:
My mom and I were walking down Union looking for a place for lunch and that's when we found Perry's. At first glance...it had a family feel to me. Very warm and inviting. We were greeted by a nice man at the host's desk and were immediately brought to a table. From then on...great service and food happened. My mom and I both ordered sandwiches, nothing too fancy, but the flavors were there and the portion sizes were fantastic. Prices were also very reasonable for the neighborhood.

Overall...a lovely restaurant within beautiful Marina. I will definitely be back again soon.
author: Dru M.

description: Pretty good on a weekday -- seems like a restaurant that has a lot of SF history, which is always a plus. The filet was tasty, too -- good spot!
author: Mel G.

description:
Meh.  I had better.  Ordered pot roast with mash taters and veggies.  Veggies and taters were good, but the highlight should have been the pot roast - it was dry and chewy.  It seemed to me that the problem obvious, the cut of meat they used is too lean.  They need to use a piece with more well marbled fat in it so that it is tender and juicier.  Just cooking it longer would not have helped (well, maybe only a little).  They serve hard dry bread sticks instead of soft sourdough - bunk alternative.  Kind of mediocre place for the money, in my opinion.  Quite noisy.  Good Calamari, though.

I would give it three stars since the service and some of the food was good, but the pot roast and the asking prices were too much, to me.  3 Stars would give the impression I thought it was "good", but honestly, I would not go back unless it was the only place open and needed to eat.
author: Ken B.

description: Great place great service! The Cobb salad is to die for! Great taste! Right when you walk in the hostesses are fantastic. Extremely nice and welcoming. Great place to have a good lunch. One of the hostesses, Nichole has a great and bubbly personality, brightened my day! Thank you so much continue the great service!
author: Jerome R.

description: Haven't been there for 30 years, but decided to meet friends for Saturday lunch/brunch and really enjoyed it. A little noisy, but the food was fresh and good. The desserts were really exceptional. Service from Andrea was a real plus--professional, knowledgeable, cheerful and responsive without being overbearing. A really pleasant experience.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Came for brunch with friends (4 people total) and had a great time.  We were sitting in the conservatory in the back.  There are only a few tables in this room, but it feels super spacious because it's so light and airy.  The food was normal-good, nothing special, service was fine too (which is the reason for the 3 stars).  

Do make a reservation if you decide to go because it gets crowded at weird times.  Also, watch out for the strollers in the entry.  It's like a stroller farm.  Woo.
author: Olivia L.

description:
This place kind of reminds me of Harry's on Fillmore - you go here because of the outside seating, not the food. My friend lives down the block and has a dog so we try to come here on weekends when the weather is nice. The food is nothing special and the bloody mary's pretty much suck, but there are tables outside. 

I had a burger and a bloody on Sunday. I kept comparing the bloody mary to the ones at the Crab Shack and it didn't even rank. It had no celery and tasted like vodka and mary mix. The burger was cooked very nicely and was pretty delicious, but really nothing out of the ordinary. 

Service was OK for us although one table got up and left saying they had been waiting for an hour and never got their food. We think the time was a bit of an exageration but who knows? Overall, a good spot for a nice sunny day although don't expect too much out of the food.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I use Yelp all the time to read reviews, but have never written one until now.  Don't get me wrong, I like the vibe of outside seating, I don't mind marina restaurants/crowds etc.  But what I do mind is mice and rude people.  A mouse.  Disgusting.  When I went inside to get the manager, not only was he not going to come outside b/c "What do you expect me to do about it?" When he finally got outside, he saw the mouse (which would not leave where our table was) and said, "Yep, it's a mouse." and walked back inside.  I have never in my life experience such a lack of customer service / care / or any interest in their patrons.  Comical. 

Reminded me of the time they got a score of 52 for their inspection in '08.  Remember that?  http://sf.eater.com/archives/2008/02/14/eaterwire_perrys_flunks_health.php 

Disgusting on every level.
author: Kim S.

description: Good comfort food and service. Reasonably priced. Staff is good, and it has an old-school San Francisco feel.
author: Danny O.

description: My boyfriend and I made a reservation at 6:30 last night, and unfortunately we couldn't make it till 7:00 due to traffic and parking. I thought our reserved table would be long gone for sure..especially since the Giants game was on and it was packed. Turns out they still kept a table for us and we had an amazing time. We ordered the calamari, which had a nice light and crispy batter...sweet potato fries, chicken enchiladas, and the pot roast. All of it was delicious and we had excellent service the entire time!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Went here for brunch today.  We had a large group so that always can throw some kinks into things but still had some troubling service issues.  Service: It was crowed, we had a reservation but were seated late.  Food took a long time.  Several guests ordered toast.  One piece was completely back so the guest asked for another piece.  The waitress had to come back and ask for "proof" for the new toast.  Perrys when you start doubting your customers over a slice of bread you just look cheap and pathetic.  Other guests toast look like it had barely been toasted - it was a little thing but a signifier of some key issues.  Waitress forgot a few of our items, coffee had grounds in it and food was mediocre.  

Not going back.
author: Victoria H.

description:
I just can't bring myself to give more stars. I've been to Perry's twice, to make sure the first time wasn't just an "off day". Both for dinner, I've never had lunch or brunch here.

Problems:
1. The food veers from palatable to stale to rather gross. You get the sense that this long-established spot just gave up trying.

2. Service occasionally swoops in from outer space, and then disappears, to be never seen again. 

I wish I could be a part of the solution but I just cannot believe that today's Perry's is the same as the popular Perry's of yore. If you're sitting here, I'm going to assume you just moved to the area or are a tourist. And I pray for you.
author: Holden P.

description: This is our go to place in Cow Hollow for brunch or lunch and a drink.  Unlike nearby places its not millennial only, friendly crowd, helpful servers and bartenders, food is dependably good.
author: P S.

description:
Food was average, while the management was very poor.  We ordered a bottle of wine that we're familiar with, have purchased it from stores often, but the wine they provided was of a different year (2011, not 2010) than what was advertised on the menu!...I verified this by asking for the menu back.  The wine tasted drastically different, for the worse, than the wine we expected, i.e. the actual wine ordered!  Given that we're paying an extreme markup on this wine ($44 + tip, for a bottle we've purchased in stores for $14), I was not willing to bite this bullet.  If the 2011 wine would have tasted no different than the 2010 we expected, then I never would have thought anything of it, but it was much different!  Anyone with even a novice understanding of wine knows that one year to the next can make a drastic difference on the wine quality.

When addressing this problem during my first glass of wine, the manager (a blonde woman) was initially refusing to correct the situation and was very rude in her effort to explain why.  Our discussion with the manager was after she made the poor waitress try telling us there would be no adjustment to the check.  We immediately felt unwelcome and had no desire to continue dining, even when the manager finally agreed to help after my continued complaint and explanation of why this was not okay.  It was too late, the damage was done.  We never even heard the words "sorry" or "apologize" come from the manager's mouth.  In fact, instead of apologizing, she told us we should have addressed the problem earlier into the bottle!  I remind you, my wife and I were in the middle of our first glasses when I spoke with the waitress about it.  Coming from a family of restaurant owners and managers, I considered the handling of this situation a management 101 mistake.  In any well run restaurant, this blonde woman manager would be considered for termination.  We won't be returning here and we'll advise all friends and family visiting San Francisco likewise.
author: Chad G.

description:
I was really disappointed by this place :( and it's to bad because I had heard good things. 

I took 2 out of town guests here and I wish I had picked better SF fare. Its too bad because I love the location and laid back bar feel, but the food was awful and the service was horribly slow. 

Just stick to the basics - quesadilla or something fried and you'll be fine. Don't try to order anything with fish or too gourmet - I think that's where we went wrong.
author: Katie K.

description:
Alright Perry's, What I know is that I know what I'm going to get when I choose you! Standard, overpriced, a pitch fancier bar food. And HEY, Guess what... I enjoy it every time. 

You know why? You're a classic, a San Francisco Staple, a gathering place of friends, an "everyone knows your name" type of place.

I occasionally change up my order to shoot for something healthy, but seriously a $10 spinach salad the size of my fist. Paleaze...! But delicious none the less. 

Perry's is a home run for good company, good service and an all around good time. But beware, the plumbing is old and can't handle more then a tinkle. The sign says so! 

Enjoy!
author: Dee C.

description:
Stopped into Perry's on Saturday for lunch....my friend and I ordered a hamburger, a Reuben sandwich and the baked ziti. They were all delicious!! The service was excellent as well , and the vibe was friendly.... 
It's location is great, right in the heart of the cool Union area... Check it out!
author: Alisa F.

description:
I've been here a few times now, once for dinner and 3 times for brunch/lunch.

In my opinion, it's a great brunch spot if you get a table that is near a window or exposed to sunlight - great way to start the day.  No complaints about the service really, although the food did take a little bit of time to be served.  The mimosas are delicious, and today I had the Eggs Blackstone which I thought was pretty darn tasty.  I've had a few different omelettes here before as well and they were good, nothing mindblowing but then again, I don't think I've ever had an omelette that I constantly dream about (has anyone?).  Overall though, this is a solid option for brunch, though I wouldn't make a beeline for here on the reg.

As for dinner, I've had their burger before. It was alright, but I remember feeling really sick a few hours later, so I will definitely not be ordering that again.
author: Laura C.

description:
The Hang over cure!

This place is always busy for some reason. I arrived during brunch on a packed Sunday. There's something classy about a joint where the wait and tend staff wear ties. Especially when they're done up in full Windsors! 

I had the good fortune of gaining exposure to this 40 year old restaurant/bar from a very reputable marina local. 

We were seated at the bar and started with a couple of fine Bloody Mary's crafted by Bob, a skilled and knowledgeable tender of the drink. The brunch menu was well populated with a wide array of entrees. I ordered the Eggs Blackstone, a variation of the Eggs Benedict with tomatoes and Hobbs bacon added. Needless to say, excellent! I think I'll throw in the blueberry pancakes next time as well. They have great buffalo wings too. 

For some reason I'm sure I'll be partaking in Perry's again. Sooner rather then later.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Go in with low expectations and you'll be just fine.
Typical Marina-Union St scene.  Average food, ok prices.  Not worth a special trip, but if you're on Union and can't decide what you want to eat, this has enough variety.
I had the Vegetable Fritatta, and it was ok.  not sure what the vegetables were that actually were in the eggs, though.  They had been chopped to such a teeny size that I had to go on color.
Service was fine and attentive.
author: Tobin S.

description:
I'm pretty sure this place at one time had a reputation for something-or-other.  Certainly my only knowledge of what it might have been comes from meager references in Tales of the  City.  Whatever it was, it wasn't obvious on my visit recently.

It was a weeknight, and it was very packed.  Our table was in the back, away from the bar so it was bit more quiet.  

The service was great.  The host staff were smiling and friendly, and our waiter was prompt and gracious, which for some reason seems to be a rare quality these days.  

The menu was American, and not very inventive.  However the fried calamari was quite crunchy and delicious.  Not sure that I should be advocating super-sized meals, but the portions were a bit small.  Let's just say the portion size to price ratio was a bit small.

I won't make any specific comments about the clientele, but if you know San Francisco, you know already know what Union St is all about.
author: Ken B.

description: Always great service, bartenders, food, drinks, and half priced bottles of wine 2 days out of the week~ This is my go-to restaurant on any given day! Perry's Never disappoints :-)
author: Lindsey P.

description:
Classic American food in the Marina. It's not really a San Francisco place, in that there's nothing too fancy or out of the ordinary. It actually reminds me of a restaurant I'd fine in my hometown of Nashville. So, if you're tired of sushi, organic vegetables, free-range meat and chicken, and french sounding entrees, Perry's is great for a familiar meal.

I had an awesome prime rib sandwich lunch special a few weeks ago though it was a little pricey for what you got (~$15). I also remember an excellent chicken dinner, again like something I'd find at home. 

Perry's is in prime location right in the heart of the marina on Union St. I wouldn't recommend it before a night out, unless you've got a few hours to rest and digest before you play some beer pong over at Bar None. Good looking hostesses is also a plus.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Made our reservations on OpenTable and came in on a Wednesday morning for breakfast - there was absolutely no one in the place.  I was beginning to think that this may not be a good idea if they were already open and nobody was in here.  We got a seat next to the window and ordered breakfast.  Surprisingly, the eggs benedict I had was cooked perfectly, what a treat.  I forget what my hubby had, but who cares, I know he liked whatever he had, ha!  Would like to come back and enjoy more.  Like!
author: Emy B.

description: Stopped in for appetizers and soup before an art show. There was really nothin' exciting about Perrys but I enjoyed it. Our group had the chicken wings, potato skins and I had a bowl of soup. All in all it was good but not spectacular!
author: Kimberly T.

description:
walked past this place a gazillion times. today i was across the street blowing my wad on jewelry. had about 30 minutes for lunch with a girlfriend and decided today was the day to try it!!

so, not sure what the usual weekday lunch crowd was but there were two tables of young professionals and the rest were "mature". if you are here for the typical cow hollow "scene", you ain't gonna get it at lunch!

i had the chinese chicken salad. it was interesting. nice touch with noodles under the vegetables. however the chicken was SALTY!!! it had been marinated in soy sauce for way too long. i couldn't finish allthe  chicken was is too bad because i needed my protein. 

maybe i would have had more fun on a weekend with lots of mimosas!! 

not dying to come back soon but the patrons seemed to be pretty hapy with their meals.
author: joyce l.

description:
This place is outright awesome! Very high quality food, exceptional service in an old world enviornment. In fact my Uncle used to drink at this bar all the time. Highly recommend the Perry's Club Sandwich ($11). They house roast their own turkey for all sandwiches,very fresh and very good. I'm a regular there.

Parking is kind of a hassle on union street though.
author: Joe K.

description: If I could I would eat here everyday, homies at the bar are dialed in. The pulled pork sandwich is as good as it gets in the city. Perry's never disappoints.
author: Ian O.

description: We've been here a handful of times over the last month or so. Aside from it being near home and having a heated patio (so that our dog can join us), they have a varied menu and a lot of what I would call, "comfort" food. It is not fancy or terribly expensive, just really satisfying when you're in the mood for some burger sliders and cheese fries, or some buffalo chicken tenders. Stuff like that. Not to mention the desserts are great and the drink menu is pretty varied as well. Funny story...we were in the mood for a margarita, so we went to a nearby neighborhood bar only to be completely unsatisfied with a sour and weak margarita. We walked over to Perry's and figured we'd try one of theirs. It was GREAT. We have also indulged in their martinis and they were satisfying as well. Considering we have lived in the neighborhood for several months now, I'm so pleasantly surprised that the one restaurant we hadn't tried yet, Perry's, will become one of our regular spots.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Absolutely love Perry's! It's been our local bar for over 10 years. The food is good and the service is excellent!  They appreciate the repeat customers or regulars and that's what I love about it the most! Some faves of mine are the Chicken BLT, the potato skins, and artichokes. As for drinks, a Ramos Fizz is a MUST if you come to Perry's. This place has a home like feel and if you sit at the bar, the bartenders are always friendly and meeting the other patrons is always an experience as well. There are many regulars that hang out at the bar and if you're lucky, you can hear the many stories of experiences they've had at Perry's!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I was walking down Union trying to find a place to eat brunch with my boyfriend when we stumbled upon this place. EXCEPT we didn't eat here because everyone inside looked ridiculously depressed. It was strange. 

We ended up eating dinner here another night in the middle of the week.  Service was good - our waiter was very attentive and polite. The food was sub-par.. My spinach tagliarini was a generous sized portion, but it had nearly no flavor even tho it was full of sauce,  tomatoes, mushrooms, pine nuts.. etc. My boyfriend said the meatloaf was just alright. 

I would probably give this place 2 stars for the dishes we got but I'm going to +1 because the Tomato Bisque was very good and its a very nice restaurant!
author: Allie E.

description: Horrible service. Horrible food, then to top this awful experience off, the bus boy began to set up the table next to me, flinging the table cloth so vigorously that all the lint, crumbs and dust from the table all landed in everything in front of me. I wasn't bummed that my food was officially ruined, but I was drinking the orange juice and tried to have some cold toast and rock hard butter so breakfast wasn't a complete bust. When I say complete bust, I'm being extremely generous. Never again. The Perry's on embarcadero gets 3 stars from me.
author: Shari S.

description: the omelets here are in a word, pathetic...seriously???  you dont use real eggs?  they taste like microwaved eggs made from powder, not sure how they thought this was a good idea and still charge a premium for this place.  Definitely not a place to go for breakfast.
author: christopher h.

description:
Brunch here was not good.  My potatoes were soggy and took FOREVER to come. I was starting to wonder if my reflection in the mirror was a portrait of Dorian Gray.  I was tapping the table but I started getting arthritis.

For brunch, I had the eggs benedict.  My potatoes came out totally soggy and it took a long time to come out.  I was in a hurry.  They said it would take 10 minutes for food to come out, before I decided to eat Perry's.  10 minutes turned into 35 minutes.  This is not a problem if I'm not in a hurry, but since I was, and the condition upon which I ate there being that they could put food out in a short period of time, this was a huge problem.  To top it off, the potatoes had a strange flavor to them, as if it had been boiled (rather roasted) in something with kale or some other vegetable.  It looked like it belonged in soup, not next to my egg bennies, which were also below average.
author: Erika C.

description: Spare of the moment ... Im usually on point wit the restaurant i pick... But not this one... The waitress was super friendly, the food .... Sliders were good... Buffalo wings  were good but how do you mess up a Caesar salad ? Not having fresh lettuce ... I had to actually return it cause the lettuce was already turning brown... This place was okay but i probably wouldnt come back:(
author: jeannette L.

description:
I went here for a Sunday brunch with family. I have never been there before but from the moment you walk in you get the feeling of an "establishment". The place is fantastically located and was busy.

Seating was a little tight but the food and drinks came quick enough. The burger that I had was good. Not as great as some I have had but very good still.

After I finished and went off somewhere else I returned for a few more beers later in the day, again it was enjoyable and the atmosphere was very pleasant. I would definitely go again but there was nothing fantastically memorable about it.
author: Ross H.

description:
Good place to watch the game. Never been here for dinner only Brunch/Lunch. 

The food was good, pretty average American bar good - nothing to rave about, nothing to complain about. Good selection so you won't have trouble finding something to order.

Service was good as well! Great spot to hang out on a Saturday afternoon, can get a little crowded though.
author: Alison M.

description:
We've been returning customers of Perry's for quite some time now and it's really hit or miss. I would say the ratings really depend on your server. Today, our waitress was a miss. 

Outdoor seating is always prime on a sunny afternoon in San Francisco, so that worked out nicely today. The food is always consistent and the condiments are normal. No surprises here. The downside was our waitress. She was nice and could memorize our orders without a writing it down - something I always found a bit impressive, but also a bit precarious. Our dishes came out fine. The part that peeved me though was that while I was still eating my lunch with my plate still in front of me, she asks if I was ready for a dessert menu or some coffee. Really? Do you think I'm ready to have dessert while I'm still on my main course? Go away. The one time there isn't a line for the outdoor seating, the waitress has to push me to my next course. Other times, there could be a party taking up to of their precious outdoor tables just drinking water after their meal. What the hell, Perry's?
author: NickJess S.

description: Looking for a decent spot on Union Street and happened on this place. Pretty standard fare on the menu, calamari, wings, quesadillas and the like. But if you're trying to sop up a few drinks, it'll do. Hell of a Bloody Mary here though!
author: Janette W.

description:
The manager here is a jerk.

We made reservations for an outside table, calling to confirm in the early evening. When we arrived (early), the manager told us that the table wasn't available and seated us inside. When the table freed up, we asked to move outside. The manager proceeded to cop a huge attitude, telling us how he didn't make any mistake, how it was our fault that we didn't the table, and to "let him run the restaurant". I told him that his attitude wasn't appropriate.

Two minutes later the manager stormed over to our table, telling us off, calling me an a**hole, pointing his finger at us, etc. The conversation *stopped* in the bar. I've never seen anything like it in a restaurant. Our waitress apologized. She even told me that she would comp my drink (which didn't happen).

Maybe Perry's could post his work schedule on the website so we know when not to go back?
author: Matthew S.

description: Came for dinner in February with a friend as the other spots on Union street were packed and required a wait. We were both disappointed with food at Perry's. Ahi sandwich and steak sandwich were not tasty at all. Onion soup was so so at best. Sweet potato fries were the only thing I enjoyed. I might go back for a drink but wouldn't order food here again.
author: Natalia F.

description: A nice little spot for a quick meal and a beer or cocktail. I always get the chili and the chicken Quesidilia. The staff is very friendly and the service is on point. They get busy so you may have a short wait!
author: daniel c.

description:
I called in and picked up my order here within 15 minutes. One star is because I didn't have to wait for my food, even though it was busy.  The other is for the soup which was quite good. However the club I ordered was ice cold and the fries that came with, cold and soggy. I've had many many clubs, and this tastes like it sat in the fridge for an hour and they gave me someone elses fries.

I won't be back.
author: Meg T.

description:
Made reservations for 8 people at Perry's for dinner.  When we arrived, 5 minutes before our reservation, the wait staff told us they had a table set up for us but just took it apart and needed a few minutes to put it back together.  Not sure what that was all about but it didn't take long. 

We tried a bunch of appetizers, spicy buffalo wings and tenders, grilled chicken quesadilla, calamari, and potato skins.  Your typical bar menu but everything was cooked and seasoned great, we enjoyed all of them.   

Shared the grilled ahi sandwich for the main which I think had mayonnaise on it that I would rather leave off next time.  Ginger gave the sandwich a fresh taste.  

This looks like a really old bar with a dirty tiled floor and dark wood.  Guess that's part of it's charm, good food, decent service but isn't anything to write home about.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Perry's is a 100% waste of prime real estate. They are lucky they've been around/have sort of a name because there is absolutely nothing about Perry's that should make you want to choose it over anywhere else. Cobb salads. Burgers. The basic sans any kind of thought. Fits the marina lame-homogeneity a little too well.

And our waitress thought our request for a drink menu was bizarre.
author: Joanne S.

description:
I used to come to this location of Perry's at least once a week.  This was when my best friend was working down the street, of course =P.  The place is never too packed, so we NEVER had to wait for a table.  The staff was very attentive and made frequent visits to our table.

I've tried their fried chicken (very crunchy, but I like eating fried chicken in the comfort of my own home with plenty of rice and ketchup), chicken sandwich (the chicken sometimes, but rarely, came out a little try for me, but I would just use a lot of ketchup to help the taste), their potato skins (delicious!), burger (nothing new), mushroom sandwhich (yumm!  very juicy.), aaaaannnnnddddd a bunch of other foods -- let me spare you on each and every one of my feelings towards each one.  My top three choices would probably be the cornbeef hash, chicken blt w/avocado, and the potato skins =).  Enjoy!
author: Pia V.

description: Don't let the three stars fool you. This place is a good place to stop on after a day of shopping. This is not a typical trendy SF bar but instead somewhere you can kick back and relax. The bar tender pours a stiff drink so you will not be disappointed with their Manhattan's and Old Fashioned drinks. The service was great and the seared ahi tuna was also good. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Erica C.

description: Meh. It's okay. Average food. Why go here when there are a million better options down the street?
author: Laura D.

description: Meh, quite possibly one of the most dried out pieces of chicken ever...
author: Leanne S.

description:
I love Perry's, and have been going there for over 20 years.

Recently, I wrote a review of Perry's Cheeseburger on my blog (http://mitchellschneider.wordpress.com/), and here are parts of it...

Perry's has been a Bay Area institution for over 40 years. And while their menu boasts a number of delicious items, Perry's is best known for it's hamburger. I couldn't think of a better place to sample my first cheeseburger of 2011 than at Perry's, and per usual, I was not disappointed.

I went on a Sunday afternoon, and the bar area was jammed with post-New Year's Day revelers. They put me at a table in the rear of the restaurant - which I wasn't all that pleased with since there's not much of a scene in the back - but I should have known better... the place is always full on the weekends.

One of the great things about dining at Perry's is their ample supply of breadsticks and butter they place on your table before the meal (and all of this is complimentary, though sometimes you have to ask for them). The breadsticks are awesome, and if you're not careful, these blissful sticks-o-bread can derail your appetite before your main course comes. I did help myself to a few breadsticks, but in anticipation of my killer burger, I went easy on them.

My Perry's bacon-cheeseburger-with-fries came out about 20 minutes after I ordered it, and when it finally arrived, I was stoked. The first thing you notice about their burger is its presentation - it's simply beautiful. The burger occupies about half of the oval plate, with the garnish and fries taking up the rest. And the burger is big - it stands a good three inches on the plate, and the whole entire dish looks classy against the checkered blue tablecloth that Perry's has employed for decades.

Perry's doesn't skimp on fries - which I love - and they bury a sliced dill pickle alongside the burger which is also a treat.

Everything about the meal was perfect, EXCEPT the mini bowl of ketchup that they place on the plate... I hate this. Why do restaurants do this? Just make life easy for everyone, and put a bottle of Heinz on the table... do it.

After dressing my burger with ketchup, and re-applying some onions and lettuce that had fallen to the side, I picked up my cheeseburger with both hands and went for it. The first bite is really something: you taste the cooked bun, burger meat, cheddar cheese and bacon in one fell swoop, and it's all fantastic. The meat is juicy with a great taste; the bacon is crispy; and the cheese balances everything else without overpowering you. This was exactly what I wanted, and why Perry's is so beloved.

The next few bites are just as good, and impressive for the following reasons:

-The burger, though big, stays together (whereas other burgers that size often fall apart in clumps)
-The bun-to-meat ratio is money; there's plenty of bun to hold everything together, but not enough to make you feel you're consuming an entire baguette
-There are actual meaty strips of "Hobbs" bacon on the burger, rather than smaller 1-2 inch strips placed unceremoniously atop the meal
-The garnish is fresh (which isn't always the case)

The Perry's burger takes about ten to 12 minutes to consume (though I eat pretty quickly), and each bite is really a treat. If you're like me, you save your fries 'til the very end, and, like the burger, are also impossible to put down.
author: Mitch S.

description:
I guess this review had to happen at some point. I am obsessed with Perry's. My love affair began a year and a half ago when I went to the one off Embarcadero for breakfast. SO GOOD.
I feel like the answer to "where should we eat?" is inevitably always Perry's. Their breakfast, dinner, appetizers, desserts, beer selection, waiters, bartenders, ambiance, etc. etc. is awesome awesome AWESOME! 
Perry's on Union is a SF staple, its been there a looong time! My dad said he used to go there back in the 70's and it was great then too. I couldn't agree more! We watched the Giants clinch the pennant here and when Brian Wilson threw that last strike, the bartender hopped up on the bar and gave us a champagne shower and then immediately began setting up free whiskey shots. One of the best nights I've had in the city, thank you Perry's!
author: Kenzie P.

description:
Review based on throwing a large party at Perry's:

I hosted a birthday party (party of 14 or so) here the other night for a friend. We planned a month or so in advance and worked with the party planner on site (Mollie) to see what our options were. She was very helpful, and knowledgable about the options we had.

When it came time for the night of the party she was not there, but other staff helped us out with our requests. They seemed to be knowledgable about our party as well which was great.

We had customized menus, brought in our own cake (there is a cakeage fee), and had a few select wines waiting for us in the back patio room we reserved. Tables were already nicely set up, and we were allowed to bring in our own decorations as well.

I was quite pleased with the readyness of the room, staff, etc. The appetizers we ordered (guacamole and tuna tacos tasted pretty good). The appetizers themselves came to $105 and I did not think for the amount we got it was worth that much, but no need to complain, as we had many guests, and that would be tacky.

We were told that 2 of the girls attending could split a meal and we would only be charged for one of theirs. We ended up being charged for both anyways, but again, I didn't want to complain in front of the guests. It was mentioned before the party, it should have been handled. It's too bad it wasn't. The party total cost ended up being WAY above what I thought it would be (some people did order hard alcohol which was not one of the options so that's probably part of the reason).

The food was just okay. I ordered the clam chowder (good), and the petrole sole with rice and veggies (meh). I've had better. But the party itself was quite enjoyable, which made up for the so-so food.

All in all, it was a great party, the staff was wonderful, the organization was great, the place itself looked amazing, only a few mishaps with the bill, and the cost was very pricey (about $62 a person if not more including tip and alcohol).

I'd still recommend to a friend to plan a party here if they were in need of a place, but I'd suggest to look elsewhere to find other options before they decide as this is the only place in SF I've hosted a party thus far.
author: Ashley D.

description: The veggie burger isn't as good as it used to be, but there are lots of vegetarian options. Consistently good in the last 20some years I've been going there.
author: Jane D.

description: Went here on a Tuesday night with a friend. Our server Sean was nice enough, but mixed up our credit card payments. We asked him to fix it, and his head server took over. The head server was EXTREMELY rude, snatching receipts out of our hands, rolling his eyes, and throwing up his arms walking away. I asked him to calm down a bit and he verbally attacked me. We told the GM afterwards, and the reaction we got was "So what, what do you want me to do about it?" from the GM!!!!! Are you SERIOUS Perry's? Over a dinner that was probably less than $30 (and average at best). Now you have lost my business, my friend's business, and I am telling everyone I know how much your service sucks. Too bad. Thank God there are plenty of great spots on Union so I don't have to go here again.
author: Ally F.

description:
Hung over today and wanted some great eggs benedict. You will not find it here.

It's a great restaurant in theory, huge interior, tv's to look at, lots of pictures. But it's overpriced average food.

Wings were delicious... but my eggs benedict were undercooked, soggy, and drenched in a terrible hollandaise. The ham was a thick piece of something I would find in a terrible cafeteria- gross. And my friend got a club sandwich that tasted like nothing really. The food is barely average for San Francisco standards... and overpriced. 

Save your money and get food somewhere else that actually tastes good.
author: Annette K.

description: Don't let the allure of outdoor tables fool you. The food is not good and the service is a joke. I guess there were only 2 servers for the entire restaurant...at lunch time! Had to hunt down someone just to get a refill! Don't order the Chinese chicken salad. It's a mayonnaisy heap of slop with a few pieces of chicken thrown in.  Very disappointing experience.
author: Hockey M.

description:
My parents introduced me to this place when I was about two years old, and as kids, my sisters and I loved to be entertained by the endless amounts of articles and paraphernalia about sports (specifically bay area ones:)) on the wall. 
As we got older, I couldn't help but to fall in love with their incredible eggs benedict, which I cannot recommend highly enough. 
And then as we entered our twenties, my parents finally revealed Perry's biggest secret, one they had been saving til the time was right-- the best hangover cure in the world-- their Bloody Mary's. 
So as a kid, a teen, and an adult, this place has been an incredible place to eat, look around, and feel better:)
author: Molly M.

description: following the specials...half off wine at union street perry's on monday and thursday...steuart street perry's on tuesdays and saturdays...union street parking difficult and taking a cab...fumble in reservations and taking a table far back....familiar crunchy breadsticks and butter to munch...starting with ahi tacos...ultra crispy toasty wonton taco shells a good compliment to well seasoned ahi tuna...a bottle of j pinot gris priced $forty regular, but only $twenty on half off...taking the union street thursday special...prime rib sandwich and substituting mashed potatoes for fries....nice thick slab of prime rib smothered in gravy between two standard buns...mountain of fresh hot french fries....side of creamy horseradish and ketchup to do as you please...dab of horseradish and bite into juice prime rib...knife not needed in this messy goodness...perry's good for casual everyday dining if you follow the specials....sharing one appetizer and side of broccoli, own meal and a whole bottle per person only $fifty per person total this thursday...
author: Hen A.

description:
The marina is my stomping grounds. You'll catch me running errands, having tea/coffee, brunch/lunch, drinks...grrr everything in this area! 

So of course I have Sat brunch here. French toast was light and wasn't overly saturated with butter. Thank god! Drinks, sunglasses, patio seating and only the people that make me happy. Was a great day since it was so sunny and warm. Waitress was a sweetheart! I love coming here, for the food, the people, and the patio! Sunny days and you'll see me here.
author: Lola D.

description: Came here after a work off-site. It was okay. It had your typical all-American food. None of it was terrible, but most of it didn't stand out. They did have really delicious crab cakes (crisp on the outside, soft and crabby on the inside, very savory) though.
author: Wendy S.

description:
This is just a fun comfort food sort of place.

The food is not great. Some items are overpowered (wings), but generally it's a solid comfort food selection. That would be a three star, but it has some pluses.

The staff are really great.  We have been helped by many of the folks there and they are all fantastic.  The atmosphere is also fun.

Monday night is half-price bottle of wine night.
author: Jason H.

description: Was there on a Sunday around 2:00 PM. Got seated outside after waiting for 20 minutes. No big deal. The waitress was very attentive and friendly. We all had salads and we all thought they were great. Had the homemade chips as well and they were great. I used to eat here twenty+ years ago as well, and they haven't changed much. I enjoyed my time there and was glad they were still around.
author: Average Guy R.

description: Have been going here for 20 years.  Went in for brunch  on Labor Day Monday and my wife went to the bar to ask the bartender if he could recommend a refreshing cocktail. He in turn rolled  his eyes, turned his back to her in disgust, and as he was walking away from her he said I don't know.  Screwdriver.   Like asking a bartender for a recommendation should be so off putting.   There is no charm in being a complete jack.
author: Rob H.

description:
Good traditional American food. Also a great place for happy hour. That is all I gotta say about that...

One thing I must add is that the bartenders here at the Marina location are really cool and knowledgeable about their wines and what's going on around the neighborhood and the city. Two thumbs up for them !!
author: Minh V.

description:
After reading these reviews, I'm glad we didn't get to try the food.

Our waiter upon our arrival was friendly enough, gave us the scoop on something he didn't recommend on this particular day.
 
Then after watching our waiter take a good long time to take two women's order who were seated before us, he rushed to take someone else's order who got in way AFTER us. Then he disappeared!

My choices: try to interrupt him while taking the latecomer's orders, or be the "bad guy" and tell him he skipped us and that we were leaving. No, we just had to walk.

Sounds like we made the right decision!

BTW, do we have to be aggressive Marina types or hipsters to get served in Cow Hollow?
author: Dave S.

description:
Went yesterday for an early dinner. Would've given Perry's five stars but I encountered the unpleasant & rude Hostess. Asked her if sitting out on the Embarcadero patio would be too windy. Her response took me aback. She said 'why are asking me you just came from outside'. Good point but any true San Franciscan knows that (I entered through Steuart St) the weather can be different from one block to another. I thought she was kidding but then she lead me to my table dropped the menus and left w/o a word. I was not impressed & fortunately didn't have to deal with her again. Looked quite bored. 

We struck up a conversation with the GM who was Fabulous, quite pleasant & saved our experience. The Cobb Salad was AMAZING & my friend had a very fresh & delish green salad & asparagus cooked to perfection. My margarita was very very good. They had an excellent collection of tequilas. We had a shot of their finest tequila ($20 a shot) which went down smooth.
author: El L.

description:
When Betelnut and many of the other places on Union are full, I think that's when people go to Perry's...

I went last Saturday afternoon after a full day of football watching; needless to say, I was in dire need of some food.  We had the quesadilla appetizers, and I had the spaghetti and meatballs (don't ask - for some reason, it just called to me).  Everything was fine and pretty standard.  They were able to seat us quickly which was a huge plus.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Nice place.  Kind of cozy, and fancy too.
Great service.  Good food with hearty portions, and great drinks.
Can't say much else though, and nothing really sticks out in my mind.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Pretty good but nothing special. 

I'd eat here again but there is nothing that would stop me from trying out someplace new. They have a lot of competition on Union Street so they have to step up their game.

I ordered a rack of lamb dinner with my friend and it was tasty and I liked the meal overall. The price was not bad for what we ordered but I wasn't too impressed (It's like you don't mind paying a little bit more if they served up something amazing). The decor and service was average.
author: Jack T.

description: Great turkey burger. Friendly fast service. Fun vintage decor.  Not crowded.
author: Peter B.

description:
I'm not sure why this place is so heralded in San Francisco.

The ambiance and service are fine. But the food is just so....blah. 

If this restaurant were in a different city, it would probably get a higher rating. But there are just too many good restaurants in SF. You're better off going somewhere else....
author: Julie V.

description:
Perry's is a great neighborhood bar & restaurant in the Marina.  I have eaten here more often then any other place in SF.  Great for brunch, lunch or dinner. It's the type of place that when my parents come to town they go at least twice in one weekend.  

I can't really comment on the menu because I always get the chicken quesadilla, but it does have a good range of American food.  I think the quesadilla is the best in the city. I also really like their tomato bisque.  

Great place to meet up with friends for a drink as well.  The bar scene is casual, but has good energy.  Last year I watched a lot of the World Cup soccer games here.  I really like their outside seating. They have heating lamps.  The seating is limited, but if you can land a spot it is great people watching.
author: Michael M.

description:
Definitely sit outside- inside is a loud bro-fest.

French onion soup is pretty good... Nice thick crust of cheese and broth that wasn't overly salty, but could have been less herby. Onions and bread were good consistency and quantity.
author: L B.

description: Love this place.  Quesadilla and buffalo chicken appetizers were great and LOVED my ribs. Will be back!
author: Cam S.

description:
Perry's fits in perfectly along the well-manicured and boutique-laden Union Street. 

After pumping about fifty quarters (no joke) into the meter and a long - yet entirely successful! - dress shopping appointment at Haute Bride next door, my group and I dined here for lunch.

With both street and indoor seating, it's a casual lunch spot with an upscale Marina vibe. Business lunchers and well-to-do couples took up a majority of the tables and quietly sipped wine and beer. We followed suit - but added a hefty amount of food, including the potato skins (yum!), the weekly special veggie sandwich (yuck!) and the cobb salad (yum!). 

I'll stop by again when I'm back in the area - but most likely only for drinks and possibly appetizers.

It's the perfect spot for a glass of wine or two on a warm SF afternoon.
author: Donna Z.

description:
I love Perry's for 2 reasons. It is literally next to my office and I can sit at the terrace and feel like I am at home. Whenever the sun is out, I want to be outside and and I go grab a bite in between appointment. It is GREAT people watching especially in the summer.
Thew food is all right what you can expect for some pub food. I usually go for the cob salad.
author: Thierry H.

description:
Went for brunch on sunday, this place is one of the few that takes OpenTable online reservations which I definitely like.  

Food was good, got a Denver omlet which was very tasty, most other dishes looked decent too.  Overall a solid choice for brunch and priced right (maybe even "cheap" by SF standards).  

More attention from the staff, ie coffee refills, how is your meal, etc would have bumped it to 4 stars.  I would go back.
author: Katie M.

description: Th bar is the best part of the place.  They have a large selection of alcohol with very professional bartender.   The waiters and  waitresses are very professional and competent.  The food isn't very good.  We ordered a burger which was good.  Pasta which didn't have much taste.  The ceasar salad was average.  The french onion soup tasted like a frozen french onion soup.   I recommend going there for drinks with friends or having a drink at the bar to meet new friends.  I would not recommend having food there.  For a burger there is a better place down the street on Union street.  The place was packed compared to Perrys.  Maybe this is saying something.
author: Han S.

description:
I ate brunch here, and I started off impressed by the menu and speed of service.  I even liked the egg white omelette (my first foray into healthy breakfast eating), but then things got real...gross.  

You do the math:
4 stars - 1/2 star for lipstick on my water glass - 1/2 star for a hair in my butter - 1 star for a curly hair on my toast = a very, very generous 2 stars. 

I will never return.
author: Kim S.

description: Perry's is definitely a staple of Union Street in SF, but in an area of amazing food venue choices, I would rate Perry's as average. I typically get roped in to having brunch here because it's convenient for me and all of my friends. Don't get me wrong...there's nothing really wrong with Perry's. It just seems like a very average place. The service is fine. The food is fine. There just isn't anything real dynamic about it that I've experienced.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Sorry, not really a fan. Maybe it's better as a bar instead of restaurant? Have been here a couple of times since friends in the area seem to like it, but haven't "seen the light" on this place yet. First time I came, I ordered the blueberry pancakes. Those were pretty terrible. Tasteless and with a few random blueberries buried in the batter. I will say that the club sandwich is pretty good. 

Service is also good. 2nd time I went, my girlfriend didn't like her omelette (cold inside) and the hostess heard her saying something and walked over and asked if she could help. Really nice proactive service.
author: Maria Y.

description:
A nice well known restaurant near the Embarcedro that serves good American comfort food.  They serve good portions of food compared to Vancouver.  I like their grilled artichoke serve with Meyer lemon aioli.  The artichoke was nicely grilled and the artichoke meat was pretty tender.  I thought their French onion soup had too much bread inside but too little soup.  I also like the clam chowder for the consistency was not too thick nor too runny and their were lots of clams inside.  However I wasn't particularily fond of their pot roast because the meat were too moist and loose.  It was nice they had some veggies on the plate too.  I noticed the crab cakes were too brown and it lacked flavour.

For a modest price and big portions it's still worth a try.
author: Betty L.

description: Had brunch at Perry's. Had to wait a little bit before getting seated as this is one of the most popular places in this neighborhood! Got to sit outside and thankfully the weather was great despite being in San Francisco! I would say it is a great place to eat as I loved the food entree . A must place to eat at if you are a foodie.
author: Rup B.

description:
Went to Perry's for my cousins birthday, we were in a large group of about 20. Our reservation was for 7:15, 5 of us showed up by 7:30 and the rest of the group showed up to Perrys Embarcadero location. 

However, the wait staff was really patient, and they gave us no guff, considering our full party actually arrived an hour after our original reservation. The food was pretty good, no one was really raving about their meals after dinner. I ordered the new york steak, it was a bit too well done, same goes for the twice baked potato which was a tad burnt. 
I felt 30$ was a little pricey considering the steak was a bit overdone and the sides weren't particularly striking.

Still, I am a steak guy, and this was a good size hunk of beef....no complaints here. Our waitress made sure the Giants game was on per our request, which is a huge plus because this was the LA series. 

I would eat here again, the atmosphere is nice, the staff is amicable...the food is pretty good too.
author: Ralphy J.

description:
Apparently an SF classic. Cute bistro tables out front as is common on Union St.

I've only been here once, but it was a solid experience. My roomie and I hit this location up for half-price hamburger Tuesday (with purchase of a beverage). We decided to post up at the bar and were immediately waited upon by the nice bartender (an older gentleman who seemed to know a lot of regulars). Of course, the place was half-empty which is expected on a Mon night in Cow Hollow.  

To cut to the chase... THIS IS MY FAVORITE BURGER IN THE CITY! Roommate agreed. 

Certainly a preference thing, but the burger was perfectly cooked and juicy on the inside (medium) with a nice crispy char on the outside. Amazeballs. Fries great too. Wow. It was silent at the bar for about 7.5 minutes while we scarfed it all down. Can't wait to go back for another. FYI, my second fave burger is found at Cafe des Amis just a couple blocks down ... 

Also note that the 1/2 price offers (burgers/wine) at the different Perry's locations occur on different days so be sure to check their website first.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Being a San Francisco native I am almost ashamed to say that in 26 years I have never been here... well...This place is super yummy! I had their hamburger with a side of sweet potato fries.  The hamburger was cooked to perfection, and very juicy.  We also tried the warm brownie sundae, very good as well. Our server was very friendly.

Minus 1/2 star because the little blond hostess was pretty snooty and not too friendly (I guess I can understand though, she works at a restaurant on Union street where the crowds are pretty snooty to begin with..)

Minus the other 1/2 star because there's nothing more annoying than having no other option but to hear all the Grade A Yuppies yap about their boyfriend/cousin/sister's mother's friend's daughter who "OH MY GOD! OH MY GOD! Like TOTALLY didn't even invite her to the party! Like WHAT the HELL?!" Ugh. Go home.
author: Michelle R.

description: Our first time at Perry's was a great experience. The service is great, friendly, inviting. They have tables outside as well as inside. The food is delicious, a wonderful dinner! Will definately go again.
author: Cat A.

description:
Perry's has great martinis! I always have a fun going out here. The food isn't the absolute greatest, but definitely good. 

Their 40th anniversary party was a blast and so much fun. Perry's is a must go for anyone who considers themselves a true San Franciscan.
author: Camille B.

description:
I was extremely impressed with their food. 

Pasta special with pine nuts and chicken      4/5
Grilled portobello mushroom sandwich          3/5
Baby Spinach Salad with addition of ahi       4/5

The mushroom sandwich came with a side of homemade chips that were very fresh and really good.  The ahi addition on the salad was seared to perfection and extremely fresh.

The service was lacking.  The waitress forgot two things we requested: a bowl of the tomato bisque soup, and bread.  She wasn't rude, but she wasn't nice either.  Now, the maitre d was AWESOME and gave us a "high 5" when we found out it was HALF off ALL of their wines (they had a pretty good selection).  I would definitely return.
author: Ashley K.

description:
There is absolutely nothing special about Perry's.  And that's being nice.

The bf and I were looking for a quick bite to eat, as I live nearby.  We settled on Perry's because the menu looked pretty standard, and because I always see people here no matter what time of day it is.  And now I wonder how that could possibly be.

The little hostess was completely snooty and I think it might have actually killed her if she cracked the slightest of smiles.  Our server wasn't terrible, but she wasn't the warmest either....

And the food, to be quite honest, is stuff you could find in your refrigerator.  The Turkey Club was blah, and my $12-chopped salad was blah-er.  I guess we ordered the wrong things?  But, I believe that your restaurant is only as good as your weakest dish, so....

Probably won't be frequenting this place again any time soon, unless every other restaurant in the area has blown up, and I just can't bring myself to boil some instant noodles.  Yah...I'm thinking Perry's may be just one step above Top Ramen.
author: Kira K.

description:
This landmark institution still delivers the goods after more than 40 years of great food, service, vibes and people, thank you Perry Butler and team.  Had lunch with old friends at Perry's the other day and it was better than ever.  There is a timeless, cheerful homeyness reminiscent of the saloon made so famous in the long running televisions series Cheers, and when you add really great food you get a home run.  Impeccably clean, well tended and professionally staffed, the food is remarkable for the scope and integrity of the menu, but truly delivers on quality.  It was a cool, gray, rainy day and the minute we walked in the entryway and were greeted by a pert, striking hostess who quickly showed us to a window table in the front dining room, the day became lighter and more interesting.  The blue and white check table clothes, chicken wire tile floors, contemporary prints and photos framed and hung perfectly throughout the whole restaurant, the centerpiece bar, and the involved crowd busy sharing their news at tables and the bar made for a thriving community within the outside world and brought comfort to all of us.

A busser promptly arrived with water, bread sticks and unsalted butter, followed immediately by a waiter with menus and a cheerful welcome.  I knew I wanted their burger, one of the best I've ever had and still among my favorite burgers in the world.  We started with a split Caesar, grilled artichoke, corn chowder and fried calamari and it was all just mouth watering good.  I had my burger, others had grilled salmon, Chopped Salad,  Meatloaf and mashers, fettucine and roast chicken and everyone raved through each bite.  I say all this because eating in a bar restaurant is almost a thing of the past and yet Perry's offers 4 star food in a relaxed and totally comfortable environment at prices that allow the dream of a foreign sports car in the near future.  My burger was sensational, the custom bun, toasted just right and almost tailored to the meat and fixings, thoughtful and spot on.  The meat tasted fresh, was cooked as ordered and was accompanied by with house made chips that were the only disappointment the table experienced, they were cold and tasteless.  But the burger was big and sumptuous and each bite felt like I was at heaven's gate.  

At Perry's time seems to matter less than at most other restaurants, maybe because it feels like a breath of fresh air, a respite or escape from pressure and stress, and it really is.  The decor, the drinks, the staff, the design and warmth, and the food, brought to life by plenty of happy faces and churning conversation make for a fine dining experience.  I'm all about burgers and this takes the cake.
author: Stu S.

description:
I just got  home from a meal at Perry's after their 40th anniversary block party where the The Sun Kings (Beatles cover band) played.  I've lived in this neighborhood for quite a few years, so I've eaten at Perry's lots of times and wanted to finally give it a review.

Perry's is that great old standby that you know you can count on.  The hostesses, waitstaff, and bartenders are always friendly.  (It was a madhouse today and the hostesses and our waitress were taking it all in stride.)  The menu has a wide selection of items, so you know that anyone you bring there will be able to find SOMETHING that they like.

Today I had the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich with fries and my friend had the classic Cobb Salad.  I also love their burger (it always comes the way I order it...medium rare) and the iceberg wedge with a nice coating of blue cheese dressing, crumbles, and bacon.  I've never ordered wine by the bottle, but they have a nice selection by the glass, so I appreciate that!  I also go quite often for breakfast/brunch and that's always good, too.  My favorite is the tortilla scramble with sour cream.

All in all, it's a friendly, comfortable, neighborhood place where everybody knows your name.  (OK, they don't really know my name or anything, but they're always nice anyway!)
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Perry's is a good place for that group of 6 people, which can be so hard to accommodate at other places. They have these perfectly sized tables that are big enough to hold 6, but small enough to allow everyone to hear each other. 

The food is fine. There were no complaints among my dining companions. I had the portobello mushroom burger, which was savory but light. I would have wanted a bit more pesto, but I'm not complaining. Service was friendly. But also a bit casual--as in, nonexistent after the food was served. Undaunted, we trekked to the service area to get our own condiments and extra napkins. 

Being a neighborhood joint with standard food, Perry's won't be a place I'll visit regularly. I feel I can get an equivalent experience closer to home, but if you're in the area...
author: QuodE D.

description: Average diner food in my opinion.  It's a lot nicer than you would expect and it has a cool feel to it, but the food was nothing spectacular.  Probably would be better if we all had some beer...
author: Jessyca M.

description:
Had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and sauteed vegetables.  Haven't had fried chicken in a while since the last trip to Popeye's did me wrong... but I really felt like I deserved it.  

Definitely worth the grease and calories!  The batter was crispy and greasy but not dripping and the chicken was really moist.  The portion was huge so I gave everyone at the table a small piece and they loved it.

While my entree was delicious, I'm giving it only 3 stars because everyone else seemed only moderately satisfied with their choices (grilled chicken breast, fish and chips, club sandwich).

Good atmosphere (laid back, casual).
author: Anh D.

description:
We stopped in Perry's two weekends ago, and we were treated to the best service and very good food.  Our waiter was attentive to every detail of our lunch, which consisted of burgers and fries.  The burger was absolutely excellent.  

We'll be back!  Love the place, love the incredible service, and look forward to trying other menu items.

D&P - Danville, CA
author: Daniel-Ray C.

description: Pretty sure the blond server on the night shift was high. Granted it was a Saturday pre Halloween so everyone should be cut a little slack but it was as if she was moving in a slow motion dream-like state. The table of four girls near us was livid and complaining to our table about how they feared that this server would never bring them food. Another table of 2 Asian women got up and left their glasses of water after waiting forever for their order to be taken. There were only 4 tables for her to serve, totaling 11 people. Fortunately, my friend and I lucked out and got our quesadilla which was perfect. It still took us a good half hour to get our check and change. The sloth was nice but completely oblivious. Table turnover rate: one per hour.
author: Nicole R.

description:
