Came here the other night with my boyfriend, his brother, and his brother's girlfriend. It was not worth the 20+ min wait. When we finally got seated, the table was so small they couldn't serve the side dishes and main entrees at the same time and service was slow. 

Now about the food... My boyfriend ordered a steak "sandwich" but it when it came out it was just steak on top of a piece of bread and underneath the steak was a portobello mushroom so it made the steak look bigger than it actually was! 

Boyfriend's brother got the pot roast and he said it was pretty good and tender. Boyfriend's brother's girlfriend got enchiladas. Boyfriend's brother liked the french fries, they were crunchy but soft in the middle.

We also ordered the mac & cheese and I got tomato bisque and one of the weekly specials, portobello mushroom sandwich. The mac & cheese and the sandwich were good and the tomato bisque was delicious!!!
author: Jess H.

description:
I have been coming to Perry's for over 10 years. In the past year I have lived a block away from Perry's with my wife. We have celebrated birthdays, showers and get togethers. We are here sometimes 3 times a week to eat breakfast lunch or dinner at times. Tonight we sat down for dinner and they served us a steak salad (my wife) and a red snapper (myself) for dinner. 

The food arrived and my wife looked down at her food and a bug was dripped in salad dressing moving upside down and she freaked out and sent it back. The waiter who served it has known us for years and immediately sent it back. 

Our waiter came back and served my wife a new salad like nothing happened. He didn't say sorry and actually just acted like nothing happened. What disturbed us most is that he didn't offer to take anything off the bill or apologize. The bill was shown as if nothing happened (except for the salad my wife didn't eat) and this is most heart breaking since we have been the biggest fans and this is all the response we got after 10 years. 

We don't want to come back here again just based on their actions. Its too bad this is the way Perry treats all his long time customers.
author: Tony H.

description: I had a really excellent corned beef hash here for breakfast. With a poached egg and sourdough....very high quality breakfast. I really liked it. Service was good, prices weren't too bad at all...great place for breakfast in the neighborhood.
author: Eric t.

description: Well, we went back to Perry's on Union (-after a bad time) and it was wonderful!  The excellent quality that we have enjoyed for many years was great.  Any place can have a bad day, but PERRY's On Union has again provided the great service, delicious food and relaxing atmosphere we had always enjoyed is their "bill of fare".  Congratulations to a family-owned business that has stood the test of time.
author: Nancy I.

description:
Went there on a Saturday night and it was dead - only a couple folks quietly chatting at the bar. Seemed more like a restaurant that was closing down the end of the night than a bar which from the surroundings, it seemed to have more of a restaurant feel.

The service was good and the bartenders were really cool so I would go back to see if I could find a more lively crowd sometime and if so, I would bump this review up by a couple stars.
author: Evan W.

description:
I really like Perrys.  It is a good place to go grab a quick bite or drink on Union St.  It has your traditional type of food- sandwiches, salads, entrees etc. are all pretty standard.

We used to sit right at the bar and grab a drink and eat a quick dinner. I like the idea of sitting at the bar for dinner- it makes me feel like a grownup.  My favorites at Perry's are the cobb salad and the grilled artichoke.

Also Joe Montana frequents this place so be on the look out :)
author: Kathy D.

description: Such a great go-to. Perry's is one of those places that immediately comes to mind when I'm thinking of where to take out-of-town guests. The menu is great, varied, and very reasonably priced, which always makes it a solid option. They have 1/2 priced bottles of wines on Mondays and Thursdays which makes it a great draw! On top of that, the area is fun and the vibe in the restaurant is great. It has an old school feel and a fun energy if you're looking for something lively. When you're done with dinner, there are loads of spots nearby to keep the night going (Marengo's my fave but the Brixton, Lightning Tavern, and Betelnut are all close)!
author: Shannon E.

description:
A local standby, I basically only go when I a too hungover to go further for brunch, or if they are having a special.  The food is really plain, and uninspired, but at least you know what you are going to get.  Brunch is weak, but the burgers and beers are good.  Wine list is decent, but pretty overpriced if its not 50% off.

The service has always been lackluster, but this most recent time was absolutely atrocious.  We questioned an item on the bill and the manager burst into a tirade as if we were robbing him.  It was hilarious to watch, but not the way to run a business.  

Most of my friends and a couple of the tables around us said they wouldn't go back after seeing this guy flip out the way he did.
author: Mark B.

description:
BEST BURGER IN SF! I know that's a strong statement, but after Moose's went under new management, there became no questions that this is the best burger in the city!
Perry's cheeseburger is a must-have - full of flavor an juices with cheese melting off the sides of a perfectly toasted bun. Perry's also have one one of the best BLOODY MARYs in town and their Lobster Madness Sundays feature amazing prices on perfectly prepared Lobsters!
Great ambiance and a fantastic location smack in the middle of Union Street.
author: Greg B.

description: I've only been to Perry's a few times and I have to say, I've really enjoyed it. Reading some other reviews, it seems like they are pretty hit and miss with their food, but so far I've left satisfied. I like to come here on a Sunday morning for brunch and mimosas - my favorite thing in the world. The mimosas are expensive so your tab can add up pretty quick if you aren't careful. They have classic style breakfasts which I love and find rather tasty. It's a great place to come with family or friends, especially when you have the day off and can grab a table outside and sit under the sun. Absolutely perfect.
author: Sara K.

description: Fun atmosphere to eat in. Sat near the bar at a tall table and got to watch the regs.I had the ahi sandwhich and sweet potato fries. To die for. Clear and simple!
author: Cleo C.

description:
I liked the food, I liked the drinks (great Bloody Mary) but my god some of the other clientele made the experience like pulling teeth.

The GF and I hit Perry's at about 11 on a Sunday for a pre Halloween costume hunt brunch.  The server and hostess were very attentive and nice. The corned beef hash was very good (not quite as good as Nob Hill Grill's but how do you compete??) and the Bloody Mary's were appropriately spicy and spiked.  

We sat outside to watch the world go by and we were having a great time until THEY showed up...

Two very talkative, whiny voiced, and over sharing 20-somethings sat down next to us and effectively took over the entire outdoor seating area.

First it was too hot so they insisted that the heat lamps be turned off (no one at the other 3 tables was consulted). Then surprise surprise! they were cold and the lamps got cranked back up (again sans consultation). 

We then got to hear very loudly about the extent of the previous night's debauchery (usually entertaining but at this point all I wanted to do was leave).

While the price is a little steeper than standard the food/drink/service were all great.

Just be careful who you sit next to...
author: Nick E.

description: Love going to this place when I'm in San Fran. Classic neighborhood place, food is solid but grabbing a drink here on their patio/outside with friends on a nice day is the best.
author: Janine F.

description:
I've been here for brunch twice and have had good experiences both times.

On my most recent visit, I came with my wife and two friends on a Sunday afternoon.  Unlike a lot of restaurants, Perry's was happy to take our reservation in advance and we were seated promptly after arriving.  They have a lot of space at their Union Street location, and we were seated in the bright "sun room" in the rear portion of the restaurant.

Our server was prompt and pleasant, and our food came relatively quickly, considering how busy it was.   Our buffalo wings appetizer was nicely spicy and quite good.  I thoroughly enjoyed my Chopped Salad, which had a tasty vinagrette dressing and fresh ingredients.

A clean place, good prices, and good service.  We'll keep coming back!
author: Tim N.

description:
I'm continually amazed by the patience of servers. 

Like, how the waiter at a late-night dim sum joint in Chinatown didn't even flinch when my hammered buddy Kyle took a live catfish out of the tank and fishslapped his dining companion (this is totally acceptable behavior for fraternity brothers, apparently) at four in the morning last Saturday. 

The same can be said for our waitress the following afternoon at Perry's. Kelly was outstanding- attentive, entertaining, and very accommodating. While Kyle was on his best behavior this time, the eccentric woman at the adjacent table was decidedly not. But Kelly didn't make fun of the elderly patron, even when she ordered the mini-burgers and prechewed every bite for her two yapping Chihuahuas.

That, ladies and gentlemen, is a professional.
author: Anna K.

description:
Perrys is that old school neighborhood restaurant thats probably been here for ages.   I finally got around to trying it out and everything I had was pretty good but nothing excting

calamari to start - really good super crispy cornmeal breaded
cup of clam chowder - not bad, clams tasted pretty fresh
cobb salad - good grilled chicken, nice red wine vignette, but i mean..how can u screw up a cobb right?
author: Arthur T.

description:
Perry's is a lot of fun.  Perfect for weekend day drinking, ok for food if you need a bite.  I'm not here for the food but do eat here often.

bartenders are great.  crowd is fine and it's a relaxed place.

I'm glad people from Virginia don't like it, or even locals that refer to themselves as cosmopolitan babe.
author: david s.

description:
I went for brunch last Saturday at 11am (my first time).  I had the French Toast and Denver Omelet which were both disappointing.  The French Toast was over "toasted" and not soft, and the omelet was below average.  My wife's Eggs Benedict was decent though.  Also, I was disappointed that they don't have freshly squeezed juice.  Not trying to be mean, but I'd rather go to IHOP for breakfast.

Service was the highlight of the brunch, and the homey environment was bright and lively.  Overall, disappointing breakfast food, however I am willing to give their lunch and dinner menus a shot if I'm in the area again.  Also, night before reservations for a party of 6 was very easy to come by which is a big plus in San Francisco.

Having recently moved from Chicago where there are so many fantastic breakfast/brunch (Yolk and Wildberry to name a couple) places that are as good or better than Mama's, perhaps my standards/expectations are too high.
author: June P.

description: We met there for a business referral lunch meeting. It is an iconic San Francisco bar and restaurant that is fun and filled with local memorabilia. The food was very good - I had the Cobb salad. It was a great portion size... fresh ingredients and loaded with toppings. I saw another person got the club sandwich as well which looked delicious. Service was great - Price was good. 5 stars.
author: Niloufer H.

description: Made my Monday - half price bottle of wine and GREAT company! Love this place!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Brunch Review:

I love lunch at Perry's but don't go there for Brunch.  Two words: Can Spinach.   Made my girlfriend sick all Saturday.

Come on Perry's we live in California.
author: Matthew F.

description: one star cuz no stars isn't allowed. This isn't a review on food or drinks since we never even made it that far. This is STRICTLY on service. My girlfriends and I went here to grab a drink before our reservation across the street and all i can say is they are RUDE! The restaurant didn't look busy and since we just wanted to grab a quick drink, we sat down at an empty table BY THE BAR. 2 women come up to us and ask if we're eating, which we say 'no' to. Then they say that they have to go and "make sure" that it's ok that we sat there....even though it was way after dinner time (it past 9PM) and the place was not packed at all. Then another woman comes up and says in a very condescending way that we can sit there...but if they get busy, they are going to kick us out of the table. OK? REALLY?  Are you expecting a dinner rush at 9:30PM? WOW. Needless to say, we took our business elsewhere and will never be back.
author: Cecilia B.

description:
I think Perry's on Union has really slipped.  Neither the food nor the service are what they should be or what they used to be. We were there for a late lunch on Saturday and they were crowded, but serving only a brunch menu.  The service was particularly bad with two different people taking care of us and neither one attentive or interested.  The traditional breadsticks were conspicuous by their absence.  We asked for them three or four times and finally received a plate of hard, stale bread with no butter or olive oil.  The food was ok, but nothing more.  From the nasty little manager to the mediocre fare, there was really nothing about the experience to encourage a return. It is too bad, as the restaurant has been such a happy staple for so many years.  It seems they have over-expanded or are resting on their laurels.  Very disappointing.

p.s. Not to mention that there are regularly dogs in the restaurant - what has happened to our health regulations???
author: nancy f.

description:
As much as I don't really hang out on Union St., this place is pretty ok for burgers and beer and a football game.

We sat by the bar and had a perfect view of the awesome Charger game today. The service was spot-on, the beers came out fast, the burgers were delicious and as big as our heads, and the french fries were nice and slightly overcooked, the way I like them.

A guy at a table close to us fell asleep at the table, then woke up, and continued drinking his beer. Ah, the Marina.
author: Rachel F.

description:
In normal terms I am neither a fan of this neighborhood nor type of joint. However, it was the ideal place to spend new year's eve.

1. We had a table all night, with an attentive waitress.

2. No ridiculous cover for the right to hang out there.

3. For white people food, it's pretty good.
author: Jason R.

description:
My favorite Perry's location.  The staff is friendly (not overly), the location is wonderful, the interior is pleasant, the exterior is fantastic when the weather is nice.  

And best of all, the patrons are generally if not always lovely.   I would recommend Perry's for a first date drink or a meal with family in town - an all around great location and dining / bar experience.
author: Melissa D.

description: This is a solid place. Nothing spectacular, but reliably good - an upscale diner as far as food selection goes. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is friendly with a cool mix of posters, old advertisements, signs and local photographs on the walls. We were seated towards the back (a lot more seating than you would think - it stretches way back) in a sunny skylit room - nice to be away from the bar area which was packed. Had a very good calamari appetizer, and a vegetable frittata for my entree. Shared a side of mac n cheese (super good). There's a great selection of beer. Thought our server was very nice and I witnessed a different server in our area treat a very high maintenance customer very graciously, which I was impressed by, because I was rolling my eyes overhearing what they were dealing with!
author: Barbara K.

description: Casual and quiet place in the outer reaches of the Marina.  I find Perry's to be a great place for lunch, especially if you sit outside with your dog and soak in the San Francisco sun.  I love all of their salads, and their homemade chips are highly addictive.  While its certainly not a destination place, I highly recommend Perry's for a low-key meal.
author: Shannon W.

description:
I came here for brunch with the girls recently and have to say that I was sorely disappointed.  I had heard such good reviews about Perry's and was really looking forward to experiencing a bit of old San Francisco. 

The place was crowded, but service was attentive & quick, the food didn't take that long.  

We sat & immediately ordered some coffee.  Coffee was drinkable, but nothing special.  I expected at least some type of gourmet coffee. oh well. 

I ordered the BABY SPINACH SALAD 8.95
with pear, candied walnuts, goat cheese and balsamic vinaigrette.  It was DRENCHED. absolutely drenched in vinaigrette.  So disgusting and inedible.  I ate as much as I could, but the bottom part of the salad was just a soggy mess. Way too much goat cheese & only a little bit of candied walnuts & pears. =( 

I also ordered a side of the Home Fries 3.50, which also came out half burnt & half soft/soggy. ?? how can you be half burnt but soggy?? i just didn't get it. Tasteless as well. 

My girlfriend got the Italian Omelette Italian sausage, fontina cheese & mushrooms 10.95. The omlette looked huge, but when she cut into it, it was like ALL egg and barely any sausage/mushrooms. It also came with the same half burnt/soggy home fries. I think the toast was the best part of the dish. 

No more Perry's for me =(
author: Lulu C.

description: Perry's is a fun place to take in a game at the bar or go with a group for Sunday afternoon burgers. It is usually pretty packed but it is def worth the wait if you are looking for savory comfort food!
author: Frank L.

description:
It was a Sunday, last minute plans for lunch with a friend and was able to get a table in no time flat.. I mean that literally.... Walked up to the hostess and it was as if she was expecting me. Fabulous. 

Sat down, and ordered mimosas right away.. The water was constantly filled and even though the first time the waiter asked us if we were ready and we weren't she did not forget about us. Gave us the perfect amount of time and of course we were ready to order by the time she came back. 

Grilled chicken BLT I enjoyed every succulent bite of grilled goodness. The fries were de-lish and the crab cakes my friend had look like yummy crab balls of goodness.... Sigh... The staff is friendly, and more then ready to refill your drinks and the place is a lot bigger then I ever thought it was. Oh Perry's I want to come back and see what else you have to offer...
author: Kylie L.

description:
I can't believe that I'm a native San Fran girl, and that this was my first time to Perry's. 

Overall, the food and service were good. I had the BLT chicken sandwich with YUMMY home fries. The other girls had the Blackstone Eggs, which I envied from across the table. 

Perry's feels so....Marina.
author: Misha F.

description: The service is always great at Perry's. Plus, how can you go wrong with 1/2 priced bottles of wine on Mondays during happy hour? (That was a rhetorical question.) The brunch never wows me, but I always get a good snicker people-watching. Perry's is prime Marina-douche territory and the people watching, especially if you're sitting out front at one of the sidewalk tables is SPECTACULAR. Also, I like the fish'n'chips.
author: Dee I.

description: Mediocre and expensive. Many other places serve better tastier less pricey fare.
author: David G.

description:
Perry, I personally have no problem with you. I mean, you have so much going for you:

1. You're conveniently located in the Douchebag Corridor known as Union

2. You're packed to the rafters with (gasp!) douchebags

3. Your bartender is a (surprise!) douchebag

4. Your facilities are clean and comfortable 

These are all things I look for in a bar. But see, Perry, the grave mistake you made was hiring an incompetent, arrogant, and utterly useless tool for a bartender. And because that ass clown treated my boyfriend very badly, I am 1-starring you. And Perry, it's unfortunate I found out about this incident. Because I'm the one you should be afraid of.
author: Autumn K.

description: Dropped by with a group of 7 to have a drink before dinner. Hung out at the bar and within 15 minutes most of us were able to find a seat at the bar. The bartenders were full of personality and you could tell they loved their jobs. Ordered some IPA beers and Pinot Grigio and all were top notch at reasonable prices ( plus free bread sticks). What a great find. Will drop by again as the food I saw being served looked fabulous as well!
author: Michelle C.

description:
There was nothing that immediately made me love or hate Perrys; Mostly vintage signage on the wall like you'll find at pubs and casual dining restaurants all over the nation, inoffensive, nothing that would leave a lasting impression. Plenty of seating.

It was while I was waiting for a drink, standing patiently at a not-particularly-crowded bar, trying in vain to make eye contact with the bartender as he wiped the bar down and played dice with regulars, at one point following him just to get my girlfriend a drink - it was during those moments that I decided that I fucking hate Perrys.
author: matthew r.

description: Definitely get the bacon on your burger...do it! Had a great afternoon sitting outside with my boy & the pooch, surprisingly dead on this particular Sunday which was awesome.
author: lindsay f.

description:
I felt like I was back in L.A. when I saw the cute little outdoor cafe seating, the beautiful crowd and the vegetarian egg white omelette on the brunch menu. Had to order it --- that and the potatoes. My friend opted for the crab cake benedict and I'm sure if I liked egg yolk I would be all over that. I'm not on any sort of low cholesterol diet or anything...

Couldn't believe how quickly our order arrived at the table. Seriously record time, even for brunch.
author: Kristi K.

description:
We ended up at Perry's because it looks like a place that would make a good Bloody Mary.  It wasn't for me --- I think the Bloody Mary is proof that there might actually be an omnipotent intelligence at work in the universe and that said omnipotent intelligence finds immense humor in making hung over people crave seriously disgusting stuff.  But the group I was with really wanted one.  As we walked by various Union Street restaurants Perry's leaped out with that kind of old school, 1950's three martini lunch-vibe and became the choice for brunch.

I had the corned beef hash, which was decent and had a good quantity of bell peppers to balance out the onions.  The omelets looked decent if unspectacular.  Since we came in carrying our own coffee I didn't get to try that ultimate bellwether of breakfast competency, but evidently the Bloody Marys hit the spot.  

The service was disinterested, but in that "I don't pay attention to anyone, it's not just you" sort of way.  I wouldn't make a point of coming back but if someone suggested it I wouldn't object to Perry's.  Just don't order me a Bloody Mary.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
Decent Americana joint a stone's throw from the Bus Stop and assorted former Greekphiles. 

I enjoyed the vibe of the restaurant and the waitstaff was chill - they hooked up my buddy who had flown out from New Mexico with a decent little birthday brownie. So what if he's going to be 28? Big kids can blow out candles, too!

I had the Spinach Salad - spinach, vinaigrette, goat cheese, walnuts, and apples, to which I had them add bacon. Wonderful! Great pre-drinking food. Speaking of drinking, QUALITY MOJITOS ARE MADE HERE. Yeah, you heard me. Quality drinks. On Union Street. Uh huh.

Also yummy: bread sticks, mozzarella sticks, french fries, and mac and cheese. If you're a drinker with the palate of a 5 year old, Perry's is a good place to start. 

Review finished, let me take the time for a PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT:

Ladies, if you decide that you have had too much to drink and that the restroom at Perry's is the place to hurl, hurl with discretion. Flush the toilet afterwards so I don't have to see puke when I go to actually USE the bathroom.
author: Devon S.

description:
Wow, you gotta love Marina joints whose reviews are just all over the map. I'm seeing one star here, five here, I'm eating onions and spotting quarters and don't know what the Sam Hell is going on.

So my apparently quite critical co-workers are killing this place for the waitress' inability to name the special when we all came here for a friend's bday. Kinda unprofessional? Perhaps. Deal-breaker? Hell to the no. Anyway, the food was pretty good, said waitress didn't forget about us, and the bar can be pretty fun on the right night. But shit, it sure as hell doesn't stand out in any way. But Baron Davis was there that night, so that's kinda cool. This review is over.
author: Drew S.

description: Great food, breakfast is awesome. Service is really friendly. Eggs Benedict are delicious and so are the sliders. Nice bar too
author: Adam M.

description:
Great bar, great staff all round. The best SLIDERS EVER!!!! 

Moving to SF was a huge move, as I didnt know a lot of people in SF. The people at Perry's, staff and clientele, are so friendly. I been to bars all over the world and never been to a place where you can sit at the bar, and know for certain that somebody (staff or customer) will strike up a conversation with you. 

I love it and will be back!!!
author: Mr F.

description: The atmosphere was awesome we stumbled upon this place and it was great food for decent prices for San Fran. Voted one of the best I can see why.
author: Sara M.

description: Average at best.  On a Monday night in April, we stopped in for dinner and were seated in the back room.  The Fried Calamari was really good, but the fried chicken was over done and dry.  My son seemed to enjoy the Pot Roast, but husband's Cobb Salad was nothing special.  Service was slow.
author: Geralyn H.

description: Straight ahead American cuisine. Great burger and a chill place to hang with your friends compared to the rest of the Marina scene. There used to be one in Palo Alto too, but it just up and disappeared one day. Almost forgot to mention that they serve food after 11pm so it's a great place for late night eats too.
author: Kim N.

description:
"Never have so many owed so much to so few"

Obviously, Churchill had not been to Perry's.

They have surged through the $10 barrier on a basic burger, an extra $2.50 for cheese and bacon.  Bowl of chili, $7.75.  Rack of lamb close to $30.   I can believe that at Eos or Hawthorne Lane.  But a bar???

Pot roast, gravy, and mashed potatoes is damn tasty on a snowy afternoon. . . even if their secret is half a stick of butter. 

If money is no object Perry's is a good, history-laden, Cheers-like place where you can meet a hell of a lot of straight white people and if you squint you might just think that's Mary Ann Singleton at the bar, plus a bunch of fifty-something salt of the earth guys wearing windbreakers and watching sports on the TV who actually seem comfortable in their aging skin.
author: Gil S.

description: After my last visit to Perry's I'm never going back. From the beginning, I've never been super impressed or blown away by this place. Nothing on the menu ever catches my eye. A few weeks ago, my boyfriend and I went for brunch because all of the other restaurants in the neighborhood weren't doing brunch because of the Union St. Fair. So we settled on Perry's. We ordered two Bloody Marys which arrived in Dixie cups. They were awful! Mostly mix, not spicy, and no alcohol. The table next to us left because they were so turned off by their drinks. Then they tried to charge us $9 for the bloodies, which is a dollar more than what they usually are in a bigger glass! We could not believe it. The food was decent but lost my appetite because of the rude waitress and the shitty drinks!
author: Jamie E.

description:
Sitting under the heat lamps at Perry's is the perfect place to people watch on a cool, dreary Sunday morning.  I had a great eggs blackstone made with crunchy bacon and two perfectly poached eggs.  The home fries were just 'eh' but I find that I really dislike home fries at 90% of the brunch places I frequent so this didn't really shock me.
Good stuff, I'll be back.
author: phil h.

description:
The food was average.. considering I had a Gardenburger with pepperjack. The bun that it came on was soft and yummy..Tons of cheese melting off of my burger.I do like to be able to taste the patty, and you can never have too much cheese, but this may be the exception.
I was a little annoyed that I waited 15 minutes before anyone brought me a menu.
I liked that I could sit outside with my dog and get in some good yuppie watching.
author: Karlee D.

description:
The WORST.  I would let the subpar food, crammed bar and the kitschy decorating slide but I can not give over the god awful customer service. The hostess was so over the top rude, condescending and did not smile once.  Told us we would have a table in 35-40min and after an hour we had to ask what was going on. I don't mind waiting for a table or even getting an inaccurate wait time but she did absolutely nothing to acknowledge that we were waiting a long time. 
Not even worth going for the half priced wine-they would have to pay me to eat there again.
author: YA Z.

description:
Perry's is like an old classic J Crew sweater or a 1956 Chevy Bel Aire.  Standard old east coast yuppie decor and bar fare.  Sort of like an upscale east coast college pub.  Slightly overpriced for what it is, but then you're buying the ambience along with that cheeseburger.

The staff has always been pleasant to me, the food decent.  Plus there's half price bottles of wine every Monday night - that's a hard deal to beat!
author: Rose Q.

description: San Francisco staple. The 1/2 price burgers on Tuesday are hard to beat and the bar is great for Giants games. They invented a drink called bull shot, so if you're feeling adventurous give it a try.
author: Mark G.

description: I will definitely be back for another round of food and conversation.  I enjoy restaurants that don't rush out the food, and rush you out the door so they can keep the table fresh with new patrons.  The Marina has many options for eateries, and this one has a touch of old school that makes you feel right at home, not to mention they have televisions with the Niners game!
author: C. H.

description:
The cheeseburger was very good (even though it was cooked well and I requested medium rare.) The potato salad was ok...more of a serving of mayo with some potatoes and onions thrown in it. I think the price is a bit high, but then again I guess paying 12.95 in SF is normal for a burger. 
Anyway, the actual place was ok, nothing special except for the fact it was on Union and had outdoor seating. My girlfirends bloody mary was some concoction I imagine cat vomit to taste like.
The server was a bitch who constantly had a salesman's smile to try to cover her true colors. All in all, I wont go back. They had potential with the good burger, but then again is it really that hard to make a good burger?  Hm, based on prior experiences maybe it is...
author: Jared M.

description: We came here for drinks to take a break from walking up all the damn San Fran hills. This is a cute little bar with a neighborhoody feel. I'd definitely come back.
author: Jessica W.

description: Three of us had lunch at Perry's on Union St., a week ago. It was very noisy, and the food was very average with San Francisco prices. I had a crab cakes and it were over cooked and hard to cut. Would I go back, NO.
author: Darla B.

description:
I went to Perry's last week to meet up with an old friend.  Therefore, my frame of mind was already pretty positive.  

Our waitress was from Ireland and was really friendly.  However, it was Valentine's Day, so it's just smart to be nice to a couple showing up when you're not sure what's going on.  No matter the reason, she was pleasant.  That earns them major points.

I used to bartend in the city years ago and still have a particular way of mixing a drink.  I asked for a drink with a specific liquor. It came to me just how I liked it and with a bit of Chambord  liqueur to finish it off.  That was a nice touch.  Unfortunately, I found a little speck of something floating in it.  The drink was replaced immediately, but with the usual way of mixing it.  I chose not to complain as I was just happy with my company.

A friend of my friend, who is a regular there, showed up later.  He recommended some food choices and we ate based on that.  The food was pretty good.  He's there so much that the bartenders and the wait staff knew him well.  Maybe they just don't warm up until they've seen your face a few times.  I'm not sure, but like I said, our waitress was nice to us from the jump but they warmed up even more when a regular sat himself at our table.

Overall, it was a nice place to relax and that's what a pub is all about. I'd definitely go back.
author: Regina W.

description:
Whether youre there for breakfast, lunch or just a cocktail...Perry's is always recommended.

I definitely go here way too much
author: Ken S.

description: We went there as a family and ate on the sidewalk tables.  It was great.  Service was good, food too, very nice time.
author: Florence G.

description:
WOW.  I am obviously out of the loop when it comes to this place!

Now, a restaurant's or man's way to my heart, is if they can make a good Eggs Benedict.  No, really.  Most Sunday mornings, I just want a good Eggs Benedict, and bottomless mimosa.  Instead of trekking over to the Castro to satisfy my Sunday cravings @ LIME, I've been eager to find another place in SF that I can go to when I just don't feel like putting on my dancing shoes for a little Sunday bump and grind.

My meal was excellent.  In contrary to Jenny K, I LOVED my Eggs Benedict, and didn't come up with the same findings as my fellow Yelper.  My friend had the vegetable frittata, which I'm assuming was delicious because it was gone before I blinked twice. :-D

While I might not be a fan of the decor, I think it's part of the charm of this place.  Check it out!

But if you're wearing casual clothing, be prepared to be seated in the back. LOL.
author: Vince S.

description:
So, today I was doing my faux- Marina girl act again- this time complete with borrowed little dog! Anyway we gave up a sidewalk table at a certain establishment known for its exotic wildlife of the feline persuasion, as it was chilly in the shade. We called Perry's and were assured 5 people could be seated outside.

We traipsed up the hill... and what do you know, parties of 5 can't be seated outside. The hostess was rude and dead eyed. She consulted with a couple standing nearby, perhaps the owners- they were rude too. Reading recent reviews on this place, it doesn't seem to be run very well. 

I'll spend my fake Marina dollars elsewhere.
author: Katie H.

description:
The host is super cute and has some kind of UK accent. I'm not sure what anything outside of Britain really sounds like other than super hot.

Our waiter was cute too. 

The food was okay. Greasy, pub-type food. I liked the toast. How about that?
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Very disappointing.  Went for dinner on a Friday evening recently.  I had the "Halibut special" and one of my companions had the crab cake appetizer.   The Halibut was inedible - looked like they had coated in almonds and then deep fried it.  It was a hard, dry inedible block of nothingness.  Just awful.  The crab cake appetizer was just embarrassing.   Again, fried to death and tiny.  A couple of thin "air hockey puck" size fried bits of filler.  Blah.

If I can avoid ever returning to Perry's, I certainly will.  Unfortunately this was my third time there but hopefully my last.
author: John B.

description:
This is just my kind of place.  

Sit at the bar all by yourself, order a martini, eat your continental cuisine, watch a little sports on the tube --all backed by excellent service from the bartenders ... quite simply, a lovely place for a girl to get her solo grub on.  More specifically, a lovely place for a girl to get her solo grub on, if she's in the mood for some fine mini cheeseburgers surrounded by a bed of skinny fries.
author: Ann M.

description:
Came here for New Year's Day brunch, they got points just for being open.

I arrived and knew that I was definitely in the Marina, most of the people looked like they walked off the pages of a J. Crew catalog if you're into that sort of thing (even if you're not, it's still eye candy).

As easy as it is to make fun of the Marina, I have you say that I had a really fun time. Of course, it was probably because my table of friends were all laughing at one another's stories from the night before.

The Denver omelet and mac & cheese that I ordered totally hit the spot.

Then of course there was the amusement of seeing all these people wearing their clothes from the previous evening. There also was some sort of custom where tables would do the slow clap as stragglers joined them late, presumably coming from some stranger's bed with disheveled hair. 

One gentleman from out of town told a lovely story about how the conversation he had with his NYE "date" mostly consisted of her saying, "I'm not sure about this..." and him responding with, "Oh yes you are..."

I was in the Marina, but I might as well have been in Morocco since I felt like I was studying abroad and feeling a little culture shock. Hey, at least there was the food.
author: Tony P.

description: My husband and I had burgers.  A bit overpriced, but it is San Francisco so I guess I just expect it.  Food was good, beer was good, service was good.
author: Jody D.

description:
I think this place could be good for breakfast or to have a drink at the bar while watching the game... but coming here for a friend's birthday dinner - not so much.

We were seated in the back since we had a party of 10 and the casual feel of the place was cool and things were starting off fine with a nice glass of pinot and some breadsticks. And then it came time to order. When the birthday girl asked what the fish of the day was - the waitress stumbled a little and said "Sea bass with a chilli salsa and I think it comes with rice, I only work one day a week so I don't know the specials well." First off - regardless of how many days a week you work, you should know the special and secondly, if you only work one day a week, wouldn't that make it even easier to know the special for that one night you work!? Needless to say she didn't get the special completely correct.

Dinner was just okay - started off with a cup of the tomato bisque which was actually very good. And then came the chicken BLT that was just okay, not great. We got a side of mac & cheese to share and it was dissapointing, I actually think that kraft mac & cheese is much better. A couple people got the baked ziti and thought it was average but the birthday girl did really enjoy her meatloaf.

All said and done - it was just okay - overpriced for the food and experience.
author: Melanie T.

description: A staple in the Marina, I had never been to Perry's before.  We went for dinner last night and we had a good time.  I didn't realize how big the place was until we were seated all the way in the back.  We ended up moving seats because the table was right next to the bathroom and there were plenty of other open seats.  The french onion soup was delicious and the meatloaf was just ok (no one can make it like mom does).  Good service though.  I would head back and try some other food there.
author: Blake B.

description: One step below mediocre, at best. My fiance and I went there for breakfast this past weekend, and I should've known better. When I lived here, I didn't like Perry's, and upon visiting they proved me right again. There was a hair in the creamer for the coffee, a hair in my fiance's potatoes, and 1/2 a whole egg shell in his Eggs Benedict (how was that missed by the cook?). All that, and not worth what we paid. If you are looking for breakfast or brunch in the Marina area, definitely look elsewhere.
author: Erin B.

description:
You know how great artists are always under-appreciated when they're alive?  Suddenly, a week after they leave our world, their paintings become way more valuable.  Why is this, you might ask?  People begin to realize that this artist will never paint another portrait . . .  

I feel the same way about Perry's.  When Perry's Downtown was there, I kind of dreaded going there.  (see http://www.yelp.com/biz/perrys-downtown-san-francisco#hrid:fbPyLCVywPlnmVVzTx7xIw).  It was slightly overpriced, a bit too crowded during lunch, and the menu never changed.  I went a couple times a month, even though I came back to the office $25 lighter.  When that Perry's on Sutter and Kearny Streets finally closed, I thought "good riddance."  Now I am going through Perry's withdrawals.

Today after helping a friend move, all I wanted was a cold Diet Coke and a sandwich.  We walked over to Perry's looking AMAZING after a whole day of driving and carrying bags of clothes; both she and I wore shorts and slightly sweaty t-shirts.  We were seated right away at a table in the back - I guess they didn't want their other customers to see us.  The crowd at this location is definitely as Marina as it gets.

I ordered a portobello and steak sandwich with fries ($16.50).  It was an open faced sandwich, which basically means this: some grilled onions on top of a small steak on top a piece of portobello mushroom on baguette-type bread.  The steak, surprisingly, was cooked medium, just like I ordered.   The mushroom was a bit too thin, but it had a lot of flavor.  The onions on top were a bit too vinegary for my taste, and I didn't want to eat too many of them.  The fries were just OK: "either undercooked or overcooked," as my friend said.

Our server Max was super nice and very helpful.  He was pretty busy, but he seemed to have made time for us.  Definitely a big plus.  Oh, and the place also has several flat screen TVs, which makes it possible to watch the games from just about every angle.

Perry's walls, not unlike those at Just For You (http://www.yelp.com/biz/just-for-you-cafe-san-francisco#hrid:zrleE76ANbS5q8oEhCjHfA), are decorated with random fun stuff.  The wall next to us had a photo of Jack Nicholson in The Shining, my favorite actor, and a photo of Pete Rose, my favorite baseball player.  Those two things alone are worth an extra star.

In conclusion, Perry's is a 4-star pub-like establishment serving 3-star food.  Come for the food, stay for the flat TVs and the Marina crowds.
author: Yan G.

description:
Perrys have a great burger and all American food. Gets quite busy on weekends but you can easy get in during the week.

quite often go for lunch or dinner, fast service and good food for the price.
author: Mark H.

description:
OK, tonight I had an epiphany regarding Perry's.

Ive eaten Brunch and dinner at Perry's at least 100 times over the years.  Always a good experience, I love the Bloody Marys, the Reuben sandwiches and the Wednesday night lobster feeds.

We have ordered Perry's dinner to be delivered to our house three times.  Each time has been a major disappointment. Tonight's problems were that the Buffalo Wings showed up as Buffalo Tenders (horror of all horrors to the Buffalo Boy that co-habs with me), The Sliders showed up as a single Slider (did the delivery guy eat the other one??), the Iceberg Wedge showed up as, well, just an Iceberg Wedge. No dressing. No cheese. Just a $7.50 1/3 of a head of iceberg lettuce. WTF. The Reuben sandwich had no dressing on it.  To be fair, the tomato bisque was off-the-charts good, however.

I've gotten side-tracked regarding the epiphany. It is as follows:

Perry's is better when you have booze. They don't deliver booze with the buffalo tenders and plain lettuce, so there you have it.  Don't say I didn't warn you. You have to go to Perrys to get the booze. The food then tastes better. Its very simple, really.
author: Megan L.

description:
Eh

The food is mediocre, ambiance is great though. I kind of don't feel like a true San Franciscian by giving this a poor review but I just must. Don't go there for bfast by all means! Dinner is a little better, salads are OK. But in my opinion there are so many great places to go in SF dont waste your time unless you are going strictly for a fun place to hang.
author: Heather S.

description: Was expecting to get a great selection of breakfast/lunch food but was disappointed by the limited choices.  It was like everyday food.  No big wow factor.  Typical American food.  Although the restaurant was spacious felt, very cramped inside bc there are so many tables right next to each other.  Only good thing was that their portions were big.
author: Randi L.

description:
A fantastic place for brunch or drinks. Had the club sandwich the first time and then got spinach and ricotta cheese omelette another time. Friendly servers(and im vicious as an ex-restaurant slave myself) and cool atmosphere. Worth the price.

Hint: Omelettes taste even better with a belleni or two.
author: Erin F.

description:
We decided to come here in a group for my friend's birthday. She mentioned that she was wearing a dress so I decided to look snazzy too. Entering Perry's, I realized that I definitely wore the wrong outfit. As we walked to the back room to join our group, my friends and I slipped on the nasty tile outside of the kitchen. Not a good start.

Our waitress didn't know what the special was and said that it was served with vegetables such as broccoli and rice. I had no idea rice was a vegetable- I guess you learn something new every day, ha. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad and a cup of vegetable soup. My vegetable soup arrived and was watery. I should have ordered the tomato bisque; my friends got it and I had a taste- yum!

Our entrees arrived and my Chinese chicken salad was a huge letdown. The chicken was cold and shredded, the lettuce not fresh, and a huge pile of unseasoned, cooked noodles was plopped on top. I barely touched it and nibbled off my friends' plates instead. Worst of all, the bill totaled $50/person, which was outrageous for my meal and a bottle of wine among three of my friends. Granted, we all helped pay for the birthday girl's meal, but among 10 people I thought it would be much less.

Overall, I think this place is much better suited for hanging out with a beer and watching the game. A fancy birthday dinner with friends- not so much.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I love Perry's.  It is one of the few places in San Francisco you can sit at the bar, have dinner, and watch a game.  Seriously try and count the places were this is an option.  Harry's but sitting at the bar sucks.  Balboa, but who wants to sit there and have uber aggresive old guys spill drinks on you while they try and hit on your girl.  Any others?  Frankies I guess, and that place is great, but they don't have booze.  

Perry's fills a much needed void in San Francisco.  And the burger is really super good.
author: Eamonn T.

description:
It's actually more like a 2.5, but I'll round up today.

Have been in here several times, but never been really wowed by anything - the food and service are both ok, but not the greatest. I guess they don't have to be, due to the prime location and constantly full tables. 

I was in there, after a race, hankering for a burger. Asked for it medium, it was closer to well done. The really disappointing thing? It was served with these not so great potato chips. Nothing was listed with the burger on the menu, and perhaps I was wrong to assume it would be fries, but it was too hectic in there for me to get more of a second or two of the server's time, so there you have it. 

Burger and potato chips...reminds me of my Catholic school days when we had Burger King burgers for special lunch and got Lays potato chips as a side. Not the best!

The burger was fine, but nothing I'll be rushing back to. I am sure I'll be back to Perry's again, as my friends like it, but I won't be rushing back there on my own.
author: Annie F.

description:
There are great restaurants and there are good restaurants. Great restaurants, you go for the food. Good restaurants are for something else. In the case of Perry's, that would mean comfortable, easy surroundings, tasty comfort food, and bartenders that know their bourbon. 

Yes, Perry's is a good restaurant.

San Francisco lacks hangout joints like New York's. Perry's is the closest I've found so far. I'll see you there.
author: Christian R.

description:
Location: conveniently located in the Marina on Union, close to a lot of shops etc. 

Food: my fries were over-cooked and I had to mask the burnt taste with loads of ketchup.  My chicken BLT was more like eating cardboard than anything and the potato skins were completely tasteless...bon appetite!

Service: RUDE! I love it when hostesses think that they're the gatekeepers of some exotic utopia and IF you are lucky enough, they might favor you and get you a table.  Oh, and I love love LOVE when you ask your server for another napkin or a refill on your water and they 1. Look at you like you're a complete idiot and 2. React in a way that makes you feel like you're putting them out and how dare you request such an impossible task!

So...I think the one star is pretty self-explanatory :|
author: Candice M.

description:
I had brunch here last weekend.  We chose it solely because it had open seats outside.  The mostly-shaded outdoor seating is quite pleasant.  

The service was good.  No complaints there.

I ordered a cafe au lait, and it was served with lots of foam in a tall glass.  Nice presentation, I guess.  

Unfortunately, the food was not very good.  I ordered the fresh fruit plate, which had not so fresh fruit and yogurt.  It wasn't awful, but not good.  My friend's scramble was also reportedly sub-par.  I think this is probably a 2.5 star.  

Brunch is such a wonderful thing, it should never be less than amazing.
author: Paul L.

description:
I decided to give Perry's another visit since my last (which was 1 year before this writing). I called a good friend and asked if he would like to meet me for a mid-week, mid-afternoon bite. 

We lucked out in happening to find a proximate street parking spot (surprisingly) our spot did not require a meter, either. 

Perry's had not changed at all since my last meal there. There were outdoor tables (sidewalk) but all were taken. We decided to sit at a high top table opposite the bar (this permitted us to also view several flatscreen tv's with news and sports playing). 

Our waitress was one of Perry's daughters. She was most courteous, attentive and informative. Our orders were simple: a well made/well presented burger and a Ruben sandwich, nicely garnished. We had beers (of course) and their offerings were numerous (they likely will have whatever swill you ask for). 

Only downer: the bartender (with 5 - 8 bar-side customers at any time) was more obvious than any of the patrons and/or the audio from the flatscreens!) I am not hard of hearing but I think he, unfortunately, might be. 

You, too, can enjoy Perry's as it's style and decor have not changed a bit in 40 years. We were glad we picked this spot for a mid-afternoon get together.  Hope you do, too!
author: Steve L.

description:
Where the cougars eat! The place is an SF institution, but food quality has fallen off a bit since I started eating at this place. I'm not sure, but this place used to have a lobster Wednesday and Saturday, that's pretty much the only thing I go for. 

But where it lacks in food, it gains in social interaction. During sports games, it's a cool place to just post and watch a game. And I've had some good conversations with people there, so it ranks high on my list in a city where people for the most part avoid each other.
author: Douglas L.

description:
I usually come here when all other decent food options are closed (think 11pm Friday nights)

While I can't really say too much about the lunch atmosphere, the dinner here is great.

The waiters and bartenders crack jokes, serve up good beer and liquor, and entertain you if you sit at the bar. I usually get the burger and its never been bad. 

Service is also good. Waiter brought out a Turkey club instead of a regular club and our friend got the meal for free =)
author: CK Y.

description: Came here yesterday for a late breakfast and although the service was slow, the food was delicious. The breakfast omelets were fluffy and amply stuffed with fresh ingredients ranging from sour cream and salsa to bacon and ham for the hardcore carnivores. The potatoes were BOMB, the smaller cubes developed a crisp crunch while the larger chunks still had that softness making it like two potatoes in one. The prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was young and upbeat.
author: Daniel K.

description: Service staff wasn't all that good and food is ok only. Wats up with that attitude! I didn't appreciate them snubbing us
author: Meredith C.

description:
I've been to Perry's on several occasions: lunch, brunch, dinner, and drinks. 

I don't know why I keep going back. Maybe it's because I just know it's there, and I know what to expect. 

Brunch was relatively tasty. I got the huevos rancheros, and they were good. For dinner, I tried a special steak sandwich of theirs. The food, in general, is what you would expect. It's pretty good, but nothing that will change your life.

The ambiance, however, just doesn't do it for me. I've sat outside twice because the inside was too loud, or too drunk, or just seemed pretentious. (Yep, that's what I said: it "seemed" pretentious.) The seating in the front is more lively (around the bar, of course), and there is a huge seating area in the back that is just... fine. A few TVs and a very quiet scene, which is generally where they seat the families. 

The two hostesses that I've dealt with acted rude or apathetic, as though it was a chore to seat us-- even though I would go out of my way to be nice to them. 

The waitstaff is great. Always friendly and relatively speedy. And Perry's has a few good beers on tap. 

So, knowing me, I will be back again. And the food will be good and the service will be fine. But I'm not looking forward to it like I normally would look forward to a meal out...
author: Lauren M.

description:
Deep Thoughts:

Sometimes when I think about fresh salad it is often ruined by overbearing dressing.  It's like what should have been advertised was salad dressing with lettuce toppings.

Every now and I then I like seafood in my diet.  Fresh seafood is often best and full of nutrition.  Next best is all forgotten cod.  A relatively tasteless fish that is often brought to life by deep frying it in beer batter or massive amounts of oil and butter.  Using a cornmeal crust destroys the cods little flavor by producing a breading that is gooey, soggy and overbearing.  Now honestly, if I'm intent on destroying my body, it better damn taste good.    

Charging $2.75 for a soft drink is fine.  Most restaurants do that these days; it's part of staying in business.  But most of these restaurants offer free refills for charging that much.  Charging $1 to refill coke when 3/4 of the cup was ice is in bad taste.  If a restaurant is that desperate to make a buck, increase the price of your entrees.  Oh wait ... looks like Perry's already did that.   Shhhhhh....

Generally I don't gripe about servers.  Servers often work hard, wear their feet out and are subjected to hot plates and high maintenance customers.  This poor guy ... are you sure he's a server?  I don't think he spoke English.  He never checked on us.  He might as well have been a drone punching a time clock.  I don't remember seeing a crank in his back. 

Sometimes now when I think about alcohol and food, I have forgotten about Perry's.  Other places in the Marina seem to offer better food, better service.  After all, the Marina is full of people with plenty of cabbage.   Who wants cabbage ... anybody .... Bueller??
author: Bill P.

description:
Turn the little "food snob knob" down a little and enjoy a decent casual neighborhood bar.  Sure it's expensive, but it's San Francisco, and on Union street.  What were you expecting?  

The burgers are good, the beer is cold, and the bartenders are friendly.  Definitely sit out on the patio if the weather is nice.
author: Sean W.

description: Pretty solid american food at this San Francisco staple. I have been here a couple times for salads and sandwiches. Their crunchy breadsticks are yummy and a nice break from the usual bread. Nothing to really rave about but like I said, if you are looking for a reliable place to go this will definitely not let you down.
author: Kristen L.

description:
Casual American fare with a heavy-on-the-salt chef! Nice for a larger group meeting...their back room is seperate from the rest of the space, which allows for good celebration, speeches, etc..
I could imgaine this would be a good neighborhood place where you ate the same thing each time you visited. Good value for your money.
author: jodes l.

description: Great atmosphere, good food, i liked it.  If you're feeling like soup, the tomato bisque was pretty legit.
author: Amie W.

description: Straight-up American fare.  Classic pub atmosphere.  Wine specials on Mondays and Thursdays.  Great burgers, wings, looking forward to trying the Wednesday lobster special.  Great Fish and Chips on Fridays.
author: Chet M.

description: Fantastic place. Really fast and good quality services as well foods.
author: rodolphocardoso

description:
Very interesting place its like a super super fancy Fridays. The company I use to work here always had their happy hours here or if the boss wanted to take us out for dinner.

Service was really good, very quick and good food.

All I can remember they had this really good Strawberry Short Cake very good!
author: Conchita B.

description: Cute restaurant with a nice bar. The food was okay but location is worth it, esp if you get a table outside-great for people watching.
author: Malak M.

description:
Five stars for a place where their parfait didn't come with non-fat yogurt? Oh yeah. A few reasons:

- It was pouring down rain. Perry's gave me dryness.
- It was busy, but the hostess still wanted to seat me at a table. I offered the bar to help save space. Perry's gave me a seat.
- The aforementioned parfait did not come with the yogurt was looking for, but it was still very generous, tons of fruit, and I got some milk on the side as a substitute. Amount for the money, one of the better ones in the city. Perry's gave me a satiated stomach.
- The girls next to me were recovering from last night, including one who was very open about her walk of shame. Perry's gave me good people watching.
- The bartender told me how to get to the presidio, where I needed to pick up my half marathon race packet. Perry's gave me directions.

Looking forward to continuing this story at their new Embarcadero spot.
author: Jason B.

description: Perry's is great! I've been coming here for years. The food is good, the bar is cool, good location right next to a parking garage. I've always had good service, and always walk out stuffed. I will remain loyal to Perry's!
author: Darren S.

description:
I came by today with my 11 year after some serious shopping on Union Street. We were sitting in a high-top table in the bar area watching March Madness and eating snacks around 6p. There was a younger couple sitting next to us having cocktails. Anyhoo- after we got our food, the girl sat in the guys lap and started making out with him. After about 5 minutes of this, I mentioned it to management (yeah they even saw them making out). So, the very very young hostess walks up to the guy and apologizes profusely before she even states why she is there, and eventually asked them if they could tone it down just a teeny bit, and apologizes again for bothering them. 

I must say I was blown away. I don't consider myself a prude, but if the shoe was on the other foot and they were subjected to me swapping spit in front of their kid, hmmm they might not think it the most appropriate restaurant behavior either. I really don't think I was wrong and wish I had a little more adult support!
author: Nicol B.

description:
I wasn't expecting too much from this place. Surprisingly the food was decent and the venue wasn't that bad.

For the price, you get a lot of food. I started off with the buffalo wings and they are by far the hottest buffalo wings I have ever had. I then proceeded with the spaghetti and meatballs. Huge plate I was unable to finish. I was stuffed to the bone.

Overall a good place to go and have a meal every now and then. Not too bad, not too good.
author: Diana R.

description: Good service. Food was great at brunch and the place was packed.
author: Stephen J.

description: I love Perry's... the wait staff is friendly and knowledgable and the food is delicious.  Everything I've tried so far has been really tasty.  It's a little pricey but the portions are pretty large (especially brunch) and can easily be shared.  I love the patio too - i love bringing my dog with us so it's perfect for him to hang out.  Nothing beats good food, good service, and good patio for my dog.
author: Monika F.

description:
Is there something in the beer here to make people socially retarded? I've gone to a lot of places by myself and made friends, this evening I was excited about having a partner in crime and even that didn't help to over come the social ineptness of people here.

Here's what happened:
1. bought a drink
2. got introduced to friends of a friend
3. had a conversation with those friends that was about as happening as watching a Giants game where Barry Bonds brought two bags of sunflower seeds instead of one.
4. chatted to my good friend
5. we both decided that this blows
6. pounded our beers and left.

This place was dead and it was a Thursday night.
author: Bryan B.

description: Older folks are seated in the back. Waitress   never offered bread, asked how our meal was or if we wanted desert. Chopped salad did not contain advertised ingredients. Wait staff must force a smile even when they might be having a bad day. We stopped in for lunch to revisit since we enjoyed this place 27 years ago while on our honey moon. Never again.
author: Eric C.

description:
Emmm yeahh... ummmm yeah...  I don't know.  I'm usually a fan of bar/pub food - you know burgers, quesadillas, steaks, fish & chips.  Usually a plethora of American food.  We stopped by here one Tuesday evening on a whim after trying to decide amongst the million places on Union & Chestnut streets.  I shouldve went with Cappinina!  Dammit!!!  

Anyway, it started off ok.  I didn't really like the decor, maybe just too dirty looking for me, with that tile floor and bar atmosphere.  But whatever, I just want a simple burger - that stuff doesn't really matter.  So the service was extremely slow this night.  Slow slow slow slow SLOW.  Did I mention slow?  Everyone gets off nights, fine whatever - gimme my burger.  We finally order, me choosing the veggie burger, my friends choosing the cobb salad, a cheeseburger, and a club sandwich.  Finally the food comes, SUPER SLOW DID I MENTION, and right before its served one of the waiters accidently knocks the plates over.  Boom, burgers flying everywhere with french fries in the mist.  It was in slow motion.  Ok fine, accidents happen whatever.  It took forever again!  You would think in an accident like that they might speed it up, but it just took forever.  Finally food comes.  It was what I expected - delicious, hearty portions.  However I didn't really like my veggie burger (not that it was bad) I just prefer veggie burgers that have more veggie/cheese in the patty then mostly smashed beans.  

Anyway I really thought since we were there for so long something would get comped off the receipt, especially in such an American place (I would NEVER expect this from a chinaman).  But no, nothing.  I was even charged twice for two icetea/lemondes because I asked for a refill.  $3.50 for half ice tea half lemonade, TWICE?  Not cool.  The only reason I had to order two beverages was because of the long wait.  And again, in America there are usually free refills!  Especially on something as cheap as ice tea.  

Eh, mediocre experience.  Half price wine did salvage some of this experience.  Will not be back.  Jovino is just to close!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Okay, i know i will get nasty comment from my review, but i don't get it? Why is Perry's SO popular? The decor is kind of cool, old school, and you can't beat the location. It's perfect for happy hour before going to your house and getting ready for a night out in the Marina and it's great for waking up hung over and drinking some bloody mary's or a mimosas. It's good, but not fantastic. I guess it's popular because it's an easy place to go to, and it's great for people watching when you're hung over from a night out watching the guys and girls do the walk of shame home. 

The mini-sliders are really good. I enjoy their happy hour the best. Not too fond on the brunch menu, especially the eggs benedict and even the burger is just okay.

It's usually crowded and you have to wait for a table for a while. Parking is difficult.
author: A.L. S.

description:
I have been literally coming to this place since I was a baby. My parents used to party here and still eat there during the day on a regular basis. Completely different crowd at night, young and hip. During the day, older, retired and mostly wealthy. On the weekends you have a combination of both. The bartenders are the same. The old school ones work during the week and the younger ones work the evenings and weekends. All are very nice. 

The menu is good but a bit pricey. The food is very consistent. They do have half off wine on Mondays and discounted food which is always nice. I love a bargain. Not sure about happy hour. Get their club sandwich, it's my favorite. They have fried chicken here as well, another favorite. Love that they have outdoor seating for a sunny day like today. A good place to go with friends or family.
author: Heather L.

description:
This bar and hamburgers place is a step down from the Balboa Cafe on Fillmore. The decor's not quite as polished, the food is less varied, and there isn't the wine selection.  

My dad seems to like Perry's a lot, and he's 63.  Take from that what you will.
author: Beau G.

description: YUM! breakfast was delicious- our reservation of 4 all enjoyed our meals for sunday brunch. The waiter was extremely delightful as well! Great vibe, good food- we will be returning for more!
author: Kate M.

description: Perry's is always one of our favorite places to have brunch or watch the Giants/49er games on the weekend. The grilled artichoke appetizer, Iceberg lettuce wedge and the Perry's burger kill. Get a table outside and enjoy the beautiful people of Union St.
author: Bill C.

description:
Nice lunch spot to go to once in a while. I wish the service was little bit faster. After all, lunch _is_ only so long. But overall, not bad. I'd go back again for a lunch date or something.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
For dinner it was fine, I'd come back to try brunch. It was surprisingly easy to get a table on a Friday evening. The bar was a little bit of a "scene," but great for people watching. 

The apps were yummy, but the food took way too long and had been sitting under a heat lamp. Overall, it was just fine. I wouldn't go out of my way to avoid it, but I won't be rushing back either.
author: Pumpkin K.

description: With all of the great food options on Union Street, this place resides somewhere between mediocre and really, really bad. At the very least, it is grossly overpriced for what you get. The service is good and the people are nice, but the food is so sub-par we can't go there except maybe for a drink at the bar. I had an omelette there last week and it was sloppy, watery and the veggies inside were flavorless. It looks like they've lost their passion, I don't know.
author: ed A.

description: Decent food, pleasant service, Ok prices. Just like the 3-stars says, it's "A-OK"
author: Morin O.

description:
* brunch review*

Headed here for brunch since it has a nice outdoor area as well as indoor corner for eating.

The service was prompt, there were many patrons, but the food blows.  I finally found a place in SF serving eggs benedict, the first I've tried outside of NY and I was more than a little disappointed.  The english muffin wasn't toasted, the ham was not cooked (tasted like straight out of the fridge) and the hollandaise sauce was inedible.  

I never imagined a brunch could go this wrong until Perry's.

In their defense, Perry's over in the FD is great for happy hour drinks and appetizers (calamari is to die for!).

This location and brunch = no good!  Only eat here if you are desperate for food and it's the only place open (which was my situation exactly).
author: Jenny K.

description:
So my friend Bartlett convinced me and some others that we simply HAD to have this drink that they serve at Perry's. It's like a bloody mary, except instead of tomato juice, there's beef bouillion. Doesn't that sound gross? If you think it sounds gross, then you're right because it is. 

I liked the crowd, though. Lots of old people and young people. Bartlett told us that he was there one a New Year's Day, and some old guy got so  drunk that he dropped his pants in the middle of the bar, and then in recompense bought the entire bar a round. Sweet, huh?
author: Sahra H.

description:
I went for dinner with my mom and it was excellent!  We ordered wine and salad, which came with way too much dressing.  My mom really liked it and it was the perfect atmosphere for the two of us.

I went later for brunch with my friends and we sat in the back patio.  It was so loud I couldn't even hear my friends.  I was not totally impressed with my food, but I am willing to go back and try it again.
author: Julie R.

description:
I'd heard Perry's did a mean cheeseburger and, having made the best burger EVER, myself, at home, only days earlier, I had to compare. The burger was cooked to order (medium rare!), juicy, flavorful, and overall damned good. If I was just reviewing the burger I think they'd nail a solid five stars! but...

The Guinness tasted like funk. You heard me - funk. You mess with my Guinness you better believe your gonna loose stars! Now in all fairness, when I told the waitress "This tastes funky" she was polite and replaced my drink for me. Good customer service? Slowly earnin those stars back... 

I try to avoid the Marina whenever possible (yup! I'm one of THOSE people!) but next time I'm around and looking for a burger I know where I'll be coming.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Perry's hardly needs my review to make a difference in their thriving business, but I'll go anyway.

It's okay, but it's not anything special.  I don't understand why people rave about it so much.  I'm not saying that I won't go back, because if I go by and there's a table out in front on a warm afternoon, sure, I'll take a seat and hang out for a while.  But people really rave!!!  I don't get it.
author: Laura H.

description: you can run into some issues w making a reservation but apart from that Perrys delivers and you always know what to expect
author: Alex A.

description: I love the french onion soup and the fried chicken on a cold foggy day. A perfect old school San Francisco experience. Perfect location and I always feel like a local. I love the staff and the service they provide. You just can't find service like this anyplace but in San Francisco, The service capitol of the world.
author: Ebert S.

description:
I had fairly high expectations for this place, having passed perrys for years now, and there always being a brunch crowd and long wait (on sunny days anyway)..we came here last minute for lunch, as rex didnt have outdoor seating today (i was looking for somewhere with good bloody reviews).

My boyfriend got the hamburger and actually found it better than he expected (VERY rare), although it did take a very long time to get it, and we were in a hurry.  Also, the server was fairly rude, and his burger was fairly well done rather than 'medium rare' as requested.  My bloody was pretty awful, all tabasco (i love spicy, but not via tabasco), and was served in a wine class, inevitably providing less to drink than a typical glass.

We asked the waitress to split it, and she said "REALLY?!" in a shocked and somewhat rude manner, and my boyfriend described her as having a scowl on her face at all times when she wasnt throwing in a smile in response to a question one may have...also i dont think she refilled our waters at any point in time..

All in all, I wouldn't come back, as there are so many better options at which to sit outside on Union street! I wish it had lived up to my expectations!
author: Danielle J.

description:
Perry's is a great spot for dinner or lunch. Fantastic people-watching inside or outside. The Cobb Salad is to die for. I'm not usually one to order a salad as my complete meal, I feel like it is a waste of going to a restaurant if all you'll have is their salad. But at Perry's, the gigantic Cobb salad is so tasty and filling that it makes the perfect meal.

Perry's has a very "clubby" feel--dark walls and lots of leather, as though you stepped into an upscale men's sportsbar. While it's a relaxed, casual place, it also retains a certain level of elegance. Maybe it's the people that dine there, but it's one of those "nice" places you can take your parents too without feeling like you're dining at your parents' favorite restaurant...if that makes any sense.

The service is good though when it gets really busy you might have trouble tracking down your server.

But after that cobb salad...it really doesn't matter.
author: Sophie D.

description:
If you are looking for an uber Marina spot to watch the game on a weekend, you have found your spot.  I was there w/ my guy on Sunday, now he is usually a sports FREAK, but the afternoon was a bit off as we had to wait to sit in the back, which I'll admit was quieter than the front, yet still really loud.

The tomato bisque was hearty and even had toasty bread hunks on the tops, which complemented it well.  Then I moved onto the chicken fingers.  Bad move on my part.  I expect, as one does to have fried chicken creations to be crisp.  Not so much, these were bendy and not in a good way.  Granted these were Buffalo chicken crisps, yet I had them w/ sauce on the side.  Still bendy...

Onion soup was quite good, as were the crab cakes.  I was lucky enough to get  a bite.  I know my favorite part of the afternoon was when I walked upstairs to the bathroom, and heard 2 guys chatting and one said, 'this is a cougar den', and his buddy responds, 'No, Pumas man!!!'

And believe you me, they are spot on w/ the analogy.
author: Nicole F.

description:
Had brunch at Perry's. It was alright. Nothing great to say about this place, but nothing horrible either. Melissa opted for breakfast - scrambled eggs with chicken sausage. The potatoes didn't even come close to Polkers (best potatoes in town!). I had the grilled chicken BLT. It was alright. Probably wouldn't get it again though. 

Three stars for the ambiance. We sat in the sun room toward the back of the restaurant. It was nice to have light pour over the table, especially cuz the rest of the restaurant seemed so dark.
author: Annie Z.

description:
i really enjoyed my experience here.  We tried: 

Sliders - really good
Fries - sub-par
Quesadillas - good
Mac and Cheese - good
Baby spinach salad - good 

Good, hearty American food.  The service is a little spotty, but friendly.  Definitely will go again!
author: Robyn F.

description: I live near this place and I go here quite often... There's a back dining room so there's rarely a wait. It's great for brunch, my default spot to bring out of towners.  The staff is always friendly although not always the speediest. The food is good, some of it great! The vibe is laid back and fun with lots of character in the decor. The bar is fun to watch sports in and there is amazing "bar food" and a full bar.
author: Erica L.

description:
Love the cobb salad here!  

It's in my neighborhood so it's like "the kitchen".

It's a comfortable place to kick back for brunch, lunch or a quick cocktail.
author: Mic D.

description: Tried this place a couple of time and every time I am more and more dissapointed. From food not coming out to having hairs in my food. I really love the location and the place itself but some of the food has just been really bad.
author: Steve M.

description: We went for brunch on Christmas day, and it was pretty good. Nothing exciting. We sat at the bar, and I had a Bloody Mary and a Mimosa. I watched the bartender make the Bloody Mary: Salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, well vodka, and generic tomato juice served in a 10oz goblet. She goes heavy on the worcestershire, so I would request less next time. I much prefer horseradish as a flavoring. It was ok, not bad or good, but pricey for how not exciting it was. I had the veggie omelette, which comes with home fries and toast. The home fries are also not exciting. They were big cubes of potato, lightly fried in oil, no herbs or seasoning. I know you can be overwhelmed and underwhelmed, and it has already been asked if you can just be whelmed. I was whelmed. Another ok breakfast place that I wouldn't choose, but wouldn't mind if someone wanted to meet there.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
Perry Butler copied P.J. Clarke's (http://www.pjclarkes.com), a Manhattan institution and stuck it in SF. He gets a lot of credit for copying one of the coolest bar n grills ever. But it IS a copy. You can feel it - it's manufactured.

Burgers are good. Club sandwiches are dry. I think the place is over-rated. Skip down the hill to Liverpool Lil's instead.
author: Don W.

description:
After a day of bathing suit shopping the girls were in dire need of alcohol and food. I absolutely love the Cobb salad, never fail bit of yumminess. We also ordered calamari and artichokes. Um, Ya half way through the second artichoke as my pure luck would have it a MAGGOT in the leaves!! 
Truly we almost barfed right there. 
Thank god our waitress was super sweet and treated us to a round of mimosas. 
I'll stick to the salad
author: Douggers M.

description:
Why I like Perry's :
The Blood Mary, YUM!
The Eggs Benedict, WOWSA!
The Location, close enough to do a roll out.
Potato Skins, mmmmm!

Why I dislike Perry's:
The Prices!

Why do I feel like I'm getting totally raked over the coals when the check comes??!!?
author: Erica A.

description:
