Went here with a group of friends. The restaurant definitely has character, which would be great if you could eat picturesque surroundings. If you came here for a quiet drink and nothing else, you'd probably come away with a better impression.

However, we wanted dinner. The clam chowder was rubbery, the macaroni and cheese was basically noodles floating in water sprinkled with bread crumbs, and the smoked chicken sandwich was credit-card size and made from standard deli meat...yet it was still hard to swallow (the $14 price tag for the sandwich alone, that is). I'm not against spending $30 to $50 on a decent meal, but it's irksome to pay $25 for the equivalent of a Lunchables pack.

If you want to read stuff on the walls, this is a great place to sit and do so. If you want a tasty, fairly-priced meal, I don't recommend it.
author: Garrett M.

description:
I've read the reviews, was recommended by my friends, pass here all the time on the weekends when we go bar hopping in Cow Hollow, and last night after a meet up, my co-worker and I decided to hit this place up.

When we arrived, the greeter was having a grand ole conversation with their chaps, but noticed us right away to sit us down. 

The waiter, old guy, very helpful and courteous. Food was ready like speedy gonzales.

We had two long islands and it's been two years since I had one, so I'm not sure what it suppose to taste like anymore. My friend, he mentioned it was a bit too much tequila in his.

He ordered a Caesar salad as a starter and some rosette dish. The salad was rather small. 

As for me, I had their special, crumb crusted, oven toasted, halibut served with mashed potatoes and spinach. It was a little dry and very hot. I think it wasn't suppose to be this dry if it was crusted and baked in an oven. More like it was microwaved after it was removed from the oven. Regardless, I ate it up and my tummy was aching from drinking on an empty stomach.

The decor is nice and cozy, a place for a romantic date. It has the old school feel, but nothing like Mel's Diner. 

The Giants game happened to be on and the place suddenly turned into a cheering bar when bottom of the 9th, 2 outs, and a hitter managed to turn a 1-4 score into a tie with the Atlanta Braves (my old home team). That actually made my day. :)
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I've dined at Perry's often over the past couple of years - the food is ok but by no means terrific, but hey, I like the location.  More often than not, I was waited on by by the cutest, nicest waitress named Katie.  She was always friendly and made my Perry's visit fun.  The other day I went there and she was not there.  I was then told that she had been let go!  This shocked me (obviously for the reasons I mentioned above).  The food is not good enough to keep me coming back, so if Perry's doesn't like friendly waitresses, I don't like Perry's.

For the Corkage Fee, go to www.SFCorkageFees.com!
author: Brittney B.

description:
there are 2 things that i HATE the most while dining out 1.) restaurants that serve COLD butter with their bread/dinner rolls 2.) restaurants that serve salad with the dressing on the side. unless i specifically ask for that i expect my salad to be coated in dressing when it is brought out to my table. 

i work down the street from perry's so i frequent this joint. food is good to decent and service is usually okay i've never had problems with the wait staff until today.  i called in my order; the cobb salad. i asked for the salad to be tossed with extra dressing on the side.  i wouldn't be so turned off just because the salad WAS NOT tossed. BUT when i asked for my total the lady who took my order told me just come in 20 mins and hung up on me! 20mins to make a salad? really? it wasn't even that busy.

i wish i would of gotten her name because i got that same kind of service when i came in to pick  up my order she was RUDE and didn't seem interested in my business so i will no longer be eating at perry's as long as i see her at the front. 

their service whether it be for take out or dining in should be consistent and any customer should be treated with a little bit of respect.  there are so many restaurants up and down union that i'd rather take my business to someone who will appreciate me and give me that little bit. 

3 stars: 2 for the food and 1 for the service i USUALLY receive.
author: Elle T.

description:
Bland.  That's about all I can say.  Everything about this place's food is bland.  Started off with the Clam Chowder and Tomato Bisque, which was so-so, but only after the addition of Tabasco and pepper and salt with a smattering of salted crackers.  The English bangers sausage tasted like I was chewing a soggy piece of French bread....except the French bread probably has a tad bit more flavor.  Chinese chicken salad was just as bland....but as an added bonus, we got grease!  Lots of greasy vermicelli-look-alike noodles.  The best part of the meal?  Whole wheat toast with butter & strawberry jam.

Service was ok.  

I just cannot believe this place is as packed as it is.  Shocking!
author: Randy C.

description: Semi decent, but standard American-type food.  Never had anything really spectacular here but its nice to come to Sunday afternoons, have a couple bloody marys with an eggs benedict. The bartenders and wait staff are all nice, and Ive never had to wait for a table, unless it was for an outdoor one on a sunny day. Union street location has nice people watching, much better than the one on embarcadero, but the ambiance of the later cant be beat.
author: Jenn H.

description: We have only been to this restaurant a couple of times but each time holds a special meaning because the first time was after we decided to get married...and the next time was to celebrate an anniversary (after we got married!) The food was good but not "wow" good and the times we've been there it was fairly busy so the service was on the slow side.  When the waitress did come by she was very pleasant though.  I'd recommend a reservation b/c it seems like there would be a bit of a wait without one--thanks to OpenTable.com we we had our table ready for us with minimal wait time.
author: Mimi W.

description:
A really delicious, but really expensive breakfast.

I'm a big eggs benedict fan so I've had them at a million bajillion places.  These were really superb.  Top it off with my good morning blast of champipple in a delicious mimosa?  Please, the day is going to be amazing!

Then the check comes...ouch.  Since my wonderful boyfriend pays for everything, I chimed in with "let me get this one:"  Ouch I tell ya

But it was so good, worth a treat once in a while for a good breakfast!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
I would hate to ever rate anything just one star, because I believe if you've lasted in SF this long there has to be a brownie point hiding somewhere to be earned - and in this case the brownie point is for ambiance.

Perry's is your usual pub/bar joint, with the vintage decor on the walls and wooden bar. If you're the type to get nostalgic of having real drinks at a wooden bar while the bartender wears a starch white collared shirt and knows your name? Perry's may fit the bill. However being on Union St, it doesn't do anything for me. A and I had decided to have lunch here because the decor called out comfort.

Seated inside with a great sunny view outside, our waiter was at best attentive because it was his job, but could care less about adding some care to his customers. I had a cobb salad, which was alright - bacon overcooked and too crunchy (how can you ruin bacon? I tasted char in some of the bites) and the red wine vinegarette turned out to be more of an oily dressing which really diminish the flavors of everything else on the plate. He had meatloaf with creamy mash potatoes and veggies, which was the best of out two orders. The meatloaf was light, not too dry but the mash potatoes was yummy, you can taste the buttery goodness in every fork full.

The staff wasn't doing it for me, in a place like this I expected comfort and cheer. All I got was indifference, but I gotta give it to a wait staff who could stash glasses of malt liquor on the side and take a shot when ever needed. That's worth a brownie point too.
author: Jacquelyne L.

description:
This is my 1st Yelp review and I had to do it because the food was inedible. What was described as "crab cakes"-- expect size of hockey pucks with recognizable crab, were marble-sized fried batter "bombs" with no visual or taste of crab. Friend had a sandwich that had one little slice of Pastrami and the bread was fried, greasy-- he couldn't eat it.
Who the heck was in the kitchen that day? A real shame since Perry's "was" a Union Street institution and great all hours of the day.
author: Mary R.

description:
Soooooo - weve managed to drag ourselves into Perrys AGAIN and this time it was a Monday night. Half price bottles of wine! YAY! 
Oh and they must have the all-star team in the kitchen on Mondays, cause everything was great!
author: nicole w.

description:
Perry's is a wanna-be Balboa, that's a chain and average on a good day.  Some misguided sports fans come here to watch games, but my computer monitor at work is larger than the 1980's TVs they have on the walls.  No HD, not surround sound, checkered plastic table cloths...need I say more.

Btw, the martinis here are half-servings.  Ask for your drinks in a rocks glass and make sure they fill up the glass if you don't want to be disappointed.
author: John M.

description: Only gets 3 stars because of it's location.  Everything else is basically mediocre.  Had lunch there, but didn't enjoy it a bit.
author: Ani N.

description:
Have been in Cow Hollow now for over two years, spent many many hours in the bars and restaurants around Union Street and never been in Perrys until Brunch this morning.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised! (But not overwhelmed).

I like the bar / diner style of the restaurant, I still get a kick out of these kind of places which are quintessentially American.

I liked the atmosphere and the relaxed ambiance, but then it was Sunday morning so you don't expect house music and dancing.  The service was speedy and efficient and the food was tasty.   My review actually should have been a 3 star review, but I was compelled to give them an extra star for the English Bangers (i.e. sausages).  They reminded me of my Mum's fry-ups on a Sunday morning back in Yorkshire.  How could I not give it an extra star for that?  And you can guarantee I will recommend this place to my Mum when she pays a visit next time!
author: Dazza M.

description:
Initially, Perry's gave off the vibe of a TGIFridays - crap hanging all over the walls.

Once my ADD took over and I looked around, I found the "crap" provided a decent San Francisco history lesson.

The non-historic flat screens behind the bar feed my appetite for around-the-clock sports updates and the bartenders are attentive and prompt - I'm starting to like this place.

The club sandwich is very good but very large. You can also find sliders under  the 'appetizers', which I order as an entree because eating two mini-burgers still feels healthier than one full-size burger.
author: Jason N.

description:
yummy!

i love this place, especially the cobb salad. i also love all the cool shit on the walls. and the sidewalk seating. it's pretty much all love at perry's.
author: Janet G.

description:
Perry's has some amazing appetizers.... nice and cheesy. All of the stuff on the walls is totally cool and their brunch is great too. 

The energy in the place is good but I have to say I'm not a huge fan of the waitstaff
author: Janice J.

description: I was very excited to try Perry's on Union Street for lunch, but very disappointed!  Went with a party of 8 for a birthday celebration lunch.  We were seated in the back room, given water and breadsticks and did not see another person for over 30 minutes.  When our server finally showed up (after someone in our party went to ask the person who seated us) there was no apology or explanation given.  It took 15 more minutes to get our beverages and place our order.  Worst service I have ever received and to add insult to injury, there was a 20% gratuity added to our check.  Will not be back to Perry's!
author: Stacy H.

description:
Always wanted to go. Now I've been. Nothing especially bad, nothing especially good.

Why is it that when I go to the Marina - I don't feel White enough? (and I'm White - but my name's not Tad, Bif, or Skippy). It's like Stepford for 20-something social climbers.

Ambience was meh. Food was average. Ordered a Bacon/Cheddar omelet for brunch. Eggs were fluffy, potatoes were half-cooked, toast was toast. Coffee was good, but I had to stir my cream and sugar with a fork because they neglected to bring a spoon.

Waiter was nice, but when the food came, some bus-boy brought out the orders to several tables. He had to ask everyone who was having what. What's with that?

We sat up front by the windows. It was noisy. Tables were too close because my left elbow kept whacking into the old lady at the table to my left - who felt she just must sit all the way back in her chair. Scooch in honey - or lay off the carbs. 

Done with Perry's - probably won't be back. Kinda pricey too. Just the omelet was like $12.
author: Bill E.

description:
STAPLE restaurant. As some have said, the hostesses and waiters are all happy to help/energetic. 

They've done this pretty annoying thing where they took off delicious courses from their menu :( However, that being said, they still have the incredible classics (burgers, calamari etc.). Bartenders know what they are doing and the sports games on the TVs are always fun for the whole crowd! I'm only reviewing this for the night/dinner scene but I definitely recommend this place to my friends whenever we manage to ignore the "Union street tools." You know the guys I'm talking about.
author: Alex T.

description: This place is my offices lunch staple. We come in here multiple times a week. The Cobb salad is my favorite and I order it almost every time.  The place has great outside seating on Union Street and it is always fun to people watch.
author: Nina Q.

description: A real San Francisco insitutution - service is excellent and the drinks are stiff
author: Pan P.

description: Since I work in the neighborhood, you can find me here at least once a week. A solid 4 stars for consistently good food (-1 star for off service sometimes). The specials change weekly, and there are daily specials printed on the menu. Love the Organic Mixed Greens Salad with pine nuts, tossed in a champagne vinaigrette (and you can add goat cheese!). I haven't had a bad meal here yet. But, I'd stick with the main meal, as the desserts leave me feeling a bit unsatisfied.
author: Meredith K.

description: Perry's was one of the highlights of my trip to SF in 2005-- I went for the eggs benedict out on the sidewalk every morning I was there.  I still think back to what a good time we had... a great way to start each day
author: Susan B.

description:
Perry's really need 2 ratings systems, one for atmosphere and drinks (especially during weekend brunch) and one for food. Perry's is a fun place to hang out on the weekend and have some mimosas, especially if you get a coveted outside table. Their food, on the other hand, is usually terrible. I really hate to give any place a bad review, butI have eaten dinner there about 4-5 times and I honestly have been dissapointed each time. Half price wine night (I think it is Monday) is a good deal (you can get a really nice Ridge Zinfandel-my favorite!-for about 30 bucks) but it is a shame the food isn't that great. Don't got there for Lobster night, trust me on this one. 

I can say that I haven't been quite so dissapointed with their breakfast items, but I haven't been really excited about anything that I have gotten there. I think they may have had a decent Eggs Benedict

So I would say:

Breakfast: 3 Stars
Dinner: 1 Star
Wine pricing on wine night: 5 stars
Lobster night: 0 Stars
Atmosphere and mimosas for brunch: 5 Stars
author: John L.

description: Ok food, not spectacular for the price.  Service was sadly lackluster in my opinion; was never offered a refill on coffee or other drinks at the table.  Probably wouldn't go there again until they improved their food, prices, and/or service.
author: Dan P.

description: I always enjoy coming to Perry's. They have nice workers and their all American food is tasty. I appreciate a nice big juicy burger when I go there and my cravings are satisfied.
author: Raquele C.

description: My friend and I go here every Monday night that we can for the turkey dinner special for $13.95. It's like Thanksgiving all year long!
author: Sandra Q.

description: I love Perry's and crave their bloody Mary's and calamari.  However I wish they served Tarter sauce with the calamari.  The service and atmosphere is always nice and the food is never bad.  The breadsticks and butter alone is worth the trip.  Its a great place.
author: Party P.

description: Grabbed dinner last night with the GF, and as usual, enjoyed the experience.  The menu offers a wide variety of dishes as well as daily specials.  The pot roast is a favorite of mine.  The mix of patrons represents the typical marina-douche-type as well as the older, Pac. Heights locals.  The wine & beer selection is great and the mixed drinks are always heavy on the booze.  After 40+-years, they're doing something right.
author: Informed C.

description: I call this establishment, "Douchebag Central" because of the clientele I met there during the Union Street Fair in 2010. I guess that the North beach client set who also frequent the marina area of SF would love this place, but $5 for a corona, and $8 watered down mixed drink specials are their game. It's also the "white-est" bar in the entire city. the older people who were frequenting the establishment looked like they were being held hostage... And that was the most entertaining aspect of our entire visit. Avoid this place during this street fair like the plague.
author: Sam A.

description: A nice place for a quick bite...seems like a neighborhood hangout for most local in the area
author: JD R.

description: An old favorite when I'm in the Union St area. Surprisingly good breakfasts and all around solid food. You're not eating at a fancy restaurant, so don't expect that, but it's a classic place with decent service (usually) in a great location.
author: Tristin S.

description:
The service sucked but the food was good. A little pricy but that is due to the neighborhood they are located in. 
Both hostesses were not friendly and had a problem that the reservation for 5 was now only for 4. I have worked at a restaurant and that is never a problem, actually makes things easier. The waitress never refilled our drinks and the soups were not brought out first, everything came all at once. They are lucky the food was good, otherwise i would have given them one star.
author: Elisa L.

description:
I've known about Perry's for years and heard good things about it being a great standby restaurant. Still, it wasn't until recently that I finally made it to one of the Perry's locations on Union. My walking group decided to end a long walk there, which meant we were hungry and not always the most patient, tolerant bunch. However, whatever patience and tolerance we lacked, Perry's more than made up for as they very nicely adjusted our reservation to accommodate 2 unexpected additions to our group (and then again when one person wasn't able to attend after all). We didn't have to wait long at all for Perry's to get us in to a larger spot.
There's a ton of options for both breakfast and lunch and drinks, both alcoholic and non-. My friend saw the eggs benedict arrive for another customer and immediately decided on that b/c it looked so good. They nicely did the hollandaise on the side for my other friend who ordered it. Another friend got pancakes while myself and another friend both ordered the club sandwich.

We also got a roasted artichoke appetizer to share with the table. Dee-lish--perfectly roasted yet not greasy or overly seasoned, just simple goodness.There was nothing but raves about the eggs benedict--the egg was declared to be perfectly poached. While there was less enthusiasm about the breakfast potatoes, I personally loved them and helped myself to these.The club sandwich was pretty dry, although far be it from me to complain about a place where you don't have to ask for mayo on the side. Some ketchup helped. I also appreciated that you got the option of salad or fries with a sandwich at no additional charge. Prices were quite reasonable especially considering the sizeable amount of tasty food you get. Perry's, you are indeed a stand-by and a solid choice anytime I'm looking for some simple, inexpensive, yet tasty grub..
author: Megan K.

description: I was drug here with a group of friends on Christmas Eve. Who knew? We got off work around noon and my pal had left his credit card here the night before, so we had to retrieve, and the cab ride was free. Normally I cringe if I know I'm headed anywhere within 10 blocks of the Marina, but for some reason this drinking escapade was amusing and entertaining in the same breath. The place to sit is the bar, with appetizers tasty and aplenty, and some great beers on tap, along with a sarcastic bartender with a heavy hand and a great sense of humor. The remaining clientele were Botoxed to the hilt, or wearing snow boots and skirts because it was 50 degrees outside (love the snow boots when it gets cold- no snow/ice to be seen, but snow boots aplenty).
author: Braden B.

description:
after sunday's Giants/Dodgers game (....GO GIANTS!!! 3-1), we all decided to walk around the marina...and...uh...eat some more (...like we didn't just fill our bellies with 4 orders of garlic fries, hot dogs, beer, and lemonade)!

we really wanted to dine in the sun since it was such a nice day...but...so did everyone else, SO we settled for the table by the window.

as the six of us sat down...each of us had the same thing on our mind, which was, "who the hell wanted to eat?!"

making the most out of it...we decided to order something to share with our better halves...

couple #1
-Deviled Dungress Crab Cakes
-Classic Ceasar Salad

couple #2
-Perry's Chopped Salad
-Mac and Cheese

couple #3
-Rueben Sandwich w/side salad

the food's ok...nothing too exciting...
it took a while for us to be fed...but our waiter acknowledged it, since i heard him mumble while running to the kitchen, "where the hell's their food?"

i'd come back on a nice day...if they have an open table outside.
author: Nancy T.

description: Recently dined with 2 kids. The food was really bad all around.  I am not that picky but caesar salad was limp and full a white dressing that did not resemble a typical caesar salad dressing. The Maryland Crab Cakes were clearly frozen pucks tossed in the deep fryer.  Even the kids food was off.  They should know not to put much, if any, pepper on a kids pasta dish.  Lastly, the artichoke appetizer was tasteless and leaves tough.
author: Christopher G.

description: really enjoyed my visit here ... the waitress emma was very friendly and polite great place for brunch
author: Fiona R.

description: Good sidewalk seating with the dog.  Food is unispired but in a great location.  If you decide to eat inside there will be a loud television blasting and the bar crowd dominates the rest.
author: Fred G.

description: How is it I've never gotten around to reviewing Perry's before now? Probably because it's one of those out-of-sight, out-of-mind type places . . . never a destination unto itself, but good enough for a nosh if you're browsing in the neighborhood. There may be a distinct Cow Hollow/Marina yuppie vibe in the air, but the decor was inspired by the neighborhood saloons on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, owner Perry Butler's stomping ground before he transplanted to San Francisco. The Third Avenue look and feel - checkered tablecloths, panelled walls covered with an eclectic collection of photos, posters, and the like, and lots of live greenery - was very different way for these parts back then; now it's pretty standard for venues like this. A Union Street institution for well over thirty years, this popular dining spot focuses on basic American favorites like hearty sandwiches, inventive salads, burgers and fries, chili, pastas, steaks, and grilled fresh fish at affordable prices. Grab a seat on the patio if the weather is nice.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Apologies in advance -- as this is going to be one of those reviews that probably won't help you out too much, because Perry's is, quite simply ... "just okay." And I've been to this location and the one near Kearny. Not bad enough to call underwhelming -- not good enough to warrant accolades. So if you're feeling wishy-washy and non-committal while hunting for a brunch, lunch, or dinner stop, it's not the worst you could do. Damn, this review almost put ME to sleep.
author: Gregor G.

description: I'm not one of those people who hate the Marina.  The people there are ok, as far as I can tell.  They're pretty and rich, but I don't hold it against them.  Perry's was a great place for a cheeseburger and fries.  The waiters and staff were ok, and the prices were high for what they serve.  I liked the back room.  It had lots of natural light.
author: Honey L.

description: Food was fine. Standard pub/sports bar. Service was efficient.
author: Saul E.

description:
I go here once in a while for lunch.  Today: Marie the french intern and I headed to Perry's for soup, because she has a cold.  I ordered tomato bisque and a small Caesar (which was wayy too much food).  The bisque was good and served really hot with croutons on top.  The Caesar was only okay, the dressing didn't have much flavor, and seemed like it had a lot of mayo in it, and no garlic.  Marie ordered the chunky vegetable (Marie parie: "what does this mean? chunky?" me:"Uh, with big, chunks? Pieces? like, it has vegetables in it.") she liked it very much.  A bowl of soup will set you back $6.75.  Their salads are too expensive.  when we walked in, a channel five news crew was interviewing a group of 3 girls about the 49ers.  They asked us if we were fans, but I was having a bad hair day so I said "i am sorry but i don't know anything about them, what are they?" in my best French accent.  They left us alone.  
The service here is really slow, it took us like 15 min after we ordered to get our soup! Soup! Soup is pre-made, people.  But I like the decor and all the (sorry guys) old men who work here.  They are classic.

__________
Update: went back again for more soup, they have really awesome bacon bits! so crispy!
__________
Update 2: Check out my compliments, the chef from the downtown Perry's wrote to me to say that he would be looking into the ceasar issue, and that he would buy me a free salad.  While I won't take him up on this on principle, I really appreciate the fact that he took the time to read the reviews and act upon them!  It shows he cares about both locations and is actively trying to improve, there is nothing worse than a multi-location restaurant with a stale formula, and I don't think Perry's will ever fall into this category because they are very conscious!
author: Natalie K.

description:
The original 'fern bar' of the late 70's and early 80's. Ooohhh boy if these walls could talk!
At any rate outdoor, indoor and back of the restaurant quiet dining. I've only eaten lunch here a few times. The staff is really friendly the food is decent and they've got the obligatory tv at one end of the 'pick-up' bar.  There was a story a couple of years ago about Perry's being the original pick up bar in the Marina area. I actually talked with the bartender (I think that was Perry) a few years ago and he seemed like a nice fellow. 
Food is average (for San Francisco) the setting is pleasant. It may be fun for people of all ages for lunch...there may still be a little gold chain action on weekend nights...I wouldn't know.
author: Craig M.

description: This popular restaurant and bar is another San Francisco tradition that everyone should experience at least once.  The extensive menu consists mainly of solid meat-and-potatoes pub grub, but they have steaks too.  I had the chili bowl with onions and grated cheddar cheese which was awesome.  Had I not been eavesdropping on the argument unfolding between two patrons at the table next to ours I would have paid more attention to the decor and setting. Priorities.
author: Rick H.

description:
Whole wheat sliced bread, processed turkey, mayo and chips at Perry's 10.50.
Whole wheat sliced bread, processed turkey, mayo and chips at home $2.45.
Yelping about overpriced sliced turkey, priceless.

Update... Margie did email and apologize and say they changed it from the menu. You have to appreciate the follow up and the changes and am adding a star just for that!
author: Misti L.

description:
In attempt to cure my hangover on Sunday, I went with some friends for lunch... and stuffed myself like Thanksgiving turkey. The Kir Royal revived my buzz from the night before, and the all american cuisine was just mouthwatering to look at. I had the mac and cheese (good, but pale in comparison to Home just down the street), mini cheeseburgers, and the calamari. Could've done without the calamari, it was pretty boring. Plus I didn't like the cornmeal crust they used instead of the regular batter. AND the cocktail sauce was more ketchupy than spicy. But we had fun, were loud, drunk and ran into a bunch of friends there who were also loud and drunk. Don't think the older patrons much cared for us. Some dirty looks were thrown our way as we were leaving. Oh well. we still had fun, and the manager bought us a round of shots ;)
Oh.... and on a side note, this place falls from 4 stars to 3, because the hostess was a BIATCH. So unfriendly, and did not get us the outside table like she was supposed to, and allowed some other group to just walk up and sit there instead. And when we said to her, hey weren't you supposed to let us know when our table was ready? She told us to go talk it out with the group that snagged the table on our own! I was like huh??? isn't that YOUR job? to manage the seating?? Guess she was just too busy flirting with some guy instead. I hope the servers don't tip her out much cause she is SO not worthy of any of it.
author: Marina K.

description: Walked by this place and just decided to have Brunch. It was awesome! I had Crabcakes with Hollandaise on English Muffins which sounds weird but it was good. I loved how it reminded me of NYC with the cool decor and the great skylights in the middle of the restaurant. I need to go back there soon!
author: Charm N.

description:
Food is somewhat decent.  Inevitably the slowest and worst service you'll ever receive.  Want a drink to start dinner?  You *might* have a waiter greet the table within the first 20 minutes of sitting down.  And then *might* get your drink within 10 minutes after that.  If you're lucky.  Really, really lucky.  Then you may get your food, even if it's just a burger, within an hour.

Decent food.  Waiters are all dipshits.  Most customers are dipshits too - typical California douche-bags.  I ate here simply because it was the closest place to my apartment, and my girlfriend at the time was worthless and never cooked shit.

Again, if Perry's wasn't in San Francisco, they would be out of business after a month.  But for some reason, making customers wait forever, and serving mediocre food is the standard in this town, so they seem to fill seats.

San Francisco desperately needs more chain restaurants to make local businesses quit being so lazy.  And full of themselves.  And actually serve customers.
author: Benjy E.

description: I am updating my rating on this place. The very first time we went here (my girlfriend and I.) The ancient host (male) Acted like it was very stressful to even answer a simple question, like "How long will the wait be?" But we did get in, and the food is nothing special, but just ok if you will... But the reason I am down grading Perry's is that the other day we went there for breakfast. And there was not even a hostess at the door to give us a seat. We waited, and waited... Nothing! People dinning inside watching us just standing in he entry feeling abused! Finaly we went inside to try and get service... (seated) And the ditzy hostess was walking by with a menu in her hands. We told her we had waited for seating, and needed to be seated. She like a dumb twit had the gawl to try and say we are supposed to wait outside! And that she was only gone a second! We explained that we were out there and she wasn't! Then we left! My girlfriend then went back and told her straight of how it went down... and that she was not there.. The hostess called her a liar in front of other customers! Not smart! NEVER GOING BACK!
author: Kirk M.

description: One of the better burgers I've had in San Francisco and if it's warm and sunny the outside seating can't be beat.  I've had a very good bloody mary here too.
author: Kevin S.

description: My experience here started off a bit shaky. The hostess didn't know how long a table for six would take. And the waitress wasn't very helpful in explaining the difference between their home fries & french fries. I believe her response was something to the effect of "home fries are potatoes, french fries are french fries". WTH - aren't french fries made out of potatoes as well? ANYHOO. None of us got sick from eating there, so I think it's safe to say we got spit-free dishes. Also, after we got our food, the waitress mellowed out her attitude. So all's well that ends well, right? :)
author: calivanilla c.

description: Nice place for brunch with a group.  The bacon is quite tasty.  Not super cheap, not too fancy, just a nice place to go.  Kind of like someone you can always count on.
author: Heather R.

description: Very tasty fare, mostly classic American (meatloaf, pot roast etc) and a good range of beers. Fast and friendly service and, by Cow Hollow standards, good value. Nice bustly atmosphere. There's a second room at the back which is quieter and means that you can usually get in without a reservation.
author: elanman

description: Decent place in the Marina.  It was one of the few restaurants on Union that had openings, so we stopped by.  The food was pretty good...really liked the vegetable frittata (although I didn't know this was a dinner) and my girlfriend liked the swordfish.  The wines were tasty too.  Nothing fancy or special about it, but good food.
author: Aaron M.

description: Opens at 8 am on weekends for breakfast and was warm enough today to sit outside with Sadie.  Food was average and bland, service was friendly, and prices high.
author: Esther R.

description: Not sure what's so great about this place. Bagel and cream cheese with a side of fruit for breakfast. One star for location. One star for edible food. The interior needs a makeover or some fresh paint. Service was okay, not great, not rude. Probably won't visit again. Cool pictures on the wall, and seemed to be a lively bar scene. Oh well.
author: David G.

description: The breakfast was okay- nothing to write home about. Caffe Union- a couple blocks away- is much better. I spent $50 for two of us to have breakfast and only one alcoholic drink. That's way too expensive for breakfast. The decor is neat and I got the feeling this was a regular spot for many of the customers.
author: Melinda Q.

description: ALRIGHT...yeah just alright!!  $8- you get two slidders and fries!  My cousin got the COBB salad, which looked heavenly...they even let her order a half size!  The clam chowder soup was delicious!  They offer you bread sticks ahead time, which are  light and a nice addition that you can snack on before your meal without getting too full!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: I used to live in the marina and frequented Perry's quite often.  I mainly enjoy the Monday night 1/2 off wine night. It's 1/2 price for all bottles of wine on the menu, which is amazing.  I've also had a lot of the different food options here and it's always pretty scrumptious and delightful.  The grilled ahi tuna sandwich is really good and fresh.  The tomato bisque is pretty tasty too.  Just the right consistency.  I've also had the mac and cheese and mashed potato sides.  The mac and cheese is fancy (a bit too creamy for me), and the mashed potatoes are amazing!
author: Jenny W.

description: I am not sure why the food at Perry's on Union is different from the Embarcadero location.  I am a fan of the food at Embarcadero not so much on Union street.  The calamari is not as tasty and the sliders were also not that great.  I think they should have a meeting and see what is different at the other location.  The service was great though.
author: jaylin c.

description: Ok, we went for a friend's birthday lunch and I'll give Perry's props for naming a drink after our group of friends and creating cute menus for the occasion.  I recommend the crab cakes and potato skins for appetizers; the artichoke was disappointing to the tune of it was still dirty and the dipping sauce was sub-par.  The drinks were delicious and the waitress kept them flowing, although in the 2 hours we were there I don't think she cracked a smile once.  Since it was an all-day drinkfest, most of us opted for the burger, which was delicious and cooked exactly to my specifications.  My major complaint...$28 to cut a birthday cake when our bill was already $500?  Are you serious?  It would have been great if they had made that more clear instead of the sticker shock we all had when the bill came.
author: Danielle H.

description: Having heard that it was something of a San Francisco institution, I came here for lunch when I was in the Union Street area. Sat outside, which was nice. Unfortunately my burger was the driest I can remember having anywhere. The others in my party were underwhelmed with their choices as well, and the waitress never came to ask how the meals were. Not so much as a "how was everything" when she brought the bill. I won't be going back.
author: Thomas L.

description:
This is a great "go-to" place for a drink or easy dinner on Union.  Their menu is simple but also done well for the most part.  Favorites include the tri-tip sandwich, fried chicken (I'm told) and I have had a few specials that were good.  Friendly bartenders that will remember you if you come in twice and make any drink you can think of.  

I usually stop by here with visiting friends because the bartenders are so great and we can have a relaxing drink or shot to get the night started.
author: Robert D.

description: The food is decent, but the real draw is the crowd watching.  During the afternoons, you have to be at one of the outside tables to soak up the union street scene, later in the day, bring it inside for a more laid back scene.  I have tried a few things on the menu but i usually come back to the club sandwich...  it is solid (and it comes with their tasty fries).
author: Robert R.

description: After trekking all over SF, attempting to find someting we could afford and learning about a 45 minute wait at Beetlenut, we ended up at Perry's. They were out of the fish we wanted, we ended up ordering fish and chips and french fries that dont' even compare to Mcdonald's. So, needless to say this was a huge dissapointment.
author: Srinivas R.

description: Pleasantly surprised. First thought was that I had gone back in time to those pubs from college campuses with their dark green walls, marble tables and brass everywhere. The crowd was distinctly local and casual. Most impressive thing the entire evening was the professionalism of the entire staff. wow...in SF. The menu seemed basic enough...burgers, grilled fish, quesadillas, lasagna and other pasta dishes. Everything we had was very good though maybe a bit overpriced. I didn't have complaints about noise and that can be a pet peeve of mine. Maybe there were no screamers that night.
author: Monster B.

description: You know for a place not really known for its food this place is a really pretty good. I usually go for the chopped salad. Its very good. Brunch on a sunday is great as well. A good SF standard that you should keep in your back pocket when you want to break up your routine...
author: Not M.

description: Union Street meets 3rd Avenue NYC.  Not a bad place to grab a drink and burger, espeically when you look at your other options.  It's a nice in-between place on Union.  Not sure I'll be back any time soon, but then again I'm on a mission to hit every stinking place in this city.
author: George K.

description: Most of the menu is just ok, but this place is a SF institution.  Three of my favorite things in the world are Perry's breadsticks, coffee, and chopped salad with salami!!
author: Mary S.

description: Had dinner here and it was ok. Nothing that stands out to make it great. If you're just looking for something to fill your belly it's fine.  Service was good. Environment was good.
author: Lisa C.

description: I've been to Perry's a few times..and the atmosphere is great (love the checkered tableclothes and pictures on the walls) but the food has never blown me away. The italian omelette is strictly ok, although the portion is huge. The corned beef hash is pretty good. The meatloaf is nothing compared to my mom's. The service is pretty good though, for example this morning the waiter kept putting a new lemon on my iced tea every time he gave me a refill. A pretty good place to go on a date or brunch with friends, but wouldn't be my first choice for either if I had my way.
author: Ashley B.

description:
I am new to yelp and this is my first review. Last week on Saturday night I went to Perry's for the 3rd time and it seems it just keeps getting better! 

Me and my friends arrived at a late hour with a group of 15 and the two hostesses were very sweet and acomidating (not to mention HOT!). There were people throughout the whole restaurant and it seemed these girls were doing a bit of everything, bussing tables, running food, and seating the wait list tey had going on! They acted as if they were expecting us and had us sat within minutes!

Our waitress was very funny and so nice. She was attentive but not annoying. I know we had stopped her from getting off of her shift, but she acted as if it was no problem at all. (mind you we were a party of 15! that takes about 3 hours to eat and it was already 10:00pm!) 

The food was amazing as usuall. The chopped salami salad is something ive never tasted before, AMAZING! My friend had the burger and has gone back to pick it up as take out 3 times! The seared ahi was amazing, the calamari was good but a little too much breading. The potate skins were delicious. But the to best things I think were the pot roast dinner my giflfriend had, and the steak sandwhich I had. Both were to die for. The steack sandwich is made with tenderloin steak over a portableo mushroom and grilled onions on an open faced grilled garlic bread! The pot roast was sooo delicious and the best comfort food I've had in a while.

The atmosphere at Perrys is always laid back and fun. The staff know most of the customers well and it truly seems like a real life Cheers. 

I will deffinatly be coming back, probably more than I even anticipate
author: kris j.

description:
I like Perry's. I've been here a couple of times for breakfast and enjoyed everything I had both times. The people I went with seemed to enjoy what they ate as well. I didn't didn't give it a higher rating because there was nothing too special about the food and the atmosphere was lacking but it's a good place to go with a group to grab some food and kickback and relax on a Saturday or Sunday morning. 

There is also a bar area which I have not hung-out in so that is not included when considering this review.
author: Yelper S F.

description: pretty nice bar. though i didn't fit into all all white crowd, i wasn't bothered. money talks, i quess.
author: Victor G.

description: Everyone is entitled to his (or her) own opinion, but personally, I love Perry's. The service is a little better (as in, perfect) on the weekdays, but occasionally I'll suffer the weekend crowds for a good Cobb.
author: Scott W.

description: Went here for Sunday brunch. This atmosphere reminds of Manhattan NY. The food was decent quality and they had the standard breakfast fare. I had the vegetarian fritata and my date had the corned beef hash. The corned beef hash was a little different as it had chunks of pastrami like meat.
author: Ginny M.

description: We rarely find ourselves in the Marina, as it remains extremely geographically undesirable for those of us who live on the 280 corridor, but here we were on a Friday eve in need of a simple but tasty meal.  As it turns out, Perry's filled the bill.  We were seated quickly and pleasantly, and our server couldnt have been more pleasant and attentive. He even asks our OK before changing the game on the TV. A perfectly cooked burger and some tasty baked ziti left us both satisfied. The fact the Giants actually won the game didnt hurt. Should we find ourselves in the Marina again, will definitely return.
author: Tom C.

description: Cool atmosphere.  It is kind of like a bar kind of like a restaurant.  A good place to sit outside for brunch or a midday meal.  If you are chillin outside, expect to run into someone you know because this is high scenery area.  Don't go here to be surreptitious.  Don't go here to spy.  Eat some food and chill outside.  Sandwiches and salads are good.  Towards the end of the day you can sit at the bar and have a glass of wine on a cooler evening.
author: apple r.

description: I've been to Perry's for brunch and remember enjoying the eggs benedict and mimosas. Recently went to Perry's for dinner and was completely unimpressed. Service was below average. The burger was nothing special. The only thing that saved this meal was the strong martini.
author: Lauren Y.

description: If I want to go watch sports games and eat decent food, I like to go to Perry's while I am in San Francisco. It's not ridiculously loud like at Bayside, there are comfortable places to sit, and the food is pretty good. Beware of their Bloody Mary's though- they are super spicy!!!
author: Anna S.

description: A few steps above TGI Fridays, but generally the same feeling. Was originally a sort of Preppy outpost in SF. Over the years the restaurant has gotten better or worse. Food is very appropriate for the meat and potatoes-type.
author: Michael B.

description: Sorry kids but the food sucks here, the only redeeming thing about the place is half price bottles of wine on Mondays.  Take advantage.
author: Dave K.

description: We come here quite often for weeknight dinners mainly because it's so casual and convenient.  Depending on my mood and hunger level, the food can go either way.  Sometimes I really enjoy what I'm eating, sometimes it's just eh.  It's not cheap, so I do struggle with that.... a house salad and bowl of clam chowder - that'll set you back about sixteen bones.  One thing that has been consistent is the excellent service from the hostess and most of the servers.  Oh yeah, and the Wednesday night special of corned beef and cabbage is pretty damn good.
author: Lisa C.

description: I'm only giving it 3 stars because I love potato skins so much and theirs were pretty tasty.  Other than that, it's pretty mediocre.  Nothing really stands out, but nothing was bad either.  Good location though.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Good place to unwind on Sundays. Brunch, Appetizers, glass of wine...sit outside if it's nice and enjoy Union Street. Potatoe Skins and the Salads were yummy!
author: Meredith A.

description: Good food and an A-OK atmosphere. Went there for dinner and had the calamari which was good.  The outdoor tables are great though when it's nice outside and good for people watching. Not an 'out of this world' place but I would definitely recommend it for lunch or brunch.
author: Courtney M.

description:
had a drink or two here on a couple of occasions and stopped by for brunch before watching a football game down the street.  it was a nice omelet, hearty, big, generous portion...but nothing too spectacular or that really sticks out.

a nice place tho...definitely a place i'd hit up if anyone was inclined to head there...but dunno if i would prompt anyone to head up there.
author: Looey P.

description: Went there for dinner a while back. It seemed to be okay ... a typical sports bar, but from the outside, it looks like a nice, expensive restaurant. It's a nice atmosphere without terribly loud music. We watched the Miami / Detroit basketball game while we were there. I had a Long Island Ice tea that got me a little buzzed when I first got there, so I don't think that I got the best food experience while there. It's rated pretty highly with other people's reviews though. I think it's definitely worth going to again.
author: Alton Y.

description:
eh, totally unimpressed.

i wouldn't discourage anyone from going, i mean... it is a sf staple for something... right?

part pub/sports bar but with through the roof prices on food.
bland, uninspired food.
nice ambiance and enviornment, but for me food comes first. *oink*
author: Ge O.

description: I didn't have a terrible time but this place is lame.  Our waiter looked like Rob Schneider and everytime he started on one of his insincerely delivered officious spiels, I could only hear the Copymeister.
author: Yen P.

description:
don't go there for the food-- that was my bad!

their bloody mary's were perfectly spicy!
author: J D.

description: Why is everyone so down on Perry's? They have really good grilled cheese and fries and nice outside seating. That's enough  to make me come back!
author: Carson H.

description: I went here for brunch with the girls.  It's awesome!  I had blueberry pancakes and they were fluffy and yummy.  The service was good.  I will go back.  I was lucky to get street parking and boy did I work off those pancakes when I had to hike up the one block to my car.  I love this area, all the good stores and restaurants.
author: Sonya T.

description: The place is a lot bigger than I thought, especially since we walked all the way to the back for our seating.  Food is ok, but not that much.  The side of mashed potatoes were a little too dry.  The mac and cheese looked too fake and artificial.  The clam chowder soup was alright, maybe the best.  Ok so it's not a rating of their entire menu, but there's really no point because nothing on the menu seemed too appetizing (proof point in the meat loaf).  At least our waitress was nice.
author: Yosie G.

description: I went there over the weekend. On a Saturday night, the place was surprising "not crowded" for a restaurant on Union. The food is typical... which is disappointing because the cheeseburger was futured on a magazine. The service was ok. I'd save the $ and go somewhere else. However, if you are looking to hang out, this is a good spot to drink and enjoy people watching during a warm night.
author: Emily Y.

description: Traditional style American bar/retaurant. Quite small with a great deal on Tuesdays of all bottled wine at half price (pretty expensive at other times). Decent food, pleasant atmosphere.
author: marsdenbel

description: The brunch is alright. The menu has all the typical brunch items, and it seems like a good place to go with the family. It also has a full bar, so if you want to get tipsy on a Saturday afternoon and don't know where to go, go to Perry's. Just don't order its orange juice because it's not fresh-squeezed.
author: Kelly G.

description:
grew up loving this place, spent birthdays here and such...
food was always good....

but have you checked the sf's restaurant ratings site? Yiksies!!!!

my opinion just went down the tubes...
now it makes me happy to see all the frat boys and yupps scarfing down their brunch...at least the alcohol will kill the bacteria:)
author: carolyn h.

description:
My buddy and I had dinner here tonight.  I like the changes they made to the tv screens so that you can watch all the sports (tonight was the lakers game and the giants game) from any angle.

I had the big wedge salad and the macaroni and cheese which were both good.  The bartender that helped us out was great.  It wasn't crowded even though all of the other places on Union Street were.
author: Brian L.

description: Great food for the price on Union Street.  My favorite on the menu is the steak sandwich, but I am usually happy when I try something different.  The staff is generally very friendly.  I have typically found the place not to be too crowded -- but just enough to give it some "atmosphere."
author: Brian D.

description: A classic joint turned up the notch a bit.  Great for brunch (with Bloody's of course) and catching a game. They also accommodate for your team - that is if you have good taste in teams.  It is a fun spot for a night cap as well - they have some great bartenders, especially Bill - he is good for a laugh or two.  Check out one of the photos to the left of the bar on the wall in the red picture frame - you will get a kick out of it.
author: Catherine B.

description: Okay food; nothing really spectacular though.  I ordered a salad that did the job.  One great thing about Perry's is that on a certain night (Monday or Tuesday, I think?) they have 1/2 price bottles of wine.  Now that's a good hook!
author: Sarah F.

description: Stopped in last night with 8 friends for dinner.  The beer was flowing and over all had a good time. We had a selection of apps, the ribs were the best by far and for dinner I had fried chicken; it was good but not the best I have ever had.  One downer for me was a cockroach fell from the roof onto my head then on to my arm... then brushed off onto the floor all while I was eating.  yuck...
author: Brian K.

description:
Banned for life!

I was there yesterday and I couldn't wait to blast this place on Yelp. I forgot that I had my Pretty Woman moment there. You know, when she walks into a store on Rodeo Drive, and the sales woman says, "We don't have your size!" 

A while ago I was looking for a dress on Union St. and my friends and I decided to have lunch. It was early in the day on a random Wednesday. We decided to go to Perry's on Union. The waiter/ host an older bald, mennie said if we wanted to have lunch we could sit in the back!
 
The back! There was no one in the restaurant! There were tables outside and it was such a nice day we thought we could sit outside. He said they were "reserved", and then continues to put reserve signs on all the tables outside. Disgusted, we left!

Flash forward to yesterday.

I was on my way to work on Union St. and my friend wanted to meet for lunch, I was thinking Jovino, La Boulange, or even Jamba Juice, she wanted something more substantial. Alright it's a nice day, let's go to Perry's. The host was nice and sat us in the front section of the restaurant. It was almost full. The coveted sidewalk tables were all full. I forgot about my whole Pretty Woman moment. 

The waitress a chunky, blonde woman, dress like she just rolled off of bed and put her hair in a bun took our order. My friend wanted wine but wasn't sure of what kind she wanted. The waitress did not make any suggestions and hovered over us, annoyed that she didn't know what wine to get. Suggestion to the waitress: put in our order and come back when she decides which wine! Anyways, we order a Chinese chicken salad and sliders: mini cheese burgers. The salad came out first, good, big proportions. Then I noticed everyone else had bread stick on their tables and we had none. I didn't want any, but still annoyed we weren't asked. Finished with our salad the slides came out, looking cute and delicious! I asked for them to be cooked medium-well and I had two bites and the middle was frozen and rare. Gross! Do they use frozen patties? That ruined our appetite. I told the waitress and she was annoyed. No lady, and calling her a lady is being kind, send this back and make them well done, at least not rare frozen in the middle. Gross! I had to say it again.  She took the plate. 
My friend told me she was very rude and was thinking she should call the manager. Oh yeah, it's all coming back to me now. I personally banned this place! Why did I come here?! I am not coming back and telling everyone not to too!

She changed her attitude a little when she heard my friend was thinking to speak with the manager. She also tried to charge us twice for the burgers. 

My friend says they are racist, because we were Asian and Latin. But I say Perry, get a new staff and you'll never see me again. 

Banned for life!
author: Melisa O.

description: Good spot for brunch.  The corned beef hash is excellent.  And everything is reasonably priced.
author: Trevor T.

description:
i don't know why i like it here so much.  it's not a hang out place with friends, more of a day date place.  i like the bartenders and the atmosphere.  i really like the checkered tables and the breadsticks.  my waiter has always been on the ball and funny..damn i forgot his name.  it's a cute place to have wine or a cocktail with a cute guy.  

Food:  has good reubens
Drinks:  decent price
Crowd:  old like actual old couples
Music:  none?  i have no idea
author: Ann M.

description: I'll take this place in a pinch, but there are much better spots on Union St.  They are overpriced for the type of food you get.  And the place always smells musty to me.
author: Kara F.

description: We went for our office holiday party.  It was ok.  I thought the salad was really oily, but, the steak was good.  The wine was good too.  Atmosphere was nice and the waitress was kind.  I'd probably go back.  It just wasn't that exciting though.
author: Noneya B.

description: I am surprised to see so many negative reviews of Perry's. This place is just a San Francisco treat in my opinion.  I have always had a great experience here. Food people and service! Perry's reminds me of that next door neighbor you just dream to have. Warm unassuming and just plain friendly without expectations. This place rocks!
author: kerry L.

description: Perry's could be the great American restaurant, but it comes up a little short in taste and a little heavy on the pocketbook.  I still like the energy and the emotion of the place though.
author: Dave M.

description:
I wish I could have it everyday, but the cheeseburger is one of the best I have every had, and I am a connoisseur o cheeseburgers.  With the homemade potato chips that they have it is the best lunch around.

I have yet to be disappointed with anything that they have served.
author: Dustin W.

description: All American restaurant with pretty good food.  If you like chicken wings be sure to order a batch - tres good here!
author: S A.

description: For a "historical" San Francisco restaurant this place has pretty lousy food.  I find this place only so-so for cocktails as the last time I had a martini here there were huge chucks of ice floating in my glass.  The service is not so great either,  it seems way too lax for a place that should be pulling in lots of the lunch and after work crowd.  Even when I went for a late lunch, when there was hardly anyone around, it seemed to take quite awhile to get a menu and my drink order in.  I was told by the bartender that the calamari was excellent....no lie it was the worst calamari I've ever had.  There are so many other places around the area that are head and shoulders above this one.  Unfortunately the quality of this place reminds me of a tourist trap Pier 39 kind of deal....wish it wasn't so cause I love the location and the history.
author: Sean M.

description: Good place to grab brunch and there is rarely a long wait.  The food here is okay, and good for people like me that actually prefer a lunch menu when eating brunch.  Nothing really stands out as a stellar item on the menu and it's your typical brunch fare.
author: Robyn S.

description:
Half price bottles of wine on Monday = five stars.
Service = five stars, as the waitress was nice and the bartender is always available to banter about sports, the weather, and even my personal problems.
Food=three to four stars depending on what you order. I personally recommend their burgers or the reuben sandwich.

A place that fills up with a mixed crowd of twenty somethings for beer and older people for a real meal. I had to say that I was quite impressed by the way that Perry's made everyone feel at home.
author: Charles T.

description: Had a yummy Vegetarian Garden Burger (on wheat BUN!) and the breadsticks they give while you wait for your meal is great! :) a friend tried the Grilled Ahi sandwich and she lurved it too!
author: Rv G.

description: I have been to Perry's several times. The only 2 things on the menu I have tried are the chicken quesadilla and the pot roast with mashed potatoes. They were both so yummy! Highly recommended!
author: Mel C.

description: I was kind of surprised to find a place with such a low key vibe among all of the fashion boutiques and young and upwardly mobile people traipsing along in the middle of the day.  Have you no jobs people!  I was off that day if your wondering.  But back to Perry's.  The greeter guy with the raspy voice spent a good 10 minutes answering my questions about the menu and suggesting his favorite dishes and I thank him for steering me away from the friend chicken and talking up the pot roast, which I ended up ordering.  It was tasty, but from the previous review, I consumed a half a stick of butter and didn't even know it....oh my!  I was also entertained by some guy and his two grandaughters visiting from England while he sang "Lets Call The Whole Thing Off" twice, purely for the girl's entertainment.  Any other time I would have been annoyed, but it was all in good fun.  The waitstaff chatted it up with some locals/regulars at the bar and overall everything just felt laid back.  Even though the Pot Roast set me back $17, there were some cheaper menu options that I'll try next time when I'm in the mood for some lighter fare.
author: LaSha G.

description: the food here is pretty good. i sat next to a table full of douchebags. i was in the marina, so i wasn't surprised.
author: Irene S.

description: ok so my boyfriend and I used to love this place, he has been going here with his family since he was a kid but lately they have really been slipping. We met some friends there for a weekend lunch and expected it to be busy. We didn't have to wait too long to be seated but then we preceded to wait 20 minutes before anyone even came to give us drinks and then another 20 before we could order our food. The place was somewhat busy but not as bad as most weekends. It was simple lunch fare, sandwiches and salads, nothing that should take more than 15 minutes and yet we didn't get our food until 40 minutes later. The food itself is quite good, their french onion soup with a HUGE slab of cheese is delicious but its quite pricey. Granted it is on union I don't want to spend $20 on a salad that I can make at home and I have to wait 40 minutes to receive. Unfortunately Perry's has dropped off our list, I cant recommend it anymore.
author: Meg L.

description: one of those classic sf eateries. consistently good hearty burger/salad type food. i haven't been in a while, but this used to be my go-to restaurant when the marin one was open.
author: lisa w.

description: I'm still not a big fan of the Marina, but the amazing Mac and Cheese at Perry's definitely helps the situation...a lot. After watching the Blue Angles on a less-than-stable roof and crawling around in pure darkness in the Tactile Dome at the Exploratorium, I met up with some friends for dinner and drinks in the Marina. I was kind of in a bad mood because I couldn't find bus stops where I needed them to be and I was bitter about the carload of boys in pink collard shirts yelling into my ear like hyenas as they drove by. My friends chose to eat at Perry's, which I knew about because last year I wrote an article featuring Perry's 25th(30th???) anniversary. I was actually excited to try it out. Although I wasn't that hungry because I had eaten an $8 sandwich at the Exploratorium, I ordered the Mac and Cheese and boy did that cheer me up. I seriously went from surly chick with the black hair that doesn't fit in, in the Marina to happiest chick ever, consuming mass quantities of melted cheese. Our waitress was super sweet and patient (which was a necessity seeing that I was with five other drunk and semi-obnoxious diners. The service was a little slow, but because I wasn't that hungry, I didn't hold it against them. Good, solid home cooking, and it boosts the Marina up to three stars in my book.
author: Sammy S.

description: I've been here twice. The first time I had brunch and it was decent, about 3 stars.  The second time was during the Union Street Fair and they get 1 (if not Zero) stars.  A friend of mine asked my husband and I to meet her there, which we did. She had a seat on the sidewalk. As we stood next to her table chatting, we were asked by a very nice man to have a seat, as they were trying to avoid people standing in that area. Fine. He couldn't get us anymore chairs, but suggested we ask a neighboring table for a couple, which we did. The folks at that table advised that they'd be leaving in 2-3 minutes. We got a few drinks at the bar while we waited.  As they stood to leave, my husband stood up to grab a chair (as we'd been TOLD to do) and ANOTHER completely RUDE alleged manager told him that he couldn't have the chair. My husband and I told him that we'd been told by another employee that we could take a chair. The manager said "Just leave." I swear. I'm not making this up. We both had full beers and he told us to sit them down and leave.  WHAT?!  Needless to say, we will never go back.  I've never experienced such utter disdain for customer service. We later found out that it was due to the fact that they had a list of people waiting, which is fine, but TELL US THAT. Don't just rudely tell us to leave.  What a jerk.
author: Brandy S.

description: Wow! This was one of the worst dining experiences I have had in ages.  It all started with my need for a hamburger.  Barney's are usually raw and yucky (but that is a totally separate review) so we decided to give Perry's a try.  I had wanted to go after the role they played in my current favorite books "Tales of the City".  The atmosphere was cute and historic SF.  We sat in the back in I supposed the atrium.  I turned into an icicle and people kept running into my table.  After my 2 friends and I each ordered a burger it took over an hour and a half for our food to arrive.  All of the tables around us that arrived after we did had eaten their meals and left before ours even arrived!  My friend asked for a medium burger and hers came out raw.  She sent it back.  When the bill finally arrived we had been charged for each refill we ordered during the hour and a half of waiting for our food.  The whole experience was ridiculous.  I won't be back.
author: Shannon B.

description: I wish I could give it a zero.  While ambiance, tasty food, service are the classic criteria by which I would rank a place like Perry's, there is one category that trumps all of these--FOOD SAFETY.  My boyfriend and I were at Perry's Saturday with a group of six.  Two of the guests (including my BF) had a "Bull Shot" which is a cocktail that contains vodka, celery salt and beef stock.  It sounds nasty but doesn't taste half bad, if perhaps a bit salty.  Here's the catch - the beef stock was from a tin can left unrefrigerated on the bar.  The two guys who had the bull shot got food poisoning a few hours later and spent the afternoon and evening curled up in the bathroom.  Now for those doubts out there let me add that neither guy was simply drunk-these guys were relatively sober and these two can hold their own with the best of 'em.  Perry's needs to keep their food costs down, but for letting the beef broth sit out like auger on a petri dish--there is no excuse.
author: Brianne K.

description: My Buddy's love this place! Its great for bar food but anything else is not so good. Drink here and be merry but dont expect good food.
author: Tod B.

description: The food at the Union St. location is pretty good, but stay away from the financial district spot. Not nearly as good, no outside tables and no sliders. Not nearly as good.
author: Pfeif E.

description: it looks like it would be nicer than it is. and it is priced as though it should be. i had the spinach salad today for lunch. ehhh. lots of old white guys having lunch on union and woman who lunch. the waitress was sweet and my water was always filled, but i won't be back. if i'm gonna eat an overpriced lunch on union and be surrounded by snobs there are tastier places to eat.
author: Samantha G.

description: not bad - i didnt have to wait when going there for dinner on a saturday night, but the food wasnt anything too special.  i had the fried chicken - huge serving, good veggies.  the cheesecake for dessert was delicious i thought!  i have heard good things about brunch at perry's but cant say that i have ever been.
author: Carolyn B.

description: this place was pretty empty on a fri night on union st.  we got here close to 9 pm and was able to get seated at the bar area right away.  i had an ahi burger, which was one of the specials, and it came w/ a choice of side salad, fries, or chips. for $13.95, it's a deal, altho it wasn't the highest quality ahi or anything, since it was all mashed, as opposed to an ahi steak.
author: Helen T.

description: Came here on a weeknight and it was ok. Food was nothing spectacular, and the crowd was definitely not interesting (aka not Mamacita or Balboa Cafe). Give couple stars to service and a convenient location.
author: Dom C.

description: I really dig Perry's on Union.  It's simple and straightforward, but for that, consistent and reliable.  For years, I've brought family and friends here for lunch and dinner.  But recently, I've begun to spend a solo hour at the bar most Sunday nights.  I usually bring the paper and order a glass of wine as part of my "weekend wind down."  The bar staff is always friendly and hospitable, but they also leave me alone as I read the paper.  I wouldn't take a date here.  But for old-school ambiance and a warm and welcoming crowd that reminds me of my days at Dartmouth (this place is, after all, owned by a Dartmouth grad), it's pretty close to perfect.  Just loud enough to feel fun, but quiet enough that it offers a mellow escape from the world.
author: Mike H.

description: Enjoyed a nice lunch on the sidewalk patio today.  I had a classic spinach salad with chicken, apples, walnuts and goat cheese, which was perfect.  Good size and fresh ingredients.   The menu offers a large selection of simple and traditional meals.  Friendly service.
author: Katherine D.

description:
this is probably a 3.5 for us.

it's true that it's pricey, but the food we had was good.

i had a veggie burger (comes with a side salad) and my husband had a chicken enchilada.  veggie burger was excellent; enchilada was pretty good.  

service was good.  they were welcoming to our toddler, whom they had a high-chair for.  menu appeared to have a good selection.  

it seemed like a solid bet.  it's not earth-shatteringly good, but it's certainly tasty and if we were back in the neighbourhood we'd go back.
author: Elmo G.

description: good brunch spot , can't go wrong w/brunch food.  parking is always a challenge w/this area, but the garage across the street wins kudos for me w/convenience.
author: Nana S.

description: Its one of those places you wish you can give a better review. Food is below average. Service is extremely friendly, but uneven in practice. The best way to put it is that there is no difference between the one at SFO in Terminal One - Delta/Northwest wing and Union Street, other than SFO having much faster service.
author: Joseph S.

description: Food was decent, atmosphere was decent, thought the barred-off section made me feel caged. Service was decent at the table, but the long-time over-the-hill blonde hostess had mad attitude and was obviously drunk. -2 stars for her.
author: Matt G.

description: I live a few blocks away, so I frequent Perry's.  The food is good.  It's perfect for a casual, easy meal.  I love the ahi starter.  They used to have a fabulous ahi salad too, but it was taken off the menu in 2006 - bummer!  My other menu favorites include the ahi sandwich, spinach salad, burger/sliders, french onion soup and the cobb.  The fries are possibly my favorite fries, ever.  Brunch has some tasty dishes too.  The bar is lively and fun in the evenings/night.  And on a warm day, outdoor seating is awesome.
author: Katie M.

description: Friendly service, cold drinks and tasty food, whether for brunch or dinner.  They make a mean pancake, a great burger and awesome potato skins.  They also catered my friend's New Year's Eve party.  Usually crowded and sometimes extremely loud, it is nonetheless an ideal neighborhood restaurant for a good quick meal with friends.
author: Michael C.

description: I love Perry's. Good food, great drinks, better people. Day, night, brunch, dinner this is a fun place to go with friends relax and get a bite to eat.
author: Geoffrey V.

description: I had brunch at Perry's yesterday. I heard from many friends that the brunch was totally out of this world, so I thought that I would check it out. I would say that it was not out of this world. I ordered a omelette and it was so cold that I sent it back. When it came back it was only re-heated and it was still cold. I was a little upset at that. The services was sub-par. I did enjoy the mimosas. I probably will not be coming back to brunch here.
author: Cortney H.

description: Great neighborhood spot with solid food, great bartenders, attentive service overall and a fun atmosphere.  They're not trying to wow you with five star food, but you get a good meal (nice portion size) and have a good time.  Great brunch on Saturday and Sunday too.
author: Kevin C.

description: Perry's is the place I go to for all sorts of reasons.  The brunch after a long weekend night is the only cure I have found for a hangover!  It's the best place to watch a football game with a couple of friends.  Get the buffallo wings, they are the right kinda spicy!  Perry's is cozy on a cold SF day and it's essential to eat outside on a sunny one.  Best thing about Perry's is that it truly feels like a family run establishment.  At any given time of the day, you will see Perry meeting and greeting patrons.  His son is a member of the ever-entertaining bartending team.   Perry's is a place where you just can't help coming back to.
author: K G.

description: I always feel right at home here- whether I'm having Sunday brunch, a middle of the week happy hour, or just want to watch a good football game, Perry's is the place I like to go! It's casual, friendly, and exudes that San Francisco charm.
author: Amy S.

description: The quality of the food is so inconsistent that it makes it difficult to give Perry's a good rating. What is wrong with their cooks? How difficult it is to make a club sandwich or cobb salad?
author: Samuel M.

description: Only good thing about the place was the great service and Bloody Mary's. The awsome (and hot) waitress who was really really on top of things is now gone. No reason to ever go back. Bad move
author: Patrick C.

description: Ahhhh...Perry's....I come here for the all-american prep school ambiance, with just a wiff of that ethnic white je-ne-sais-quoi thrown in for flavor. Its the kind of place my heavily-accented father would have been comfortable taking me in honor of some life milestone or other. Once seated, I'm in the company of polo-shirted men, half of who are nicknamed "Biff" or "Teddy." They are usually having an early dinner with their rakishly dressed wives, exuding an insouciance that simply cannot be learned after a certain age.  Me? I'm not worried; I've got my sperry topsiders (inherited from older brother of course) and my seer-sucker button-down with the sleeves rolled up. Hell, I've even summered in Nantucket since I was old enough to trim a foresail. In any case, I always order the fish n' chips, inevitably request extra malt vinegar, and end up tipping the old man serving me more than I planned---mostly because I suspect he trimmed some vowels from his name just to land the job.
author: Veljko S.

description: this place is pretty safe. you can pretty much get anything to satisfy anyone. i like sitting outside on a nice day.  brunch of lunch is fun. i usually go for the burgers.
author: Miss O.

description: Perry's was mediocre. Went there for breakfast on a Tuesday morning and the place was DEAD! Which was completely understandable because nothing on union st was really open except the Starbucks and Jamba Juice. But there was only one other party there so...that might have taken away from the atmosphere. Anyways, the food was ok. I got the french toast and my bf got the mexican omelet. I had 5 triangles (so 2 1/2 pieces of bread) of French Toast and a cup of syrup. The french toast was ok. The bread was super thin (like the kind you buy at the grocery store to make homemade sandwiches) so that was a little disappointing. But I didnt finish it anyways so why complain? My bf's meal looked much better. The mexican omelet was HUGE and came with toast and potatoes. The potatoes looked delicious although I did not try them. He definetely got his money's worth...i on the other hand felt a little jipped. I left the restaurant satisfied but I would have much rather hit up Polkers on Polk St. since its closer and the same price. They did however give me fresh fruit on my french toast (i asked for it) and did not charge me. Granted it was no more than one strawberry chopped up...most places would have charged a few bucks!
author: Sarah I.
